128.Safi Kaskas: Has it not become clear to them how many generations We destroyed before them, in whose ruined dwellings they now walk? There are signs in this for those with understanding.

129.Safi Kaskas: And were it not for a prior word from your Lord, setting an appointed term, [their punishment] would necessarily have come immediately.

130.Safi Kaskas: So [Prophet] be patient with what they say and exalt your Lord's limitless glory and praise Him before the rising of the sun and before its setting; and exalt His limitless glory during periods of the night and the day, so that you may be content.

131.Safi Kaskas: And do not gaze longingly toward what We have given some of them to enjoy, [it is merely] the splendor of worldly life by which We test them, but the provision of your Lord is better and more enduring.

132.Safi Kaskas: Order your people to pray and be steadfast yourself. We are not asking you for provision; We provide for you, and the [best] end [comes through] being mindful of God.

133.Safi Kaskas: And they say, "If he would only bring us a sign from his Lord?" Has not clear evidence come to them in the earlier texts?

134.Safi Kaskas: And if We had destroyed them with a punishment before this, they would have said, "Our Lord, if You had only sent us a messenger, we could have followed Your signs before we were humiliated and disgraced."

135.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Each is expectantly waiting; so wait with your expectations. For you will eventually know who is on the path of equity and who is rightly guided."

1.Safi Kaskas: People's reckoning draws closer, but they turn away without paying any attention.

2.Safi Kaskas: Every time a new message comes to them from their Lord, they listen to it while they play,

3.Safi Kaskas: with their hearts distracted. Those bent on wrongdoing conceal their private conversation, [saying], "Is he not [Muhammad] just a man like you? Do you succumb to magic with your eyes wide open?"

4.Safi Kaskas: He said, "My Lord knows whatever is said throughout the heaven and earth, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-knowing."

5.Safi Kaskas: But they continue to quibble, "These [revelations] are only confused dreams," or, "He has just invented it," or, "He is merely a poet." "So [they say] let him bring us a sign like those who were sent previously."

6.Safi Kaskas: We destroyed the communities before them who did not believe, so will they believe?

7.Safi Kaskas: Those We have sent before you were only men whom We inspired. So, tell those who deny the truth: "if you do not know this, ask the people of earlier revelations."

8.Safi Kaskas: And We did not give the prophets bodies that did not eat food, nor were they immortal.

9.Safi Kaskas: Then We fulfilled Our promise to them and We saved those We willed, and destroyed those who exceeded all bounds.

10.Safi Kaskas: We have sent down to you a Book containing all that you ought to bear in mind. Will you not reason, then?

11.Safi Kaskas: And how many communities of unjust people have We destroyed, raising up other people in their place?

12.Safi Kaskas: When they felt the might of Our punishment, they fled at once.

13.Safi Kaskas: "Do not flee, but return to the life of luxury you enjoyed and to your homes, so that you may be questioned."

14.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Woe to us! we were truly wrongdoers."

15.Safi Kaskas: And that cry of theirs did not cease until We made them like stubble, silent and still

16.Safi Kaskas: We did not create the heavens and the earth and all that is between them in play;

17.Safi Kaskas: had We wished for amusement, We could have found it within Ourselves- had We so willed.

18.Safi Kaskas: Instead, We hurl the Truth after falsehood, and the Truth destroys it, and it withers away. But woe to you for all your [attempts to] define [God].

19.Safi Kaskas: To Him belongs everything in the heavens and on earth. And those near Him are never too proud to worship Him, nor do they tire [of doing so].

20.Safi Kaskas: They exalt His limitless glory day and night, [and] do not grow weary.

21.Safi Kaskas: Or have they taken for themselves earthly gods who resurrect the dead?

22.Safi Kaskas: Had there been in heaven or on earth any deities other than God, they would both be ruined. But exalted be God in His limitless glory, Lord of the Throne, Who is far above anything they describe.

23.Safi Kaskas: He will not be questioned about what He does, but they will be questioned.

24.Safi Kaskas: Or have they taken gods besides Him? Say, "Produce your proof. This is the message for those with me and the message of those before me." But most of them do not know the Truth, so they turn away.

25.Safi Kaskas: We never sent any messenger before you [Prophet] without revealing to him that "There is no god except Me, so worship Me."

26.Safi Kaskas: And yet, some say, "The Merciful-to-all has taken a son!" May He be exalted in His glory! " No! They are only His honored worshipers.

27.Safi Kaskas: They do not speak before He does, and they act only on His command.

28.Safi Kaskas: He knows what is before them and what is behind them, and they cannot intercede [for anyone] except with His approval, as they are in reverent awe of Him.

29.Safi Kaskas: Where any of them say, "I am a god besides Him"- that one We would repay with Hell. This is how We repay the transgressors.

30.Safi Kaskas: Are the unbelievers not aware that the heavens and the earth were one mass before We separated them and made every living thing from water? Will they not believe, then?

31.Safi Kaskas: And We placed within the earth firmly set mountains, lest it should shake with them, and We made valleys, as roadways as roadways that they might be guided [through them]

32.Safi Kaskas: and We made the sky a protected roof, yet still, they turn away from its signs.

33.Safi Kaskas: And It is He who created the night and the day and the sun and the moon; each floating in its orbit.

34.Safi Kaskas: [Prophet] We did not grant immortality to any human being before you; so if you die, would they live forever?

35.Safi Kaskas: Every soul is bound to taste death. We test you with evil and with good as a trial and to Us you will all return.

36.Safi Kaskas: And when the unbelievers see you, they laugh at you, [saying], "Is this the one who keeps talking about your gods?" Yet when the Merciful-to-all is mentioned, they reject Him.

37.Safi Kaskas: The human being is a creature of haste. I will show you My signs soon, so do not ask Me to show them sooner.

38.Safi Kaskas: And they say, "When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are telling the truth?"

39.Safi Kaskas: If the unbelievers only knew the time when they will not be able to divert the Fire from their faces or from their backs, and they will find no help.

40.Safi Kaskas: Rather, it will come to them unexpectedly and bewilder them, and they will not be able to repel it, nor will they be reprieved.

41.Safi Kaskas: Messengers before you were also mocked, but those who mocked them were overwhelmed by the very thing they mocked.

42.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Who can protect you by night or day from the Merciful-to-all?" Yet they turn away when their Lord is mentioned.

43.Safi Kaskas: Or, do they have gods to defend them from Us? They are unable [even] to help themselves, nor can they be protected from Us?

44.Safi Kaskas: We have allowed these people and their fathers to enjoy life for a long time, until life seemed long and good to them. Do they not see how We come upon the land, eroding it from its extremities? Will they prevail then?

45.Safi Kaskas: Say: "I can only warn you through Revelation," but the deaf cannot hear the call when they are warned.

46.Safi Kaskas: Yet, if but a whiff of your Lord's punishment should touch them, they would surely say, "Woe to us!  We have been unjust."

47.Safi Kaskas: And We place the scales of justice for the Day of Resurrection, so that no soul will be wronged in the least for though there be [only] the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. It suffices that We will do the reckoning.

48.Safi Kaskas: And We gave Moses and Aaron the Furqan [a standard by which to judge right from wrong] a light and a reminder for those who are ever mindful of God-

49.Safi Kaskas: those who stand in awe of their Lord, though He is unseen, and who fear the Hour.

50.Safi Kaskas: And this [Qur'an] too is a blessed message that We have sent down. Will you then ignore it?

51.Safi Kaskas: Before [Moses] We gave Abraham sound judgment and We  knew him well,

52.Safi Kaskas: when he said to his father and his people, "What are these statues to which you are devoted?"

53.Safi Kaskas: They said, "We found our fathers worshipping them."

54.Safi Kaskas: He said, "You and your fathers have obviously gone astray."

55.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Have you come to us with the Truth, or are you playing games?"

56.Safi Kaskas: He said, "[No], rather, your Lord, who created them, is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, and I am a witness to that.

57.Safi Kaskas: And, by God, I will surely plot against your idols after You have turned your backs and gone away."

58.Safi Kaskas: So he broke them into pieces, except for the largest one among them, so that they might return to it [and question].

59.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Who has done this to our gods?  He is unjust."

60.Safi Kaskas: Some said, "We heard a young man mention them; they call him Abraham."

61.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, so that they may be witnesses."

62.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Have you done this to our gods, Abraham?"

63.Safi Kaskas: He said, "Rather, this one, the largest of them, did it, so ask them, if they are able to speak."

64.Safi Kaskas: So they turned on one another, saying, "It is you who are the unjust."

65.Safi Kaskas: Then, they reversed themselves, [saying], "You [Abraham] knew that these [idols] do not speak!"

66.Safi Kaskas: He said, "Then do you worship what does not help or harm you at all instead of God?

67.Safi Kaskas: Shame on you, and shame on what you worship instead of God. Will you not use reason then?"

68.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Burn him and support your gods-if you are to act."

69.Safi Kaskas: But We said, "Fire, be coolness and peace for Abraham."

70.Safi Kaskas: And they intended to harm him, but We made them the greatest losers.

71.Safi Kaskas: And We delivered him and Lot to the land which We had blessed for all people.

72.Safi Kaskas: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob as an additional gift, and all [of them] We made righteous.

73.Safi Kaskas: We made them leaders guiding others by Our command. And We inspired them to do good deeds, to establish prayer, and to give the purifying alms; they were our true worshippers.

74.Safi Kaskas: And to Lot We gave sound judgment and knowledge, and We saved him from the town that was committing wicked deeds.  They were evil, perverse people.

75.Safi Kaskas: And We admitted him into Our mercy. He was of the righteous.

76.Safi Kaskas: Long before that, We answered Noah when he called to Us, so We responded to him, and saved him and his family from the great calamity.

77.Safi Kaskas: And We helped him against the people who denied Our signs. They were an evil people, so We drowned them, all together.

78.Safi Kaskas: And David and Solomon, when they gave judgment concerning the field into which some people's sheep had strayed [at night]. We were witness to their judgment

79.Safi Kaskas: and We gave understanding of the case to Solomon, and to each [of them] We gave sound judgment and knowledge. And We caused the mountains and the birds to join David in extolling Our limitless glory, for We are able to do [all things].

80.Safi Kaskas: And We taught him to fashion coats of armor to protect you from your [enemy in] battle. But are you grateful?

81.Safi Kaskas: And to Solomon We subjected the wind, which aped at his command toward the land that We had blessed. It is We who have knowledge of everything.

82.Safi Kaskas: And among the [devils] rebellious creatures, who dove into the sea for him and did other work, but it was We who kept watch over them.

83.Safi Kaskas: And [mention] Job, when he cried to his Lord, "Great harm has afflicted me, and you are the Most Merciful of the Merciful."

84.Safi Kaskas: So We responded to him and removed the harm that afflicted him. And We restored his family and their like with them, as a mercy from Us and a reminder for God's worshippers.

85.Safi Kaskas: And [mention] Ishmael and Idris and Dhul-Kifl; all were all steadfast.

86.Safi Kaskas: And We admitted them into Our mercy for they were truly righteous.

87.Safi Kaskas: And [Jonah] Zun-nun, when he went off in anger and thought that We would not punish him. Then he called out from the deep darkness, "There is no God except You; May You be exalted in Your glory.  I have been among the unjust."

88.Safi Kaskas: We responded to him and saved him from his grief. This is how We save the believers.

89.Safi Kaskas: And Zechariah, when he called to his Lord, "My Lord, do not leave me childless, for you are the best of heirs."

90.Safi Kaskas: We responded to him, gave him John, and healed his wife for him. They were always eager to do good deeds, calling out to Us in hope and fear, and they humbled themselves before Us.

91.Safi Kaskas: And [mention Mary] the one who guarded her chastity. We breathed into her from Our Spirit, and made her and her son a sign for all people.

92.Safi Kaskas: This is your community, a single community [of believers], and I am your Lord, so worship Me.

93.Safi Kaskas: And [yet], they later disagreed and became divided, [but] they are all destined to return to Us.

94.Safi Kaskas: So whoever does righteous deeds while he is a believer -his effort will not be ignored, and We shall record it in his favor.

95.Safi Kaskas: No community that We have destroyed can possibly return

96.Safi Kaskas: until Gog and Magog are let loose and they rush down from the heights,

97.Safi Kaskas: Then, the true promise will approach and the eyes of the unbelievers will stare [in horror, while they say], "Woe to us; we were oblivious to this; rather, we were unjust."

98.Safi Kaskas: You and what you worship other than God are the firewood of Hell. You will be coming to it.

99.Safi Kaskas: Had these [false deities] been [actual] gods, they would not have come to it, but each one of them will stay there [in Hell] forever.

100.Safi Kaskas: In it they will be wailing and they will not be able to hear.

101.Safi Kaskas: As for those for whom We have decreed the best [reward]-they will be kept far removed from Hell.

102.Safi Kaskas: They will not hear its sound, while they abide eternally in whatever their souls desire.

103.Safi Kaskas: They will not be grieved by the greatest horror and the angels will greet them, [saying], "This is your Day which you have been promised"-

104.Safi Kaskas: the Day when We will roll up the heavens as one rolls up a written scroll. Just as We produced the first creation, [so] We will repeat it. This is a binding promise on Us.  We will do it.

105.Safi Kaskas: We have written in the Zabour [Psalms] as We did in previous Scriptures, that My righteous worshipers shall inherit the earth.

106.Safi Kaskas: Truly there is a message in this for people who worship!

107.Safi Kaskas: We have only sent you [Prophet] as a mercy to humanity.

108.Safi Kaskas: Say, "It is revealed to me that your god is but one God-so, will you be submissive to Him?"

109.Safi Kaskas: But, if they turn away, then say, "I have proclaimed the message equally to [all of] you.  And I do not know if what you have been promised is near or far.

110.Safi Kaskas: He knows what is revealed when you speak, and He knows what you conceal.

111.Safi Kaskas: For all I know [this delay in God's judgment] may be a trial for you and you will have enjoyment for a while."

112.Safi Kaskas: Say [Prophet] "My Lord, judge [between us] in Truth. Our Lord is the Merciful-to-all, the one whose help is ever sought against that which you unbelievers speak."

1.Safi Kaskas: [The Pilgrimage]O Humankind, be ever mindful of your Lord.  The tremor of the [final] Hour is a mighty thing.

2.Safi Kaskas: On the Day you see it every nursing mother will be distracted from the child she is nursing, and every pregnant woman will abort her pregnancy, and you will think that people are drunk while they are not-but God's punishment is severe

3.Safi Kaskas: Yet some people still argue about God without knowledge, following every rebellious devil

4.Safi Kaskas: who is destined to lead astray those who ally themselves with him, and guide them toward the suffering of the blazing flame.

5.Safi Kaskas: People-If you should be in doubt about the Resurrection, then [consider that] We created you from dust, then from a fertilized ovum,  then a leach like, and then a chewed morsel, differentiated and undifferentiated so We may show you [our power]. And We settle in the womb what We wish for a specified term, then We bring you forth as an infant, and then you may grow to reach maturity. And among you some will die, and some will reach the most decrepit age in which he no longer knows what he once knew. You see the earth barren, yet when We send down rain, it shakes and swells and produces every kind of beautiful plant.

6.Safi Kaskas: That is because God is the Ultimate Truth and because He alone brings the dead to life and because He is competent over all things.

7.Safi Kaskas: And [that they may know] that the Hour is coming; no doubt about it, and that God will resurrect all those in the graves.

8.Safi Kaskas: Yet among men there is he who argues about God without knowledge or guidance or an enlightening Book,

9.Safi Kaskas: turning away [from the truth] in his arrogance to lead [people] astray from the path of God. For him there is only disgrace in the world, and We will make him taste the punishment of the burning fire on the Day of Resurrection

10.Safi Kaskas: [He will be told] "This is for what you have done. God is never unfair to His servants."

11.Safi Kaskas: And among people you would find one who worships God with shaky faith. If good befalls him, he is reassured by it; but if he is tested, he reverts to his old ways, [thereby] losing both [this] world and the next. That is a manifest loss.

12.Safi Kaskas: Instead of God, he calls upon what can neither harm him nor benefit him. That is the ultimate misguidance.

13.Safi Kaskas: He calls on one who is more likely to harm than to benefit [him]. How miserable are both the protector and the companion.

14.Safi Kaskas: But God will admit those who believe and do righteous deeds to Gardens with rivers flowing through them. God does what He wills.

15.Safi Kaskas: Anyone who thinks that God will not help him [the Prophet] in this world and in the Hereafter, let him find a way to reach out to heaven, then try to make headway, and see if his scheme will eliminate what enrages him.

16.Safi Kaskas: And thus have We sent the Qur'an down as verses of clear evidence for God guides those who want to be guided.

17.Safi Kaskas: As for those who believed, the Jews, the Sabeans, the Christians, the Magians and those ascribing divinity to other than God-God will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection. God witnesses all thing

18.Safi Kaskas: Do you not see that everyone in the heavens and everyone on earth and the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, the moving creatures and many human beings bow down before God? But for many others their punishment is justified and he who is disgraced by God cannot have his honor restored by anyone. God does whatever He wills

19.Safi Kaskas: These are two adversaries who have disputed over their Lord. But the unbelievers will have cut out garments of fire cut out for them, and boiling water will be poured over their heads

20.Safi Kaskas: which will melt the contents of their bellies as well as their skin-

21.Safi Kaskas: and they shall be held by iron grips.

22.Safi Kaskas: Every time they try to escape [the fire) of it in their anguish, they will be returned to it, and [it will be said], "Taste the punishment of the Burning Fire!"

23.Safi Kaskas: As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, God will admit them to Gardens with rivers flowing through them. They will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments will be silk,

24.Safi Kaskas: for they were [willing to be] guided [in this life] to speak the best words, and so they were guided to the path that leads to Him Who is Worthy of [all] Praise.

25.Safi Kaskas: As for the unbelievers who divert [others] from the path of God and [from] the Sacred House, which We made for all People equally-[both] those who dwell there, and those who come from abroad - We will let those who desire to profane it with wrongdoing taste a painful punishment.

26.Safi Kaskas: For when We showed Abraham the site of the House, [We told him], "Do not associate anything with Me and purify My House for those who will circle around it, and those who stand to pray and those who bow down and prostrate themselves.

27.Safi Kaskas: "And proclaim the Pilgrimage to all people: they will come to you on foot and on every kind of swift and lean mount, through distant passes;

28.Safi Kaskas: so that they may receive benefits for themselves and to celebrate God's name on appointed days. He has provided [sacrificial] animals for their purposes. So eat of them and feed the miserable and poor.

29.Safi Kaskas: So let the pilgrims perform their acts of purification and fulfill their vows. And then circle around the Ancient House."

30.Safi Kaskas: All of that [has been commanded]. As for anyone who honors the sacred ordinances of God, it is good for him in the sight of his Lord. Livestock have been permitted to you, except what has been explicitly forbidden. So turn away from the filth of idols, and turn away from telling lies

31.Safi Kaskas: inclining [only] to God, not associating [anything] with Him. And he who associates others with God- it is as though he had fallen from the sky and was snatched by the birds or the wind carried him down into a remote place.

32.Safi Kaskas: Thus it is; and whoever venerates the sacred rites of God-[their acts] proceed from a pious heart.

33.Safi Kaskas: You have benefits in these animals marked for sacrifice for a specified time; then, their place of sacrifice is at the Ancient House.

34.Safi Kaskas: We have appointed a rite [of sacrifice] for every nation, so that they may mention the name of God over whatever [sacrificial] animals He has provided them. Your god is one God, so submit to Him. And, give good news to the humble of heart-

35.Safi Kaskas: those whose hearts tremble  when God is mentioned, and those who patiently persevere over what has afflicted them, and those who perform prayer and those who spend from what We have provided them.

36.Safi Kaskas: We have appointed sacrificial animals for you among the rituals of God. There is much good for you in them, so mention God's name over them when they lined up [for sacrifice], and, when they are [lifeless] on their sides, then eat from them and feed the needy and the beggar. Thus We have subjected them to you so that hopefully you may be grateful.

37.Safi Kaskas: It is neither their meat nor their blood that reaches Good: what reaches Him is your piety. Thus He has made them subject to you, so that you may glorify God for having guided you. And give good news to those who do their best at whatever they do.

38.Safi Kaskas: God will defend the believers. God does not like the treacherous and ungrateful.

39.Safi Kaskas: Permission [to fight] has been given to those against whom war is being waged wrongfully, because they were wronged. And God is surely capable of giving them victory.

40.Safi Kaskas: [They are] those who have been driven from their homes unjustly, for saying only that "Our Lord is God." And, if God did not intervene by using some people to drive out others, many monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques, where God's name is much remembered, would have been destroyed. God is sure to help those who help His cause, for truly God is strong and mighty.

41.Safi Kaskas: [And they are] those who, if We give them authority in the land, establish prayer, and give the purifying alms, and order what is obviously right, and forbid what is obviously wrong. And to God belongs the outcome of [all] matters.

42.Safi Kaskas: And if they deny you [Prophet], so, did the people of Noah and Aad and Thamud deny [their prophets],

43.Safi Kaskas: as did the people of Abraham and the people of Lot

44.Safi Kaskas: and the inhabitants of Midian. And Moses was called a liar. So, I indulged the unbelievers for a time, and then I seized them, and how [terrible] was My reproach.

45.Safi Kaskas: And how many a town did We destroy while it was committing wrong, so It is [now] fallen into ruin, and [how many] an abandoned well, and [how many] a lofty palace?

46.Safi Kaskas: Have they not traveled through the land, so that their hearts gain wisdom and their ears learn to listen? For it is not the eyes that are blind, but the hearts within the breasts.

47.Safi Kaskas: They challenge you [Prophet] to bring on their punishment [if you can]. But God will never fail to deliver His promise. A day with your Lord is like a thousand years as you count them.

48.Safi Kaskas: And how many a community did I indulge while it was unjust? Then I seized it, and   their [final] destination is up to Me.

49.Safi Kaskas: Say [Prophet) , "O People, I am sent only to deliver a clear warning to you."

50.Safi Kaskas: And those who have believed and done righteous deeds - for them is forgiveness and generous rewards.

51.Safi Kaskas: But those who oppose Our message, [seeking] in vain to cause it to fail-those are the companions of Hell.

52.Safi Kaskas: Yet, whenever We sent a messenger or a prophet ahead of you, and he was hoping [that his warning will be headed], Satan would cast [doubt] on his hopes. But God destroys that what Satan insinuates, and God confirms His messages, for God is All-Knowing and All-Wise.

53.Safi Kaskas: He makes what Satan spews forth a temptation only to those whose hearts are sick or hardened-surely the unjust are profoundly opposed to the Truth.

54.Safi Kaskas: So that those who have been given knowledge may understand that it is the Truth from your Lord and believe in Him, while their hearts humbly submit to Him. God will guide the believers to a straight path,

55.Safi Kaskas: but the unbelievers will continue to be in doubt about it until the Hour comes suddenly on them, or punishment strikes them on the Day of desolation.

56.Safi Kaskas: [All] sovereignty on that Day will belong to God; He will judge between them. So, those who believed and did righteous deeds will be in the Gardens of Delight.

57.Safi Kaskas: While the unbelievers and those who reject Our signs will receive a humiliating punishment.

58.Safi Kaskas: And those who emigrated for the cause of God and then were killed or died-God will surely provide for them handsomely, for God is surely the best of providers.

59.Safi Kaskas: He will surely admit them into a place that well pleases them, for God is All-Knowing and Forbearing.

60.Safi Kaskas: That [is so]; and whoever responds [to an act of aggression] only with an equivalent force and is then wronged again, God will surely help him.  God is pardoning and forgiving.

61.Safi Kaskas: Thus it is, because God merges the night into day and merges the day into night, and because God is All-Hearing and All-Seeing.

62.Safi Kaskas: Thus it is, because God is the Ultimate Truth, and  anything they call upon other than Him is falsehood, because God is the Most High, the Most Great.

63.Safi Kaskas: Do you not see that God has sent down rain from the sky, and then the earth becomes green? God is Most-Subtle, All-Aware.

64.Safi Kaskas: To Him belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth, God is the Rich Beyond Need; the Praiseworthy.

65.Safi Kaskas: Do you not see that God has made everything on the earth of service to you-including the ships that run through the sea by His command- and that He prevents heaven from falling on the earth without His permission?  God is most compassionate and most Merciful-to-all people.

66.Safi Kaskas: He is the One Who gave you life, and then will causes you to die, and then will bring you back to life. Human being however is ungrateful.

67.Safi Kaskas: We have appointed acts of worship for every nation, which they [are to] observe. So, let the unbelievers not contend with you over the matter, but invite them to your Lord. You are on the straight path,

68.Safi Kaskas: and if they argue with you, then say, "God knows best what you are doing.

69.Safi Kaskas: On the Day of Resurrection, God will judge between you regarding your differences."

70.Safi Kaskas: Do you not know that God knows what is in the heaven and earth? All this is written in a Record. This is easy for God.

71.Safi Kaskas: Nevertheless, they worship others besides God, something for which He has granted no authority, and about which they have no knowledge. There will not be any helper for the unjust.

72.Safi Kaskas: And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidence, you will detect disapproval in the faces of the unbelievers. They all but assault those who recite Our verses. Say, "Shall I inform you of [what is] worse than that? [It is] the Fire that God has promised the unbelievers. How miserable is their destination."

73.Safi Kaskas: People, an example is presented, so listen to it. Those you call on besides God will never be able to create [as much as] a fly, even if they all gathered together for that purpose. And if the fly robs them of anything, they will not be able to retrieve it.  How feeble are the petitioners and those they petition.

74.Safi Kaskas: They do not give God His due esteem. God is  omnipotent, almighty.

75.Safi Kaskas: God chooses messengers from among the angels and people.  God is All-Hearing and All- Seeing.

76.Safi Kaskas: He knows what lies before them and what is behind them, for all matters will go back to God.

77.Safi Kaskas: Believers: bow, and prostrate, and worship your Lord and do good, so that you may succeed.

78.Safi Kaskas: And strive for God as He deserves. He has chosen you and has not imposed hardships on you in religion- the faith of your father, Abraham. He named you "Muslims" [submitters] before [in former Books] and in this [revelation], so that the Messenger may be a witness over you, and you may be witnesses over other human beings. So, perform prayer, and give the purifying alms and hold fast to God. He is your protector, and how excellent is this protector, how excellent this helper.

1.Safi Kaskas: The believers have prospered.

2.Safi Kaskas: They are those who humble themselves in prayer,

3.Safi Kaskas: who turn away from meaningless talk,

4.Safi Kaskas: pay the purifying alms,

5.Safi Kaskas: and who protect their chastity

6.Safi Kaskas: except with their wives or with those whom their right hands held in trust, for which they will not be blamed.

7.Safi Kaskas: Those who desire anything beyond that are transgressors,

8.Safi Kaskas: whereas those who honor their trusts and their promises

9.Safi Kaskas: and who keep up their prayers,

10.Safi Kaskas: those are the inheritors

11.Safi Kaskas: who will inherit the Paradise of Ferdous, where they will dwell for eternity.

12.Safi Kaskas: And We did certainly create man from an extract of clay.

13.Safi Kaskas: and then We placed him as a fertilized ovum in a safe place,

14.Safi Kaskas: and then We transformed the fertilized ovum into a clinging leach, and the leach into a chewed morsel, and [from] the chewed morsel, We created bones, and We covered the bones with flesh, and then we structured him into yet another creation. Blessed is God, the best of creators.

15.Safi Kaskas: Then, after that, you will surely die.

16.Safi Kaskas: Then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will be resurrected.

17.Safi Kaskas: And We have created above you seven heavenly dimensions, and We have never abandoned [Our] creation.

18.Safi Kaskas: And We have sent down rain from the sky in a measured amount and we settle it into the earth, [although] We have the power to withdraw it.

19.Safi Kaskas: With [water] We bring forth gardens of palm trees, and vines with abundant fruit for you, from which you may eat,

20.Safi Kaskas: and a tree growing out of Mount Sinai that produces oil and relish for those who eat.

21.Safi Kaskas: And there is a lesson for you in livestock, we give you milk to drink from their bellies, [you derive] numerous other benefits from them: you eat [their meat]

22.Safi Kaskas: We sent Noah to his people, and he said, "My people, worship God; you have no gods before Him. Will you not be aware of Him?"

23.Safi Kaskas: and ride upon them as you do on ships.

24.Safi Kaskas: But their leaders, who were among the unbelievers from his people said, "He is but a human being like you, trying to gain dominance over you; if God had so willed, He would have sent down angels. We have never heard of anything like this from our forefathers.

25.Safi Kaskas: He is only a man possessed, so put up with him for a while, and let's see what happens to him."

26.Safi Kaskas: [Noah] said, "My Lord, help me, because they have accused me of lying."

27.Safi Kaskas: So We instructed him, "Build the Ark under Our watchful eyes and [according to] Our revelation. When Our command comes and the valley overflows, take on board pairs of every species and your family, except for those among them against whom judgment has been proclaimed. And do not plead with Me on behalf of the unjust; they will all be drowned.

28.Safi Kaskas: When you and those with you are settled on the Ark, then say, 'All praise is due to God, who has delivered us from the oppressive people.'

29.Safi Kaskas: And say, 'My Lord, let me land at a blessed landing place, as You are the best to provide.' "

30.Safi Kaskas: There are signs in all this, and We are always putting people to the test.

31.Safi Kaskas: Then, after those people, We raised up a new generation.

32.Safi Kaskas: And We sent them a messenger from among them, [saying], "Worship God for you have no god before Him. Will you not, then, be aware of Him?"

33.Safi Kaskas: But the leaders among his people, who denied the truth and denied the encounter with the Hereafter, and to whom We had given ease and plenty in this worldly, life said, "This is only a man like you, who eats what you eat and drinks what you drink

34.Safi Kaskas: and, if you should obey a human being like yourselves, you would then fail.

35.Safi Kaskas: Does he promise you that when you have died and become dust and bones that you will be brought forth [to a new life]?

36.Safi Kaskas: What You have been promised is sheer nonsense.

37.Safi Kaskas: Life is only our worldly life: we live and die, but we will not be resurrected.

38.Safi Kaskas: He is just a man who has invented a lie about God, and We will never believe him."

39.Safi Kaskas: He said, "My Lord, help me because they call me a liar."

40.Safi Kaskas: [God] said, "After a little while, they will surely regret [what they have said]."

41.Safi Kaskas: So the blast justly struck them, and We swept them away like scum. Away then with the oppressive people.

42.Safi Kaskas: After them, We gave rise to new generations.

43.Safi Kaskas: No community can speed up or hold back its appointed destiny.

44.Safi Kaskas: Then We sent Our Messengers in succession. Whenever a messenger came to a community he was invariably rejected, so We destroyed them one after the other, until they became mere tales. Away, then, with the people who do not believe

45.Safi Kaskas: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs and a clear authority

46.Safi Kaskas: to Pharaoh and his inner circle, but they were an arrogant, haughty people.

47.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Should we believe two human beings like us while their people are serving us?"

48.Safi Kaskas: So they called them both liars, and were consequently destroyed.

49.Safi Kaskas: And We gave Moses the Book so that they might be guided.

50.Safi Kaskas: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign, and sheltered them within a hill where there was a meadow and a flowing spring.

51.Safi Kaskas: [God said], "O Messengers, eat good things and do good. I know all that you do.

52.Safi Kaskas: This community of yours is one community, and I am your Lord, so be ever conscious of Me."

53.Safi Kaskas: Yet [your followers] tore their unity piece by piece, each faction rejoicing in what it has.

54.Safi Kaskas: So, leave them in their confusion for a while.

55.Safi Kaskas: Do they think that We provide them wealth and children

56.Safi Kaskas: because We rush to give them good things? No, but they are oblivious [to what is going on].

57.Safi Kaskas: Those who stand in awe of their Lord

58.Safi Kaskas: who believe in the messages of their Lord

59.Safi Kaskas: who do not associate anything with their Lord,

60.Safi Kaskas: and who give whatever they can while their hearts tremble at the thought that they will be returning to their Lord,

61.Safi Kaskas: these are the ones who vie to do good deeds, and they will be the first to attain them.

62.Safi Kaskas: We do not burden any soul with more than it can bear. There is a record with Us which speaks the Truth and they will not be treated unjustly.

63.Safi Kaskas: However, the [unbelievers'] hearts are in confusion about this [message], and they do even do worse deeds,

64.Safi Kaskas: until We bring those corrupted with opulence for punishment. Only then will they suddenly start crying [to God] for help.

65.Safi Kaskas: "Do not cry out today. You will not get any help from Us.

66.Safi Kaskas: For [every time] My verses were recited to you, you  turned away from them

67.Safi Kaskas: in arrogance, amusing yourself by talking nonsense about them far into the night."

68.Safi Kaskas: Have they not thought about what We tell them, or has something come to them that did not come to their forefathers?

69.Safi Kaskas: Or do they not recognize their messenger? Is that why they do not acknowledge him?

70.Safi Kaskas: Or do they say, "He is crazy?" when in fact he brought them the Truth. But most of them hate the Truth.

71.Safi Kaskas: If the Truth conformed to their desires, truly, the heavens, and the earth, and whoever is in them would have been corrupted.  Instead, We have given them their Reminder, but they turn away from it.

72.Safi Kaskas: Or [do they think that] you are asking them for compensation, when your Lord's compensation is best? He is the Best of Providers.

73.Safi Kaskas: You call them to a straight path,

74.Safi Kaskas: but those who do not believe in the Hereafter deviate from that path.

75.Safi Kaskas: Even if We were to show them mercy and relieve them of the harm afflicting them, they would persist in their blind transgression.

76.Safi Kaskas: Even when We afflicted them with suffering [as a warning], they did not humble themselves to their Lord, nor were they submissive,

77.Safi Kaskas: but when We open a gate of severe punishment to them, they will immediately be crushed with despair.

78.Safi Kaskas: And it is He who created your hearing and vision and hearts; how seldom are you grateful.

79.Safi Kaskas: And it is He who spread you over the earth, and to Him you will be gathered.

80.Safi Kaskas: And It is He Who gives life and causes death, and to Him is due the alternation of night and day. Will you not then use your reason?

81.Safi Kaskas: However, they are content to say what their ancestors said.

82.Safi Kaskas: They said, "When we die and become dust and bones, are we to be resurrected?

83.Safi Kaskas: We have been promised this before, and so were our forefathers. These are just ancient legends."

84.Safi Kaskas: Say, "To whom belongs the earth and all that is in it, if you know?"

85.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "To God." Say, "Then will you not take heed?"

86.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Who is Lord of the seven heavens and Lord of the Mighty Throne?"

87.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "[They belong] to God." Say, "Then will you not be mindful?"

88.Safi Kaskas: Say, "In whose hand is the dominion over all things. Who protects, while none can protect against Him, if you happen to know?"

89.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "[All belongs] to God." Say, "Then how can you be so mislead?"

90.Safi Kaskas: In fact, We have sent them the Truth, but they lie.

91.Safi Kaskas: God has not taken any son, nor has there ever been any other god but Him. [Had there been], then each god would have taken aside what it created, and sought to overcome the others. May God be exalted in His glory, far above what they ascribed to Him.

92.Safi Kaskas: The Knower of all that is beyond human's perception, as well as all that can be witnessed by humans. May He be exalted above all whom they associate with Him!

93.Safi Kaskas: Say, "My Lord, if You are going to show me what you have promised them,

94.Safi Kaskas: then, My Lord, do not place me among such unjust people."

95.Safi Kaskas: We are surely able to show you what We have promised them.

96.Safi Kaskas: Overcome evil with good- We are well aware of what they are saying.

97.Safi Kaskas: And say, "My Lord, I seek refuge in You from the incitements of the devils,

98.Safi Kaskas: and I seek refuge in You, my Lord, so they may not come near me."

99.Safi Kaskas: When death comes to one of them, he says, "My Lord, send me back

100.Safi Kaskas: so that I may  make amends for what I left undone." Never! This is but a word he is saying; for behind them there is a [dimensional) barrier until the Day when all will be resurrected!

101.Safi Kaskas: So when the Horn is blown, no ties of kinship will bind them on that Day, nor will they ask about one another.

102.Safi Kaskas: And those whose balance [of good deeds) is heavy, it is they who will be successful;

103.Safi Kaskas: but those whose balance is light, those are the ones who have lost their souls and will remain in Hell forever.

104.Safi Kaskas: The Fire will sear their faces, distorting them horribly and painfully.

105.Safi Kaskas: "Were not My verses recited to you and did you not reject them?"

106.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "Our Lord, our defiance overcame us, and we were led astray.

107.Safi Kaskas: Our Lord, get us out of here, and, if we go back to our evil ways, we would be unjust."

108.Safi Kaskas: He will say, "Remain despised where you are and do not speak to Me.

109.Safi Kaskas: Among My worshipers there were those who used to say, 'Our Lord, We have believed, so forgive us and have mercy on us, for You are the most Merciful.'

110.Safi Kaskas: But you were so preoccupied with mocking them that you forgot about Me, while you were laughing at them.

111.Safi Kaskas: I have rewarded them this Day for their patient endurance - they are the successful."

112.Safi Kaskas: He said: "How many years were you on earth?"

113.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "We were there a day or part of a day; ask those who keep track of it."

114.Safi Kaskas: He will say, "You stayed but a little, if only you had known.

115.Safi Kaskas: Did you think, then, that We created you in vain, or that you would not be returned to Us?"

116.Safi Kaskas: How sublimely exalted is God, the Ultimate Sovereign, the Ultimate Truth; there is no deity except Him, Lord of the Noble Throne of His majesty.

117.Safi Kaskas: Whoever calls another deity besides God with no evidence for its existence, then his reckoning will be with his Lord. the unbelievers will never triumph.

118.Safi Kaskas: And, say, "My Lord, forgive and have mercy; and You are the most Merciful-to-all."

1.Safi Kaskas: [This is] a chapter which We have sent down and made it obligatory, revealing clear messages so that you might take heed.

2.Safi Kaskas: The [unmarried] woman or man found guilty of adultery, lash each one of them with a hundred lashes, and do not let compassion for them prevent you from obeying God's law, if you believe in God and the Last Day. And let a group of the believers witness their punishment.

3.Safi Kaskas: The adulterer shouldn't marry except an adulteress or idolatress, and let none marry her except an adulterer or an idolater. Such behavior is forbidden to believers.

4.Safi Kaskas: And as for those who accuse a chaste women and then do not produce four witnesses, lash each with eighty lashes, and do not accept their testimony again, for they are deviators from the truth,

5.Safi Kaskas: except for those who repent later and reform, for God is most forgiving and Merciful-to-all.

6.Safi Kaskas: As for those who accuse their own wives [of adultery] and have no witnesses except themselves, let each call on God four times to witness that he is telling the truth,

7.Safi Kaskas: and the fifth [testimony will be] that the curse of God be upon him should he be lying.

8.Safi Kaskas: But she will not be punished if she gives four testimonies with God as her witness that he is lying,

9.Safi Kaskas: and the fifth [testimony will be] that the wrath of God be upon her should he be truthful.

10.Safi Kaskas: Were it not for God's favor to you and His mercy...and because God is accepting of repentance and Wise

11.Safi Kaskas: There is a group among you who spread slander. Do not think it bad for you; rather It is a good thing. Every one of them shall bear the sin that he has earned,  and he who took the greatest part in it will have a painful punishment.

12.Safi Kaskas: When you heard about it, why did the believers-men and women-not think well of one another and say "This is an obvious lie?"

13.Safi Kaskas: And why did they not produce four witnesses to it? When accusers do not produce four witnesses, then in God's sight it is they who are the liars.

14.Safi Kaskas: And had it not been for God's favor upon you and His mercy in this world and the Hereafter, you would have already been afflicted by terrible suffering for indulging in such talk.

15.Safi Kaskas: When you received it on your tongues and your mouths uttered things about which you had no knowledge, you thought it a trivial matter, while in God's sight it was most serious.

16.Safi Kaskas: And why, when you heard it, did you not say, "It does not behoove us to speak about this. May you [O God] be exalted in Your glory; this is a great slander?"

17.Safi Kaskas: God warns you never to repeat this [conduct], if you are true believers.

18.Safi Kaskas: God makes His messages clear to you, for God is All-knowing and All-Wise.

19.Safi Kaskas: Those who enjoy hearing that immorality has spread among the believers will have a painful punishment both in this world and the Hereafter. God knows and you do not.

20.Safi Kaskas: Were it not for God's favor to you and His mercy, and because God is compassionate and Merciful-to-all.

21.Safi Kaskas: Believers, do not follow Satan's footsteps, for he who follows Satan's footsteps joins immorality and wrongdoing. Were it not for God's favor to you and His mercy, not one of you would have been purified, ever, but God purifies whom He wills, for God is All-Hearing and All-Knowing.

22.Safi Kaskas: Let not those among you who possess affluence and wealth swear against giving to their relatives, the needy, and the emigrants for God's sake, but let them pardon and forgive. Would you not like for God to forgive you? God is forgiving and Merciful-to-all.

23.Safi Kaskas: Those who [falsely] accuse chaste women [who are] incautious but believing are cursed in this world and the Hereafter; they will have a great punishment

24.Safi Kaskas: on the Day when their tongues, their hands and their feet will bear witness against them regarding what they used to do.

25.Safi Kaskas: On that Day, God will pay them in full their just due, and they will know that God is the Manifest Truth.

26.Safi Kaskas: Wicked women are for wicked men, and wicked men are for wicked women. Good women are for good men, and good men are for good women. The good [men and women] are innocent of what has been said against them; they will have forgiveness and a generous provision.

27.Safi Kaskas: Believers do not enter houses other than your own until you have asked permission to do so and greeted their residents. That is best for you, so that you will be reminded [of each other's rights].

28.Safi Kaskas: And if you do not find anyone in, do not enter until permission has been granted, and, if It is said to you, "Go away," then go away. This is purer for you, for God knows well what you do.

29.Safi Kaskas: [However] there is no blame on you for entering houses not inhabited but serve a purpose useful to you. God knows what you reveal and what you conceal.

30.Safi Kaskas: Tell believing men to lower their gaze and guard their private parts. That is purer for them.  God is acquainted with what they do.

31.Safi Kaskas: And tell the believing women to lower their gaze and guard their private parts and not expose their charms, beyond what may be [acceptable to] display. Let them drape [a portion of] their head coverings over their breasts, and not reveal their charms except to their husbands, their fathers, their husbands' fathers, their sons, their husbands' sons, their brothers, their brothers' sons, their sisters' sons, their womenfolk, their slaves, or those male attendants having no sexual desire, or children who are not yet aware of women's private parts. And let them not stamp their feet to make known what they conceal of their charms. And believers-all of you-turn to God in repentance, that you may succeed.

32.Safi Kaskas: Marry off those among you who are unmarried and those who are righteous among your male and female slaves. If they should be poor, God will enrich them from His favor; God is All- Encompassing and All-Knowing.

33.Safi Kaskas: Those who are unable to marry should keep chaste until God gives them sufficiently from His favor. If any of those whom your right hands held in trust seek a contract then, draw one with them if you know there is goodness within them, and share with them the wealth that God has given you. Do not compel your girls against their will to prostitution, out of your desire for the short-term gains of this world, if they want to be married. If they however are compelled, God will be forgiving and merciful to them.

34.Safi Kaskas: We have sent down to you clarifying messages and examples from those who passed on before you, and an admonition for those who are ever mindful of God.

35.Safi Kaskas: God is the illuminator of the heavens and the earth. His light may be likened to [the light emanating from] a  niche containing a lamp that is enclosed in glass, the glass [is shining] like a brilliant star fueled from a blessed tree, an olive tree that is neither of the east nor of the west-its oil is nearly luminous even if untouched by fire. Light upon light. God guides to His enlightenment whoever wills [to be guided]. God presents such examples to people, since God [alone] has full knowledge of all things.

36.Safi Kaskas: In houses of worship that God has allowed to be raised, where His Name will be remembered and where His limitless glory is celebrated morning and evening

37.Safi Kaskas: [by] men whom neither commerce nor business can distract from the remembrance of God, performance of prayer, and the payment of the purifying alms. They fear a Day when hearts and eyes will be convulsed

38.Safi Kaskas: hoping that God may reward them according to the best of what they did, and give them more from His favor. God provides limitlessly for anyone He will.

39.Safi Kaskas: But the unbelievers, their deeds are like a mirage in a desert that the thirsty mistake for water until, when he comes to it, he finds it is nothing. Instead, he finds only God there, and God will pay him his full due, for God is quick to take account.

40.Safi Kaskas: Or [their deeds are] like darkness over a stormy sea covered by waves, over waves, over which are dark clouds, layer upon layer of darkness. If one holds out his hand, he can hardly see it. For him to whom God gives no enlightenment, there is no enlightenment.

41.Safi Kaskas: Do you not see that God's limitless glory is exalted by all in the heavens and the earth, even by the birds with wings outspread [in flight]? Each [of them] knows how to pray to and glorify [Him], and God well knows that they do.

42.Safi Kaskas: To God belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth, and to God [all things] ultimately return.

43.Safi Kaskas: Do not you see that God drives the clouds, then brings them together, and then piles them into heaps until you see rain come pouring from them? He sends down from the sky mountains [of clouds] filled with hail, striking with it whom He wills and averting it from whom He wills. The flash of its lightening almost blinds the eyes.

44.Safi Kaskas: God revolves night and day.  In [all] this is a lesson for those who are insightful.

45.Safi Kaskas: God has created every living creature from water. Some of them creep on their bellies, some walk on two legs, and some walk on four. God creates what He wills for God is surely able to do all things.

46.Safi Kaskas: We have indeed sent down messages clarifying everything. God guides to a straight path whoever wills [to be guided].

47.Safi Kaskas: Some declare, "We believed in God and the Messenger, and we obey," but then, a group of them turn away. Such people are not true believers.

48.Safi Kaskas: When they are called to God and His Messenger to judge between them, some of them turn away,

49.Safi Kaskas: but if they think that the right is on their side, they then come to him [the Prophet] in prompt obedience.

50.Safi Kaskas: Is there a sickness in their hearts? Or are they in doubt? Or do they fear that God and His Messenger will be unjust to them? Rather, it is they who are the unjust.

51.Safi Kaskas: When the believers are called to God and His Messenger to judge between them, they respond "We hear and we obey." Those are the achievers,

52.Safi Kaskas: for whoever obeys God and His Messenger, and is in awe of God and is ever mindful of Him, it is they who are the successful.

53.Safi Kaskas: [Others] solemnly swear by God that if you [Prophet] ordered them, they would go forth [in God's cause]. Say, "Do not swear. [Such] obedience is [expected].  God is well aware of all you do."

54.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Obey God and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away, he is responsible only for what he has been given to do, and you are responsible for what you have been given. If you obey him, you will be [rightly] guided, but the Messenger's duty is only to deliver the Message clearly."

55.Safi Kaskas: God has promised those among you who have believed and done righteous deeds that He will make them successors upon the earth just as He did those before them, and that He will establish for them the faith that He has chosen for them. He will exchange the fear they have experienced with security, [for] they worship Me [alone], not associating anything with Me. But whoever denies the truth after [having understood] this, then those are the defiantly disobedient.

56.Safi Kaskas: Establish prayer, and give the purifying alms, and obey the Messenger, so that you may receive mercy.

57.Safi Kaskas: Do not even think that the unbelievers can ever escape God on earth. Their refuge will be the Fire. What an evil destination.

58.Safi Kaskas: Believers, let your slaves and those who have not [yet] reached puberty among you ask permission of you [before entering your presence] at three times of the day: before the dawn prayer, and when you take off your clothing [for rest] at noon, and after the evening prayer. [These are] three times of privacy for you. At other times, there is no blame on you or them if you move about freely, tending to each other's needs. In this way does God make the message clear to you, for God is All-Knowing and All-Wise.

59.Safi Kaskas: And when your children reach puberty, let them ask your permission to enter, just as those before them have done. In this way God makes His messages clear to you, for God is All-Knowing and All-Wise.

60.Safi Kaskas: As for elderly women who have no desire to marry-there is no blame upon them if they remove their outer garments without displaying their charms, but, to modestly refrain [from that] is better for them, for God is All-Hearing and All-Knowing.

61.Safi Kaskas: There is not any restriction on the blind, the lame, the ill or yourselves when you eat from your [own] houses or the houses of your fathers, your mothers, your brothers, your sisters, your father's brothers, your father's sisters, your mother's brothers, your mother's sisters or [from houses] whose keys you possess, or from any of your friends' houses. There is nothing wrong with your eating [either] together or separately, but, when you enter any house, give greetings of peace upon each other, a greeting from God, blessed and good. In this way God makes His messages clear to you so that you may understand.

62.Safi Kaskas: The Believers are those who believe in God and His Messenger, and who, when they meet with him about some matter of common concern, do not depart until they have asked his permission. [Prophet], those who ask your permission are the ones who [truly] believe in God and His Messenger. So, when they ask your permission to attend to their affairs, then give permission to any among them you will, and ask God to forgive them. God is Ever-Forgiving and Merciful-to-all.

63.Safi Kaskas: [Believers], do not call the Messenger as you call one another. God knows those of you who slip away, [from meetings with the Prophet] stealthily, so let those who dissent from the Prophet's order beware, lest some trial befall them [in this life] or a painful punishment [in the next].

64.Safi Kaskas: To God belongs everything is in the heavens and earth. He knows what you stand for, and one Day, when all return to Him, He will inform them what they have done, for God knows all things.

1.Safi Kaskas: Blessed is He who sent down to His Servant the Furqan [the Standard by which we judge right from wrong), so that he may be a warner to all people.

2.Safi Kaskas: It is He to whom belongs the dominion over the heavens and the earth, and who has not taken a son and has no associate in His dominion, for He has created all things according to precise measures.

3.Safi Kaskas: Yet some have chosen to worship gods other than Him, gods who cannot create but are themselves created, who have no power to protect themselves from harm or benefit themselves, and who have no power over death, or life, or resurrection.

4.Safi Kaskas: And the unbelievers say, "This is but a lie he has devised, made possible with the help of other people." In truth, they have committed injustice and falsehood.

5.Safi Kaskas: They [also] say, "These are just legends of the ancients that he [directed to be] written down and dictated to him morning and evening."

6.Safi Kaskas: Say, "It has been sent down by Him who knows [every] secret within the heavens and the earth. He is ever-forgiving and Merciful-to-all."

7.Safi Kaskas: And they also say, "What sort of messenger eats food and walks in the markets? Should not at least an angel have been sent down to him, to help him with his warning?"

8.Safi Kaskas: Or, "Why hasn't he been given a treasure?" Or, "Why he does not have a garden from which he eats?" And the unjust say, "The man you follow is simply bewitched."

9.Safi Kaskas: Look at the examples they are using to describe you, [Prophet] but they have strayed and now cannot find their way.

10.Safi Kaskas: Blessed is He Who, if He wishes, can give you [Prophet] better than these; Gardens with rivers flowing through them and can grant you palaces.

11.Safi Kaskas: Denying that there is an Hour [of resurrection] is actually their main issue. [Hence], We have prepared a blazing fire for those who deny the Hour.

12.Safi Kaskas: When [Hell] sees them from a distance, they will hear its fury and roaring,

13.Safi Kaskas: and when they are thrown, shackled together, into a narrow place therein, they will pray for death.

14.Safi Kaskas: [They will be told] "Do not pray today for one death, but pray for many deaths."

15.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Is that [fate] better for you, or is the Garden of Eternity, which is promised to those that were ever mindful of God, better? For them, It will be a reward and a destination.

16.Safi Kaskas: Where they can have whatever they wish forever. This is a binding promise from your Lord.

17.Safi Kaskas: And on the Day He will gather them [the unjust] along with those they worship beside God, and [He] will say, "Was it you who misled My servants, or did they stray from the path by themselves?"

18.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "May You be exalted in Your glory! It was not for us to take any protectors beside You. But You provided comforts for them and their fathers until they forgot your message and became a worthless people."

19.Safi Kaskas: [God will say] "They [whom you claimed as divine], are refuting you and what you claim. Hence, you cannot avoid [punishment] or [find] help. And whoever commits injustice among you, We will make him suffer great punishment".

20.Safi Kaskas: [Prophet] Every messenger we ever sent before you ate food and walked in the markets. But We have made some of you a test for others to see if you will be steadfast? For your Lord is ever insightful.

21.Safi Kaskas: Those who do not expect that they are destined to meet Us say, "Why were not angels sent down to us, or [why] do we [not] see our Lord?" They have certainly become too proud of themselves and excessively insolent.

22.Safi Kaskas: On the day they see the angels, there won't be any good news for those who denied God, and [the angels guarding the gate to paradise] will say, "Stop, stay out."

23.Safi Kaskas: We will examine their deeds and scatter them like dust,

24.Safi Kaskas: Meanwhile those who are destined for paradise will, on that Day, be securely settled in the best resting place.

25.Safi Kaskas: The Day when heaven will split open with clouds [emerging], and the angels are sent down successively in streams.

26.Safi Kaskas: True sovereignty, on that Day, will belong to the Merciful-to-all. For unbelievers, it will be a day of distress;

27.Safi Kaskas: on that Day the one who was unjust to himself will bite his hands [in regret] and will say, "How I wish I had followed the way of the Messenger.

28.Safi Kaskas: Woe to me! I wish I had not taken so and so as a friend.

29.Safi Kaskas: He led me away from the remembrance [of God] after it had come to me. Satan, has always let man down."

30.Safi Kaskas: The Messenger will say, "My Lord, This Qur'an was abandoned by my people,"

31.Safi Kaskas: and thus have We assigned to every prophet an enemy; those, who force others to reject Our messages. But your Lord is sufficient as a guide and a helper.

32.Safi Kaskas: And the unbelievers say, "Why was the Qur'an not sent to him in one single revelation?" [It was revealed in stages] so that We may strengthen your heart. And We revealed it in well-organized portions.

33.Safi Kaskas: And every time they come to you with an argument, We will give you the [full] Truth and the best explanation.

34.Safi Kaskas: As for those who are dragged facedown to Hell, they will be in the worst place as they are the most misguided from the path.

35.Safi Kaskas: And We gave Moses the Book and appointed his brother Aaron to help him.

36.Safi Kaskas: We said, "Go together to the people who have rejected Our signs." Then We destroyed them completely.

37.Safi Kaskas: And the people of Noah-when they denied the messengers, We drowned them, and We made them a sign for people to come. And We have prepared a painful punishment for the unjust,

38.Safi Kaskas: [And the people of] Aad and Thamud, the people of the Al Rass and many generations in between.

39.Safi Kaskas: in each case, We, [warn them with] examples, and each We utterly destroyed.

40.Safi Kaskas: They must surely have come upon the town that was showered with a horrible rain; have they not seen it? But they do not expect resurrection.

41.Safi Kaskas: And whenever they see you [Prophet] they ridicule you, [saying], "Is this the one God sent as a messenger?

42.Safi Kaskas: He would almost have misled us from our gods had we not stood firmly by them." But soon, when they see the punishment, they will know who is the most misguided.

43.Safi Kaskas: Have you seen the one who has taken his own whims as his god? Are you responsible for him?

44.Safi Kaskas: And do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are just like cattle; indeed, they are [even] more lost.

45.Safi Kaskas: Have you not considered how your Lord lengthens the shadow [when], had He so willed, He could have made it stationary? [Instead], We have made the sun its guide,

46.Safi Kaskas: and We draw it back toward us gradually.

47.Safi Kaskas: It is He who made the night a veil for you and sleep for rest, and the day a time for rising.

48.Safi Kaskas: And it is He who sends forth the winds, bringing good news of His mercy. And We send down from the sky pure water,

49.Safi Kaskas: so that We may bring dead land to life and provide drink for the multitude of beings, animals and people, We have created.

50.Safi Kaskas: Indeed, We have distributed it among them so that they might take heed, but most people continue in their denial of the truth.

51.Safi Kaskas: And if We had willed, We could have sent a warner to every town,

52.Safi Kaskas: so do not go along with the unbelievers, but strove hard against them with this [Qur'an)

53.Safi Kaskas: He is the one who has merged the two seas, one fresh and sweet, the other salty and bitter, and He placed between them an insurmountable barrier.

54.Safi Kaskas: He created human beings from water and made them kin by blood and marriage. Your Lord is able to do all things.

55.Safi Kaskas: Yet, instead of God, they worship what can neither benefit nor harm them. The unbeliever is always biased, against his Lord.

56.Safi Kaskas: We have sent you [Prophet] only to bring good news and deliver a warning.

57.Safi Kaskas: Say, "I ask you no payment for doing this- only that whoever wills may take a path to his Lord."

58.Safi Kaskas: Put your trust in the Everlasting who does not die, glorify Him and celebrate His praise. For it is sufficient that none knows His worshipers' sins as fully as does He

59.Safi Kaskas: Who created the heavens and the earth and everything in between them in six days, and then established Himself above the Throne of His majesty- the Merciful-to-all! Ask about Him, then, the well informed.

60.Safi Kaskas: Yet, when they are told, "Prostrate yourselves before the Merciful-to-all," they say, "And who is the 'Merciful-to-all'? Should we prostrate ourselves before whatever you order us [to worship]?" And they turn farther away.

61.Safi Kaskas: Blessed is He who has placed constellations in the sky, a radiant light and glowing moon.

62.Safi Kaskas: And It is He who has made night and day succeed each other, [revealing Himself to] for anyone who wishes to be mindful or show gratitude.

63.Safi Kaskas: The worshipers of the Merciful-to-all are those who walk upon the earth with humility, and when the ignorant address them, reply with "peace";

64.Safi Kaskas: those who spend the night prostrating themselves and standing before their Lord;

65.Safi Kaskas: and those who say "Our Lord, spare us the punishment of Hell. Its punishment is dreadful;

66.Safi Kaskas: It is an evil abode and resting-place."

67.Safi Kaskas: They are those who, when they spend, are neither wasteful nor tightfisted, but maintain balanced spending habits,

68.Safi Kaskas: [as well as] those who never invoke another god alongside God nor kill the soul that God has forbidden [to be killed], except in the pursuit of justice, nor commit unlawful sexual intercourse. Whoever does these things will face a penalty

69.Safi Kaskas: that will be multiplied for him on the Day of Resurrection, and he will remain in humiliation forever,

70.Safi Kaskas: except those who repent, believe and do righteous work, [in that case] God will replace their evil deeds with good ones for God is ever-forgiving and Merciful-to-all.

71.Safi Kaskas: Whoever repents and acts righteously has truly returned to God in repentance.

72.Safi Kaskas: Those who do not testify to falsehood, and, when they pass near ill speech, pass by with dignity;

73.Safi Kaskas: and those who, when reminded of their Lord's revelations, do not turn a deaf ear or a blind eye;

74.Safi Kaskas: and those who say, "Our Lord, give us joy in our spouses and offspring, and make us a good example for those who are ever mindful of You."

75.Safi Kaskas: All of them will be awarded the highest paradise for what they patiently endured and they will be received with greetings of peace,

76.Safi Kaskas: and will live there for eternity. What an excellent home and place of rest.

77.Safi Kaskas: Say [to unbelievers], "What would my Lord care for you if not for your prayers to Him?" But since you have denied the truth as lies, [punishment] will inevitably befall you.

1.Safi Kaskas: Ta Seen Meem,

2.Safi Kaskas: these are the verses of the Book that makes everything clear.

3.Safi Kaskas: Perhaps, [Prophet] you punish yourself with grief because they will not believe.

4.Safi Kaskas: If We so will, We can send down from heaven a miracle that will force their necks to remain bowed in humility.

5.Safi Kaskas: Whenever a new revelation comes to them from the Merciful-to-all, they turn away.

6.Safi Kaskas: They have already denied the truth, but the news of what they used to ridicule will come back to [hunt] them.

7.Safi Kaskas: Do not they see the earth, and how many kinds of noble pairs of plants, We have caused to grow in it?

8.Safi Kaskas: There is a sign in this, but most of them will not believe.

9.Safi Kaskas: Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all.

10.Safi Kaskas: When your Lord called on Moses, [saying], "Go to the unjust people,

11.Safi Kaskas: the people of Pharaoh. Will they not be mindful of Me?"

12.Safi Kaskas: He said, "My Lord, I fear that they will call me a liar,

13.Safi Kaskas: and that my breast will tighten, and my tongue will be tied, so send for Aaron.

14.Safi Kaskas: Besides, they have a charge against me, so I fear that they will kill me."

15.Safi Kaskas: [God] said, "No. Go both of you with Our signs; We are with you, listening.

16.Safi Kaskas: Go to Pharaoh and say, "We are messengers from the Lord of the worlds,

17.Safi Kaskas: let the Children of Israel go with us."

18.Safi Kaskas: [Pharaoh] said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and did you not live among us for many years?

19.Safi Kaskas: [Then] you committed that crime of yours,  you were so ungrateful."

20.Safi Kaskas: [Moses] said, "At the time I did it, I was of the misguided.

21.Safi Kaskas: So I fled from you because I feared you. Then my Lord gave me wisdom and made me one of the Messengers.

22.Safi Kaskas: As for that favor of which you remind me, was it not because you enslaved the Children of Israel?"

23.Safi Kaskas: Pharaoh said, "But what is the Lord of the worlds?"

24.Safi Kaskas: He said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and all that is between them, if you only knew."

25.Safi Kaskas: [Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you hear [what he said]?"

26.Safi Kaskas: [Moses went on], "Your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers."

27.Safi Kaskas: [Pharaoh] said, "This messenger who has been sent to you is really mad."

28.Safi Kaskas: [Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you [would just use your] reason."

29.Safi Kaskas: [Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely imprison you."

30.Safi Kaskas: [Moses] said, "Even if I show you undeniable proof?"

31.Safi Kaskas: [Pharaoh] said, "Bring it, then, if you are telling the truth."

32.Safi Kaskas: So [Moses] threw down his staff; and behold, it was an undeniable snake.

33.Safi Kaskas: Then he drew out his hand, and-behold- it was [shining] white for all to see.

34.Safi Kaskas: [Pharaoh] said to the notables around him, "This is a skilled magician.

35.Safi Kaskas: He wants to drive you out of your land with his magic, so what do you recommend?"

36.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Let him and his brother wait for a while, and [meanwhile] send marshals to all the cities

37.Safi Kaskas: to bring every skilled magician."

38.Safi Kaskas: So the magicians were assembled at the appointed time on the appointed day.

39.Safi Kaskas: It was said to the People, "Have you assembled

40.Safi Kaskas: so that we might follow the magicians if they win?"

41.Safi Kaskas: When the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there a reward for us if we win?"

42.Safi Kaskas: He said, "Yes. You will be in my inner circle."

43.Safi Kaskas: Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you will throw."

44.Safi Kaskas: So they threw their ropes and their staffs, and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, We will surely win."

45.Safi Kaskas: Then Moses threw down his staff, and it devoured their deceptions.

46.Safi Kaskas: And down fell the magicians in prostration [to God],

47.Safi Kaskas: saying, "We believe in the Lord of the Worlds,

48.Safi Kaskas: the Lord of Moses and Aaron."

49.Safi Kaskas: [Pharaoh] said, "How dare you believe in Him before I have given you permission? He [Moses] must be your leader who has taught you magic. But soon you will know. I will cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and I will crucify all of you."

50.Safi Kaskas: They said, "We do not care! We will be returning to our Lord.

51.Safi Kaskas: We hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, because we were the first believers."

52.Safi Kaskas: We later revealed to Moses, "Travel by night with My worshipers, for you will be pursued."

53.Safi Kaskas: Then Pharaoh sent his marshals to the cities,

54.Safi Kaskas: [ saying], "[The Children of Israel] are a small band,

55.Safi Kaskas: but they are offending us,

56.Safi Kaskas: and we are a vigilant society.

57.Safi Kaskas: So We expelled them from [their] gardens and springs

58.Safi Kaskas: treasures and honored estates.

59.Safi Kaskas: Thus it was. [In time], We caused the Children of Israel to inherit all of this.

60.Safi Kaskas: So, they [the Egyptians] pursued them at sunrise,

61.Safi Kaskas: and when the two sides sighted one another, Moses' companions' said, "We will be overtaken!"

62.Safi Kaskas: [Moses] said, "No! my Lord is with me; He will guide me."

63.Safi Kaskas: Then, We revealed to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea." It parted, and each part looked like a mountain.

64.Safi Kaskas: We brought the pursuers right into it,

65.Safi Kaskas: and We saved Moses and all who were with him,

66.Safi Kaskas: and We drowned the others.

67.Safi Kaskas: There is a sign in this, but most of them will not believe.

68.Safi Kaskas: Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all.

69.Safi Kaskas: Tell them the story of Abraham,

70.Safi Kaskas: when he asked his father and his people, "What do you worship?"

71.Safi Kaskas: They said, "We worship idols, and we always attend to them."

72.Safi Kaskas: He asked, "Do they hear you when you call on them?

73.Safi Kaskas: Or do they benefit you, or harm you?"

74.Safi Kaskas: They said, "But this is what we found our fathers doing."

75.Safi Kaskas: He said, "Have you really thought about what You have been worshipping,

76.Safi Kaskas: you and your forefathers?

77.Safi Kaskas: They are enemies to me. [I worship none] except the Lord of the worlds,

78.Safi Kaskas: Who created me. It is He Who guides me.

79.Safi Kaskas: and He who feeds me and gives me drink,

80.Safi Kaskas: and He who heals me when I am ill,

81.Safi Kaskas: and He who will cause me to die and then bring me back to life,

82.Safi Kaskas: and who, I hope, will forgive my sins on the Day of Judgment."

83.Safi Kaskas: [Abraham then said], "My Lord, grant me wisdom and allow me to join with the righteous,

84.Safi Kaskas: and grant me a lasting mention as one who told the truth among later generations.

85.Safi Kaskas: And make me among those who will inherit the Garden of Bliss.

86.Safi Kaskas: Forgive my father, for he has been of those who were misguided,

87.Safi Kaskas: and do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected,

88.Safi Kaskas: the Day when neither wealth nor children will benefit [anyone]

89.Safi Kaskas: except the one who comes to God with a flawless heart."

90.Safi Kaskas: [On that day], Paradise will be brought near to those who were mindful of God,

91.Safi Kaskas: and Hell will be brought forth for those who were misled.

92.Safi Kaskas: It will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship

93.Safi Kaskas: other than God? Can they help you or help themselves?"

94.Safi Kaskas: So They will be hurled into Hell with those who misled them

95.Safi Kaskas: with Iblis' helpers, all together.

96.Safi Kaskas: While bickering with each other they will say,

97.Safi Kaskas: "By God, we were obviously misguided

98.Safi Kaskas: when we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.

99.Safi Kaskas: No one misguided us except those who forced us to reject God's messages.

100.Safi Kaskas: So now we have no intercessors,

102.Safi Kaskas: If we can only go back [to the world) , we will be believers."

103.Safi Kaskas: There is a sign in this, but most of them will not believe.

104.Safi Kaskas: Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all.

105.Safi Kaskas: The people of Noah denied the Messengers

106.Safi Kaskas: when their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not be mindful of God?

107.Safi Kaskas: I am a trustworthy messenger to you.

108.Safi Kaskas: So be mindful of God and obey me.

109.Safi Kaskas: I ask no reward from you for doing this; my reward comes only from the Lord of the worlds.

110.Safi Kaskas: So be mindful of God, and obey me."

111.Safi Kaskas: They said, "How can we believe you when you are followed mostly by the lowest [class of People]?"

112.Safi Kaskas: He said, "What do I know about what they have been doing?

113.Safi Kaskas: It is for my Lord alone to bring them to account, if you [could] only understand.

114.Safi Kaskas: I am not one to drive away the believers.

115.Safi Kaskas: I am only a clear warner."

116.Safi Kaskas: They said, "If you do not desist, Noah, you will surely be stoned."

117.Safi Kaskas: He said, "My Lord, my people have denied me.

118.Safi Kaskas: Judge between us decisively, and save me and those believers with me."

119.Safi Kaskas: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ark,

120.Safi Kaskas: and then We drowned the rest.

121.Safi Kaskas: There is a sign in this, but most of them will not believe.

122.Safi Kaskas: Truly your Lord is the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all.

123.Safi Kaskas: [The people of] Aad denied the Messengers

124.Safi Kaskas: when their brother Hud said to them, "Will you not be mindful of God?

125.Safi Kaskas: I am a trustworthy messenger to you,

126.Safi Kaskas: so be mindful of  God, and obey me.

127.Safi Kaskas: I ask no reward from you for doing this; my reward is only from the Lord of the worlds.

128.Safi Kaskas: Do you build a tower on every hill just to amuse yourselves,
