59.Safi Kaskas: Prophet, tell your wives, your daughters and the believers' women to bring down over themselves [part] of their outer garments. This will make it more likely that they will be  recognized and not abused. God is the All-Forgiving, the Mercy-giver.

60.Safi Kaskas: If the hypocrites and the sick at heart and those who spread bad rumors in Medina do not stop, We will stir you up against them; then they will be living there with you for only a short while.

61.Safi Kaskas: They are cursed, and they should be arrested and put to death wherever they are found.

62.Safi Kaskas: This has been God's way with those who went before, and you will not find any change in the way of God.

63.Safi Kaskas: People ask you about the Hour [of Judgment]. Say," God alone has Knowledge of It. You never know; the Hour maybe near."

64.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers have earned God's anger, and He has prepared a Blazing Fire for them.

65.Safi Kaskas: There they will stay forever, where they will find no protector or helper.

66.Safi Kaskas: On the Day, their faces will be turned about in the Fire, and they will say, "How we wish we had obeyed God and obeyed the Messenger."

67.Safi Kaskas: And they will say, "Our Lord, we obeyed our masters and our dignitaries, and they led us down the wrong path.

68.Safi Kaskas: Our Lord, give them double the punishment and curse them in a huge way."

69.Safi Kaskas: Believers, do not be like those who slandered Moses, but God cleared him of what they said, and that he was distinguished in God's sight.

70.Safi Kaskas: Believers, be mindful of God, and speak in a straightforward way,

71.Safi Kaskas: He will rectify your deeds and forgive you your sins. And whoever obeys God and His Messenger has certainly achieved a great success.

72.Safi Kaskas: We offered the Trust to the heavens, the earth and the mountains; but they refused to bear it and feared it, yet the human being took it on. He has always been unjust and ignorant,

73.Safi Kaskas: [This is in order that] God punishes the hypocrites, men and women, as well as the men and women who associate others with Him, and why God turns mercifully towards the believing men and women, for God is the Ever-Forgiving, the Mercy Giver.

1.Safi Kaskas: [All] praise is [due] to God, to whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and the earth, and to Him belongs [all] praise in the Hereafter. He is the All-Wise, the All-Aware.

2.Safi Kaskas: He knows what goes into the earth and what comes out of it, and what comes down from the heaven and what goes up into it. He is the Mercy-Giver, the Forgiving.

3.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers say, "The Hour of Judgment will never come to us." Say [Prophet], "Yes by God, it will surely come to you. [God is] the Knower of all that is beyond our knowledge." Not even an atom's weight within the heavens or within the earth escapes His knowledge, nor anything smaller or larger than that. All is in a clear record,

4.Safi Kaskas: so that He may reward those who believe and do good deeds. They will have forgiveness and generous provision,

5.Safi Kaskas: but for those who strive against Our message, trying to undermine it, there will be a painful punishment of agonizing pain.

6.Safi Kaskas: Those who have been given knowledge see that what is sent down to you from your Lord is the Truth, and that it guides to the path of the Almighty, the Praiseworthy.

7.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers say, "Shall we show you a man who will tell you that when you are totally decayed, you will be raised as a new creation?

8.Safi Kaskas: Has he invented a lie about God or is he mad?" Rather, they who do not believe in the Hereafter will received punishment and are extremely misguided.

9.Safi Kaskas: Have they not looked at what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and earth? If We wanted, We could cause the earth to swallow them or let fragments from the sky fall down on them.  There is a sign in that for every worshiper who turns back to God in repentance.

10.Safi Kaskas: We gave David great favors from Us: "Mountains, repeat [Our] praises with him, and the birds [as well]." And We made iron pliable for him,

11.Safi Kaskas: [instructing him to], "Make full coats of mail, measuring the links carefully. Do good all of you. I am aware of everything you do."

12.Safi Kaskas: And [We subjected] the wind to Solomon; its morning course [covered] a month's journey, and its evening course [covered] a month's journey. And We made a fountain of molten copper flow for him. And among the jinn were those who worked for him with his Lord's permission, and whoever among them deviated from Our command, We will make him taste of the punishment of the Blazing flame.

13.Safi Kaskas: They made him whatever he wanted: high arches and statues, bowls like reservoirs, and firmly anchored kettles. [We said], "Work in gratitude, family of David, for few of My worshipers are grateful."

14.Safi Kaskas: And when We decreed Solomon's death, nothing indicated his death to the jinn except an earthworm eating his staff, but, when he fell down, it became clear to the jinn that, had they known the reality which was beyond their knowledge, they would not have remained in humiliating punishment.

15.Safi Kaskas: There was a sign [of God's grace] for the people of Sheba in their homeland: two gardens one on the right and one on the left. [They were told], "Eat from the provisions of your Lord, and be grateful to Him for a good land and a forgiving Lord."

16.Safi Kaskas: But they turned away, so We loosed on them the flood from the dam, and We replaced their two gardens with two others of bitter fruit, tamarisk bushes and a few thorn trees.

17.Safi Kaskas: This is how We repaid them for their ingratitude. Are any but the ungrateful repaid like this?

18.Safi Kaskas: [Before their demise] We had placed between them and the towns We had blessed other towns within sight of one another to which they could easily have traveled, "Travel safely between them by night or day."

19.Safi Kaskas: But [they complained], "Our Lord has made the distance between our staging posts so long." [In so doing] they wronged themselves, so We made their fate a tale for all and scattered them in small groups throughout the land. There are certainly signs in this for everyone patient and grateful.

20.Safi Kaskas: What Iblis thought of them was proven right, since they all followed him, except for a group of believers.

21.Safi Kaskas: He had no authority over them, but We wanted to know who believes in the Hereafter and who is in doubt about it. Your Lord is the Preserver over all things.

22.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Call on those you claim to be gods other than God." They have no power over the smallest particle, either in the heavens or on earth, and they do not have partnership [with Him], nor does He need any assistant from among them.

23.Safi Kaskas: Intercession does not work with Him except when He permits it. [But, on the day of Judgment,] when the terror is removed from their hearts, they will say [to one another], "What has your Lord said?" They will say, "The truth." And He is the Most High, the Most Great.

24.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Who provides for you from the heavens and the earth?"" Say, "God does. Then either we or you are rightly guided or clearly lost."

25.Safi Kaskas: Say, "You will not be asked about what we have done, and we will not be asked about what you do."

26.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Our Lord will bring us together; then He will judge between us in Truth, for He is the All-knowing, the Just Decider."

27.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Show me those whom you have joined to Him as partners. No! Rather, He [alone] is God, the Almighty, the Wise."

28.Safi Kaskas: And We have sent you to all people as bearer of good news and to deliver a warning, but most people do not know.

29.Safi Kaskas: And they say, "When is this promise coming, if you are truthful?"

30.Safi Kaskas: Say, "You have an appointment for a Day which you cannot delay nor bring forward even by a single hour"

31.Safi Kaskas: Those who deny the truth say, "We will never believe in this Qur'an or in what came before it." But if only you could see when the unjust are made to stand before their Lord, blaming each other; those who were thought weak will say to those who had been arrogant,  "Had it not been for you, we would have been believers."

32.Safi Kaskas: Those who had been arrogant will say to those who they deemed to be weak, "Did we prevent you from following the right guidance after it had come to you? Rather, you rejected it."

33.Safi Kaskas: Those who had been thought weak will say to those who had been arrogant, "Rather, it was your scheming, night and day, ordering us to deny God and attribute equals to Him." But when they all see the punishment [that awaits them], they will be unable to express their remorse. We will put shackles around the necks of those who rejected the truth, and they will be repaid only for what they have done.

34.Safi Kaskas: Never have We sent a warning into a town without those who were corrupted by wealth  saying, "We reject the message with which you have been sent."

35.Safi Kaskas: They also say, "We are wealthier and have more children [than you], and We will not be punished."

36.Safi Kaskas: Say, [Prophet] "My Lord gives abundant provisions to whom He wills, or [likewise] restricts [it], but most people do not know."

37.Safi Kaskas: It is neither your wealth nor your children that will bring you nearer to Us , but rather [your choice] to believe and to do good deeds. For those there will be double reward for what they did, and they will be safe in the upper chambers [of Paradise].

38.Safi Kaskas: But as for those who rejected Our messages, trying to undermine them, they will be consigned to the punishment.

39.Safi Kaskas: Say, "My Lord gives abundantly to whomever of His worshipers He wills, or [likewise] restricts [it], but whatever you spend [in His cause], He will replace, for He is the Best of Providers."

40.Safi Kaskas: And one Day He will gather them all and say to the angels, "Was it you whom these people worshipped?"

41.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "May You be exalted in Your glory. You are our protector, not them. Rather, they [the unbelievers] used to worship the jinn; most of them believed in them."

42.Safi Kaskas: "Today, none of you hold any power to benefit or harm another," and We will say to those who wronged themselves, "Taste the punishment of the Fire, which you used to deny."

43.Safi Kaskas: When our clear verses are recited to them [your people], they say, "This is only a man who wants to turn you away from what your ancestors worshipped." They [also] say, "This is only a lie that he has invented." When the Truth comes to them, the unbelievers say, "This is nothing but sorcery."

44.Safi Kaskas: [Even] though We had not given them any Books to study nor sent any one before you, [Prophet], to warn them.

45.Safi Kaskas: Those before them similarly rejected the truth, when they did not receive a tenth of what We had given them [your people], yet they [the previous people] rejected My Messengers, and how [terrible] was My disapproval.

46.Safi Kaskas: Say, "I only have one advice for you: Stand up before God, in pairs or individually, and then reflect. Your companion is not crazy. He is here only to warn you of a severe impending punishment."

47.Safi Kaskas: Say, "The payment for which you think I ask you is yours. My payment comes only from God, and He is the Witness over all things."

48.Safi Kaskas: Say, "My Lord hurls forth the Truth, for He has the full knowledge of all that is beyond our knowledge."

49.Safi Kaskas: Say, "The Truth has come, and falsehood can neither originate anything nor regenerate it."

50.Safi Kaskas: Say, "If I should be misguided, it is only to my own detriment, but if I am guided, it is through what my Lord reveals to me. He is the All-Hearing, the Near."

51.Safi Kaskas: If only you could see when they are terrified, but there will be no escape, and they are seized from a place nearby.

52.Safi Kaskas: They will [then] say, "We do believe in it!" But how can they reach it from such a distant place?

53.Safi Kaskas: They had already denied the truth and were prone to guessing from afar about things beyond their perception.

54.Safi Kaskas: A barrier will be placed between them and what they desire, as was done with their kind before, for they too were in hopeless doubt.

1.Safi Kaskas: [All] praise is due to God, the Programmer of the heavens and the earth. He made the angels messengers with wings, two, three and four [pairs]. He adds to His creation anyway He wills, for God has power over all things.

2.Safi Kaskas: Whatever mercy God grants to people, no one can prevent, whatever He withholds, no one can release, for He is the Almighty, the Wise.

3.Safi Kaskas: People, remember the favor of God upon you. Is there any creator other than God who provides for you from the heaven and earth? There is no God except Him, so what lies are you inventing?

4.Safi Kaskas: And if they deny you [Prophet], other messengers were denied before you. To God will all matters be returned.

5.Safi Kaskas: People, God's promise is true, so do not let the worldly life delude you, and don't let the deceiver deceive you about God.

6.Safi Kaskas: Satan is your enemy, so treat him as an enemy. His call on his followers [will only lead them] to be among those of the Blazing Fire.

7.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers will have a severe punishment, and those who believe and do good deeds will have forgiveness and great reward.

8.Safi Kaskas: What about the one whose evil deeds were made to look attractive to him so he regards them as good? God lets stray [those] who choose [to be misguided] and guides [those] who choose [guidance], so don't let your sorrow over them destroy you.  God knows what they do.

9.Safi Kaskas: It is God who sends the winds, which lift the clouds, which We then drive to a dead land and thereby bring the earth to life after its death. Such is the resurrection.

10.Safi Kaskas: Whoever desires might, [they should know that] all might belongs to God. To Him all good words ascend, and He lifts up righteous deeds. But they who plot evil deeds will have a severe punishment, and their plots will perish.

11.Safi Kaskas: God created you from dust, then from a fertilized ovum, and then He made you into pairs. No female conceives nor does she give birth without His knowledge, and no being grows old or has his life cut short except in accordance with a record. That is easy for God.

12.Safi Kaskas: The two seas are not alike: one is fresh and sweet, suitable for drinking, and the other is salty and bitter. Yet from each you eat fresh meat and extract ornaments to wear. You see ships making their way through [each of them] so that you might seek His bounty and so perhaps you will be thankful.

13.Safi Kaskas: He merges the night into the day and the day into the night, and has made the sun and the moon subservient [to His laws], each running [its course] for an appointed time. This is God, your Lord. Sovereignty belongs to Him, while those whom you invoke beside Him do not even control [as much as] the skin of a date seed.

14.Safi Kaskas: If you invoke them, they do not hear you, and even if they could hear, they would not respond to you. On the Day of Resurrection, they will reject your having associated them with God, and no one can inform you [of the Truth] like the One who is All-Aware.

15.Safi Kaskas: People, you are in need of God, while God is the Rich Beyond Need, the One the Praiseworthy.

16.Safi Kaskas: If He wishes, He can do away with you and bring forth a new creation,

17.Safi Kaskas: [which] for God is not difficult.

18.Safi Kaskas: No bearer of burdens will bear the burdens of another and if a heavily laden soul calls [another] to [carry some of] its load, nothing of it will be carried, even if they were related. You can only warn those who stand in awe of their Lord even though He is beyond the reach of their perception, and those who perform prayer. Whoever purifies himself [does so] for the good of his soul. God is the [final] destination.

19.Safi Kaskas: The blind and the seeing are not equal,

20.Safi Kaskas: nor are ignorance and enlightenment,

21.Safi Kaskas: nor shade and heat,

22.Safi Kaskas: nor are the living and the dead alike.  God can make anyone He wills hear, but you cannot make those in the grave hear.

23.Safi Kaskas: You are only a warner.

24.Safi Kaskas: We have sent you with the Truth as a bearer of good news and a warner, for there is no community to which a warner has not come.

25.Safi Kaskas: If they reject you, those before them also rejected the truth. Their messengers came to them with clear signs and Psalms and with the enlightening Book.

26.Safi Kaskas: Then I seized the ones who denied the truth, and how [terrible] was My punishment.

27.Safi Kaskas: Don't you see that God sends down rain from the sky, with which We produce fruits of varying colors, [just as] in the mountains there are layers, white and red of varying shades, and some extremely black?

28.Safi Kaskas: Similarly, among people, animals, and livestock there are also many hues. Of all of his worshipers, only those with knowledge, are in awe of God. God is Almighty, most forgiving.

29.Safi Kaskas: Those who recite the Book of God, and perform prayer and spend out [on charity] from what We have provided them, secretly and openly, may expect a trade that will never perish,

30.Safi Kaskas: for He may give them their full rewards and increase for them out of His bounty. He is ever-forgiving and ever-thankful.

31.Safi Kaskas: What We revealed to you of the Book, is the very Truth, confirming what is available to you of previous revelations. God is All-Aware of His worshipers, and All-Seeing.

32.Safi Kaskas: We then bestowed this Book as an inheritance on those of our worshipers whom We selected; and among them are some who wrong their own souls, some are moderate, and some who, by God's grace, are foremost in good deeds. That is the greatest favor,

33.Safi Kaskas: for they will enter Gardens of Eden, where they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and where their garments will be silk.

34.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "Praise be to God, who has removed all our sorrow from us, for Our Lord is truly ever-forgiving and ever-thankful

35.Safi Kaskas: It is He who has settled us in the everlasting Home out of His favor, where no weariness or fatigue will touch us."

36.Safi Kaskas: But the unbelievers will be in Hell, where they will neither be finished off and die, nor will they be relieved from Hell's punishment. That is how we reward everyone who is ungrateful.

37.Safi Kaskas: They will cry out loud, "Our Lord, let us out; We will do good deeds, different from what we were doing before!" "But didn't We give you sufficient time so that those who would be mindful could be mindful? And we even sent you the warner. Taste, then, [the punishment], for the unjust will have no helper.

38.Safi Kaskas: God knows all the unknown of the heavens and earth; He knows what is in the hearts.

39.Safi Kaskas: It is He who has put you in charge of the earth. Whoever denies the truth will bear the consequences. Their denial will increase their rejection in the sight of their Lord, and their denial will only increase their loss.

40.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Have you considered your 'partners' whom you invoke besides God? Show me what part of earth they have created, or do they have a partnership [with Him] in the heavens? Or have We given them a Book that has clear evidence? [No indeed]; Rather, the unjust promise each other nothing but delusion."

41.Safi Kaskas: God upholds the heavens and the earth lest they fall apart, and, should they fall apart, no one other than He could hold them [in place], for He is forbearing and most forgiving.

42.Safi Kaskas: They swore by God their most solemn oaths that, if a warning came to them, they would be better guided than any one of the previous communities. But, when a warner did come to them, they only turned further away

43.Safi Kaskas: because of their arrogance on earth and their evil schemes. Yet evil schemes overwhelm only those who plot them. Do they expect anything different, given what happened to earlier people? You will never find any change in the way of God, and you will never find any deviation in the His way.

44.Safi Kaskas: Have they not traveled through the land and observed the final fate of those who preceded them, who were even greater than they in strength? Nothing in the heavens or earth will prevent God from accomplishing His purpose, for He is All-Knowing, infinite in His power.

45.Safi Kaskas: Were God to take people to task for what they have earned, He would not leave any creature on the earth, but He defers them for a specified time. Then when their time comes, God sees all that is in [the hearts of] His worshipers.

1.Safi Kaskas: Ya Seen,

2.Safi Kaskas: by the wise Qur'an

3.Safi Kaskas: you are one of the messengers,

4.Safi Kaskas: on a straight path.

5.Safi Kaskas: This revelation has been gradually sent down from the Almighty, the Merciful

6.Safi Kaskas: to warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are unaware.

7.Safi Kaskas: [However], the word [of God] is bound to come true for most of them, for they will not believe.

8.Safi Kaskas: We have put shackles round their necks, reaching to their chins, so that their heads are forced up,

9.Safi Kaskas: and We have put a barrier before them and behind them, and have blindfolded them, so that they cannot see.

10.Safi Kaskas: It is all the same to them whether you warn them or do not warn them, they won't believe.

11.Safi Kaskas: You can only warn someone who follows the message and stands in awe of the Merciful-to-all even though He is beyond his perception. So give him good news of forgiveness and a generous reward.

12.Safi Kaskas: It is We who bring the dead to life, and record what they have done and the results of their deeds. We account for everything in a clear record.

13.Safi Kaskas: Give them the example of the people whose town was visited by the messengers

14.Safi Kaskas: We sent two to them, but they rejected both, so We reinforced them with a third, and they declared, "We are messengers to you."

15.Safi Kaskas: They replied, "You are only human beings like us, and the Merciful-to-all has not revealed a thing. You are only telling lies."

16.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Our Lord knows that we are messengers to you,

17.Safi Kaskas: and we are responsible only for delivering [the message] clearly."

18.Safi Kaskas: They said, "We feel that you are an evil omen.   If you do not stop, We will surely stone you, and cause you to suffer severely."

19.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Your evil omen is upon you. How can it be evil that you were reminded [about God]? You are rather going too far."

20.Safi Kaskas: Then a man came running from the farthest end of the town, saying, "O, my people, follow the Messengers.

21.Safi Kaskas: Follow those who do not ask you for [any] payment; they are [rightly] guided.

22.Safi Kaskas: Why should I not worship the One who brought me into being and gave me a purpose and to whom you will be returned?

23.Safi Kaskas: Would I take any gods other than Him? if the Merciful intends me some harm, their intercession will not help me at all, nor can they save me.

24.Safi Kaskas: I would then be clearly misguided.

25.Safi Kaskas: I have believed in your Lord, so listen to me."

26.Safi Kaskas: It was said [to him], "Enter Paradise." He said, "I wish that my people only knew

27.Safi Kaskas: how my Lord has forgiven me and placed me among the highly honored."

28.Safi Kaskas: After him, We did not send any host from heaven to his people, nor would We send one down.

29.Safi Kaskas: It was only one shout, and immediately they were extinguished.

30.Safi Kaskas: Alas for our servants. Whenever a messenger comes to them, they ridicule him.

31.Safi Kaskas: Have they not considered how many generations We destroyed before them, none of whom will ever come back to them?

32.Safi Kaskas: Yet each and every one of them will be brought before Us.

33.Safi Kaskas: A sign for them is the dead land that We have brought to life; from it We have brought forth grain, from which they eat.

34.Safi Kaskas: And We have placed gardens of palm trees and grapevines in it, and caused springs of water to burst from it,

35.Safi Kaskas: so that they may eat its fruit. It was not their hands that produced it, will they not be grateful?

36.Safi Kaskas: Exalted in His glory is He who created pairs out of whatever the earth produces, as well as from themselves and from other things unknown to them.

37.Safi Kaskas: Night is a sign for them. We remove the daylight from it, so they are [left] in darkness,

38.Safi Kaskas: and the sun runs its course toward its destined point. Such is the determination of the Almighty, the All-Knowing.

39.Safi Kaskas: And the moon, We have determined it's phases, until it finally appears like the old date-palm stalk.

40.Safi Kaskas: The sun is not allowed to reach the moon, nor does the night overtake the day, but each floats in their own orbit.

41.Safi Kaskas: Another sign for them is that We carried their offspring in the loaded Ark.

42.Safi Kaskas: And that We have created for them similar vessels in which to ride.

43.Safi Kaskas: If We wish, We could drown them, with no one to respond to their cry for help, nor would they be saved,

44.Safi Kaskas: except through Our mercy, that they could be given a while to enjoy life.

45.Safi Kaskas: But when they are told, "Beware of what lies before you and what lies behind you; perhaps you will be shown mercy,"

46.Safi Kaskas: they turn away from every sign that comes to them from their Lord.

47.Safi Kaskas: And when It is said to them, "Give to others from what God has provided for you," the unbelievers say to those who believe, "Should we feed one whom, if God had willed, He would have fed? You are clearly misguided."

48.Safi Kaskas: They say, "When will this promise come about, if you are truthful?"

49.Safi Kaskas: All it takes is one blast that will seize them while they still arguing about it.

50.Safi Kaskas: They will not be able [to give] any testimony, nor will they return to their people.

51.Safi Kaskas: And then the Horn will be blown, and at once they will rush out of the graves to their Lord.

52.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "How terrible for us! Who has raised us up from our resting-place?" [They will be told], "This is what the Merciful-to-all had promised, and the Messengers told the Truth."

53.Safi Kaskas: It will be only one blast, and at once they are all brought before Us.

54.Safi Kaskas: "Today no soul will be wronged at all, and you will be repaid for what you did."

55.Safi Kaskas: The people of Paradise will on that Day be joyfully engaged;

56.Safi Kaskas: they and their spouses will lie in shades, reclining on couches

57.Safi Kaskas: where they will have fruit and whatever they wish,

58.Safi Kaskas: and their Lord, the Mercy giver, will great them with "Peace."

59.Safi Kaskas: [But to the guilty, He will say], "Those who forced others to reject Our messages should stand apart today."

60.Safi Kaskas: Children of Adam, did I not make a covenant with you not to worship Satan, who is clearly your enemy,

61.Safi Kaskas: and that you worship [only] Me? This is a straight path.

62.Safi Kaskas: [Satan] has already led a great many of you astray; why do you not use your reason?

63.Safi Kaskas: This is the Hell that you were promised.

64.Safi Kaskas: Enter it today as a result of your having denied the truth."

65.Safi Kaskas: Today, We will seal over their mouths, but their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify about what they used to do.

66.Safi Kaskas: And if We willed it, We could have taken away their sight, and they would have struggled to [find] the path, but how could they have seen it?

67.Safi Kaskas: And if We had so willed, We could have crippled them where they stood, so that they could move neither forward nor backward.

68.Safi Kaskas: When We grant a person long life, We also cause him to decline in power, so will they not understand?

69.Safi Kaskas: We did not teach [the Prophet] poetry, nor it is suitable for him. This is simply a reminder and a self-evident Qur'an

70.Safi Kaskas: to warn those whose hearts are alive, and to pass God's verdict against the unbelievers.

71.Safi Kaskas: Can they not see that, by Our own handiwork, We have created livestock for them, that they now control?

72.Safi Kaskas: We have tamed [those animals] for them, so that they can ride some of them, and some they can eat,

73.Safi Kaskas: and some have other benefits, [such as milk] to drink. Will they not, then, be grateful?

74.Safi Kaskas: Yet they have taken [false] gods besides God, hoping that they will help them,

75.Safi Kaskas: but [their false gods] cannot help them, even if they were soldiers standing by, ready to support them.

76.Safi Kaskas: So do not let what they say grieve you.  We know what they conceal and what they reveal.

77.Safi Kaskas: Does a human being not consider that We created him from a [mere] fertilized ovum, yet he becomes a fierce adversary?

78.Safi Kaskas: Now, he argues about Us while he overlooks how he himself was created. He says, "Who will give life to bones when they are disintegrated?"

79.Safi Kaskas: Say, "He who made them in the first instance will give them life again. He has full knowledge of all creation,

80.Safi Kaskas: He, who produces fire for you from green trees, so that you use them to light your fires."

81.Safi Kaskas: Is not He who created the heavens and the earth able to create the same again? Yes, indeed, for He is the All-Knowing, the Creator.

82.Safi Kaskas: When He wills something to be, His simply says, "Be"- and it is.

83.Safi Kaskas: Exalted in His glory is He who has the dominion of all things in His hand, and to Him you will return.

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Safi Kaskas: By those lined up in ranks,

2.Safi Kaskas: and those who warn, crying warnings,

3.Safi Kaskas: and those who recite God's word,

4.Safi Kaskas: your God is One,

5.Safi Kaskas: Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything between them, Lord of every sunrise.

6.Safi Kaskas: We have adorned the nearest heaven with planets

7.Safi Kaskas: and protected them against every rebellious devil,

8.Safi Kaskas: [so that the devils] may not listen to the highest assembly [of angels] but be repelled from every side,

9.Safi Kaskas: driven away.  For them there is a continuous punishment,

10.Safi Kaskas: except for him who snatches a glimpse [of such knowledge], He will be pursued by a piercing flame.

11.Safi Kaskas: Then ask those who persist on denying the truth if they were more difficult to create than those other beings We have created, for We created them from sticky clay.

12.Safi Kaskas: No wonder you are surprised, to see them ridicule [the message],

13.Safi Kaskas: and when they are reminded [of the Truth], they don't want to remember,

14.Safi Kaskas: and when they see a sign, they ridicule it,

15.Safi Kaskas: saying, "This is mere magic.

16.Safi Kaskas: When We have died and become dust and bones, are we to be resurrected,

17.Safi Kaskas: and our forefathers too?"

18.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Yes, and [on that Day of Judgment] you will be humiliated."

19.Safi Kaskas: [On that Day,] there will be only a single shout, and at once they will begin to see.

20.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "How terrible for us! This is the Day of Judgment,"

21.Safi Kaskas: and [They will be told], "This is the Day of separation [between the good and the bad], which you used to deny."

22.Safi Kaskas: [The angels will be ordered], "Gather those who were unjust, all those like them, and the idols they used to worship

23.Safi Kaskas: instead of God, and show them to the path of Hell

24.Safi Kaskas: And stop them, for they are to be questioned:

25.Safi Kaskas: "Why do you not help each other now?"

26.Safi Kaskas: No, today they come in absolute submission,

27.Safi Kaskas: and they will turn on one another, questioning each other.

28.Safi Kaskas: [Some] will say, "You used to approach us from a position of power."

29.Safi Kaskas: The others will say, "No, you [yourselves] were not believers,

30.Safi Kaskas: and we had no authority over you, but you were exceedingly arrogant people.

31.Safi Kaskas: Our Lord's Word has been carried out against us, and we will all taste punishment.

32.Safi Kaskas: We misled you, and we were ourselves misled."

33.Safi Kaskas: On that Day, they will share in the punishment,

34.Safi Kaskas: for that is how We deal with those who forced others to reject Our messages.

35.Safi Kaskas: Whenever they were told, "There is no god but God," they became arrogant,

36.Safi Kaskas: and would say, "Are we to give up our gods for a mad poet?"

37.Safi Kaskas: Rather, the Prophet has come with the Truth and confirmed the [previous] messengers.

38.Safi Kaskas: You [who deny the truth] will taste the painful punishment,

39.Safi Kaskas: and you will be repaid only for what you used to do.

40.Safi Kaskas: Not so for God's devoted worshipers,

41.Safi Kaskas: they will have recognizable provision,

42.Safi Kaskas: of fruits, and they will be honored

43.Safi Kaskas: in Gardens of delight,

44.Safi Kaskas: [resting] on couches and facing one another.

45.Safi Kaskas: A cup from a flowing spring will be passed among them,

46.Safi Kaskas: white and delicious to the drinkers,

47.Safi Kaskas: which will neither sicken nor intoxicate them.

48.Safi Kaskas: With them are mates of modest gaze with beautiful eyes

49.Safi Kaskas: just like closely guarded pearls.

50.Safi Kaskas: They will turn to one another, inquiring

51.Safi Kaskas: One of them says" I used to have a friend [on earth]

52.Safi Kaskas: who used to say to me, are you of those who believe

53.Safi Kaskas: that, when we have died and become dust and bones, we will  be brought for judgment?'"

54.Safi Kaskas: And he will add, "Shall we look for him?"

55.Safi Kaskas: And he looks and sees [his former companion] in the midst of Hell.

56.Safi Kaskas: He says to him, "By God, you almost ruined me.

57.Safi Kaskas: Were It not for the grace of my Lord, I would have been with those taken [to Hell].

58.Safi Kaskas: Then, [he says to those in paradise], "Will we really not die

59.Safi Kaskas: except for our first death, and will we really not be punished?"

60.Safi Kaskas: Truly, this is the ultimate success."

61.Safi Kaskas: This is what everyone should strive to attain.

62.Safi Kaskas: Is Paradise a better place to be, or the tree of Bitterness?

63.Safi Kaskas: We have made [this tree] a punishment for the unjust.

64.Safi Kaskas: It is a tree that grows in the heart of Hell,

65.Safi Kaskas: Its fruit like devils' heads,

66.Safi Kaskas: and [the people in Hell] will eat from it and fill their bellies with it.

67.Safi Kaskas: On top of that, they will have a boiling brew to drink.

68.Safi Kaskas: Then they will return to Hell,

69.Safi Kaskas: for they found their fathers misguided,

70.Safi Kaskas: so they rushed [to follow] in their footsteps.

71.Safi Kaskas: Most of the earlier peoples went astray before them,

72.Safi Kaskas: though We had already sent them someone to give warning.

73.Safi Kaskas: Look, then, at the final fate of those who were warned,

74.Safi Kaskas: except for the devout worshipers of God.

75.Safi Kaskas: Noah called Us, and how excellent was Our response.

76.Safi Kaskas: We saved him and his family from the great distress.

77.Safi Kaskas: We made his descendants the survivors,

78.Safi Kaskas: and left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:

79.Safi Kaskas: "Peace upon Noah, among all people."

80.Safi Kaskas: This is how we reward those who do good,

81.Safi Kaskas: for he was among Our believing worshipers.

82.Safi Kaskas: We drowned the rest.

83.Safi Kaskas: Abraham was like him.

84.Safi Kaskas: He came to his Lord with a faultless heart,

85.Safi Kaskas: and said to his father and his people, "What are you worshiping?

86.Safi Kaskas: Are you fooling yourselves by choosing false gods other than God?

87.Safi Kaskas: What do you think about the Lord of the worlds?"

88.Safi Kaskas: Then he took a look at the stars

89.Safi Kaskas: and said, "I am sick [of you worshipping these],"

90.Safi Kaskas: so they turned away from him and left.

91.Safi Kaskas: Then he turned to their gods and said, "Will you not eat?

92.Safi Kaskas: What is wrong with you that you do not speak?"

93.Safi Kaskas: And he turned on them, striking them with his right hand.

94.Safi Kaskas: His people came rushing back to him.

95.Safi Kaskas: He said, "How can you worship that which you [yourselves] carve,

96.Safi Kaskas: while God created you and everything you do?"

97.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Construct a furnace and throw him into the burning fire."

98.Safi Kaskas: They plotted against him, but We humiliated them.

99.Safi Kaskas: [Abraham] said, "I will go away to my Lord, He will guide me.

100.Safi Kaskas: My Lord, grant me a righteous son."

101.Safi Kaskas: So We gave him the good news of a gentle boy.

102.Safi Kaskas: And when [the boy] was old enough to work with him, he said, "My son, I have seen in a dream that I [must] sacrifice you, so see what you think." He said, "My father, do as you are ordered. You will find me, God willing, patient."

103.Safi Kaskas: But as soon as they had both submitted to [what they thought to be] God's will, and [Abraham] had laid [his son] down on the side of his face,

105.Safi Kaskas: you have fulfilled the vision."  This is how we reward those who do good.

106.Safi Kaskas: This was clearly a grave trial,

107.Safi Kaskas: and We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,

108.Safi Kaskas: and We left the later generations saying of him:

110.Safi Kaskas: This is how we reward those who do good,

111.Safi Kaskas: for [Abraham] was among Our believing worshipers.

112.Safi Kaskas: Then We gave him the good news of Isaac, a prophet from among the righteous,

113.Safi Kaskas: and We blessed him and Isaac. Among their descendants are doers of good, and those who clearly wrong themselves.

114.Safi Kaskas: We certainly showed great kindness to Moses and Aaron.

115.Safi Kaskas: We saved them and their people from a terrible predicament,

116.Safi Kaskas: and We supported them so that they prevailed,

117.Safi Kaskas: and We gave them the clarifying Book,

118.Safi Kaskas: and We guided them on the straight path,

119.Safi Kaskas: and We left the later generations saying of them:

121.Safi Kaskas: This is how We reward those who do good,

122.Safi Kaskas: for they were among Our believing worshipers.

123.Safi Kaskas: Elijah was indeed one of the messengers.

124.Safi Kaskas: When he said to his people, "Will you not remain mindful of God?

125.Safi Kaskas: Do you call upon Baal and leave the best of creators,

126.Safi Kaskas: God, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?"

127.Safi Kaskas: But they denied him, so they will be brought [for punishment],

129.Safi Kaskas: And We left the later generations saying of him:

130.Safi Kaskas: "Peace be upon the House of Elijah."

131.Safi Kaskas: This how we reward those who do good,

132.Safi Kaskas: for he was among Our believing worshipers.

133.Safi Kaskas: Lot was indeed one of the messengers.

134.Safi Kaskas: We saved him and all of his family,

135.Safi Kaskas: except an old woman who stayed behind.

138.Safi Kaskas: and night, so will you not use your reason?

139.Safi Kaskas: Jonah was one of the messengers.

140.Safi Kaskas: He ran away to an loaded ship,

141.Safi Kaskas: but they cast lots, and he lost,

142.Safi Kaskas: [so they threw him into the sea], and a great fish swallowed him, for He was blameworthy [for what he had done].

143.Safi Kaskas: And had he not been one of those who glorify God's limitless glory,

144.Safi Kaskas: he would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are resurrected.

145.Safi Kaskas: But We cast him, ill, on an open shore,

146.Safi Kaskas: and We made a gourd vine to grow over him,

147.Safi Kaskas: and We sent him to a hundred thousand people or more.

148.Safi Kaskas: They believed, so We let them enjoy their life.

149.Safi Kaskas: So [Prophet] inquire [of the idolaters], "Why do they think their Lord has daughters while they have sons"?

150.Safi Kaskas: Or, maybe they witnessed the creation of the angels as females?"

151.Safi Kaskas: No indeed, It is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say,

152.Safi Kaskas: "God has begotten," and they are liars.

153.Safi Kaskas: Has He chosen daughters over sons?

154.Safi Kaskas: What is [wrong] with you? How do you reach your judgments?

155.Safi Kaskas: Will you not be reminded [of the warning against such thinking]?

156.Safi Kaskas: Or do you have a clear authority [for what you allege]?

157.Safi Kaskas: Then, produce your Book, if you are truthful.

158.Safi Kaskas: They also claimed a lineage between Him and the jinn, but the jinn know that they will be brought before Him for [judgment].

159.Safi Kaskas: May God be exalted in His glory above all they describe,

160.Safi Kaskas: except for God's devout worshipers [who don't make such claims].

161.Safi Kaskas: So you [who deny the truth] and whatever you worship,

163.Safi Kaskas: except for him who will burn in Hell.

164.Safi Kaskas: [All of God's creations will say], "Among us, too, there is none but has a known place.

166.Safi Kaskas: and we are those who glorify God."

168.Safi Kaskas: "If only we had a message from those who lived before us,

169.Safi Kaskas: we would have been faithful worshipers of God."

170.Safi Kaskas: But they rejected the message, so they will soon realize [the consequences].

171.Safi Kaskas: Our word has already been given to Our worshiping Messengers

173.Safi Kaskas: and [that] Our soldiers will be those who overcome.

174.Safi Kaskas: So [Prophet], leave them for a time.

175.Safi Kaskas: And watch them, for they will soon see.

176.Safi Kaskas: Do they really want to hasten Our punishment?

177.Safi Kaskas: When it descends on them, how terrible will that morning be for those who were warned.

179.Safi Kaskas: and watch them, for they will soon see.

180.Safi Kaskas: May your Lord, the Lord of Might, be exalted in His glory above all they describe.

181.Safi Kaskas: And Peace be on the Messengers,

182.Safi Kaskas: and praise be to God, Lord of the worlds.

1.Safi Kaskas: Saad, by the Qur'an, which contains all that one ought to know.

2.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers are full of arrogance and dissent.

3.Safi Kaskas: How many generations have We destroyed before them (for the same sins)? They called out (to Us), but it was too late to escape.

4.Safi Kaskas: They are surprised that one of their own has come out to warn them, so those who want to deny the truth are saying, "This is a magician and a liar.

5.Safi Kaskas: How can he claim that the gods are [only] one God? This is a strange thing."

6.Safi Kaskas: Their leaders went off, saying, "Walk away, and be faithful to your gods. This is what you must do.

7.Safi Kaskas: We have not heard of this in the latest religion. This must be an invention.

8.Safi Kaskas: How can the message be revealed to him alone out of all of us?"In fact, they are in doubt about My message. In fact, they have not yet tasted My punishment.

9.Safi Kaskas: Or do They have the stores of your Lord's mercy, the Almighty, the Ever-Giving?

10.Safi Kaskas: Or is theirs the dominion of the heavens, and the earth, and what is between them? Then let them ascend through any means of access.

11.Safi Kaskas: [They are only] soldiers [who will be]   defeated regardless of what alliance they have.

12.Safi Kaskas: The people of Noah denied [My messages] before them, as did [the tribe of] Aad, Pharaoh-the owner of [many] tent-poles-

13.Safi Kaskas: [the tribe of] Thamud, the people of Lot, the woods-dwellers: those were the parties,

14.Safi Kaskas: each of whom rejected the messengers, so My punishment was justified.

15.Safi Kaskas: And these, too, [who now deny the truth] are only awaiting a single blast, which will not be stopped.

16.Safi Kaskas: And they say, "Our Lord, hasten for us our share [of the punishment] before the Day of Account

17.Safi Kaskas: Be patient over what they say, and remember Our servant, David, the possessor of strength; he was one who repeatedly turned back [to Us].

18.Safi Kaskas: We subjected the mountains to join him in praising Our limitless glory in the evening and daybreak,

19.Safi Kaskas: and the birds to assemble, all repeating [praises] with him.

20.Safi Kaskas: And We strengthened his kingdom, and gave him wisdom and keen judgment.

21.Safi Kaskas: And has the story come to you of the disputants who climbed over the wall of [his] prayer chamber?

22.Safi Kaskas: When they entered upon David, he was alarmed, [but] they said, "Do not be afraid. [We are] two disputants. One of us has wronged the other, so judge between us with truth, and do not be unjust, and guide us to the right way.

23.Safi Kaskas: This is my brother. He has ninety-nine ewes, and I have one ewe, so he said, 'Entrust it to me,' and got the better of me with his words."

24.Safi Kaskas: [David] said, "He has certainly wronged you in demanding that your ewe be added to his ewes. And many associates oppress one another, except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, and they are few." David then realized that We had been testing him, and he asked forgiveness of his Lord, and fell down bowing [in prostration], and turned [to God] in repentance,

25.Safi Kaskas: so We forgave him, and,  he has nearness to Us, and a good place in the Hereafter.

26.Safi Kaskas: [We said], "David,  We have made you a steward over this land, so judge between the people in truth and do not follow [your own] whim, as it will lead you away from the way of God."  Those who wander away from His path will have a severe punishment for having forgotten the Day of Account.

27.Safi Kaskas: We have not created the heaven and the earth and all that lies between them without meaning and purpose. That is the assumption of the unbelievers. How terrible the fire will be for the unbelievers.

28.Safi Kaskas: Would we treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like those who spread corruption on earth? Or would We treat those who are mindful of God like the wicked?

29.Safi Kaskas: This is a blessed Book, which We have revealed to you so that they might reflect upon its verses and that those of understanding would be reminded.

30.Safi Kaskas: And to David We gave Solomon, an excellent servant. He repeatedly turned back [to Us].

31.Safi Kaskas: When well-bred, swift horses were paraded before him at dusk,

32.Safi Kaskas: he said, "I love to love good things out of remembrance of my Lord," [and when] the horses disappeared into the  distance,

33.Safi Kaskas: he would say, "Bring them back to me," and stroke their legs and necks.

34.Safi Kaskas: But [previously], We had indeed tested Solomon [by] placing a lifeless body on his throne, he then turned toward us

35.Safi Kaskas: and prayed, "My Lord, forgive me, and grant me a kingdom the like of which will not belong to anyone after me.  You are the Ever Giving."

36.Safi Kaskas: So We gave him power over the wind, to direct it to blow gently wherever he wished,

37.Safi Kaskas: and over the devils, every kind of builder and diver

38.Safi Kaskas: and over others bound in shackles.

39.Safi Kaskas: [We said], "This is Our gift, [for you to] give or withhold without [rendering any] account."

40.Safi Kaskas: He is closed to Us and [has] a good place in the Hereafter.

41.Safi Kaskas: And remember Our servant Job, when he called to his Lord, "Satan has afflicted me with hardship and suffering."

42.Safi Kaskas: [So he was told], "Strike [the ground] with your foot; here is a [spring for] a cool bath and a drink."

43.Safi Kaskas: And We restored his family, and their like with them; as a mercy from Us and a reminder for those of understanding.

44.Safi Kaskas: [We said], "And take in your hand a bunch of grass and strike with it, and do not break your oath."  We found him patient, an excellent servant, one who repeatedly turned back [to Us].

45.Safi Kaskas: And remember Our servants Abraham, Isaac and Jacob, men of true strength and vision,

46.Safi Kaskas: for We purified them with a most pure quality-remembrance of the [Hereafter],

47.Safi Kaskas: and [in our sight] they are among the chosen and the outstanding.

48.Safi Kaskas: And remember Ishmael, Elisha and Dhul-Kifl, for they are all among the truly outstanding.

49.Safi Kaskas: This is a reminder, for the mindful of God will have a good place of return,

50.Safi Kaskas: Gardens of Eden, whose gates will open to them,

51.Safi Kaskas: where they will recline, calling for abundant fruit and drink,

52.Safi Kaskas: having beside them well-matched mates of modest gaze.

53.Safi Kaskas: This is what you are promised for the Day of Account.

54.Safi Kaskas: This is Our provision, which will never run out.

55.Safi Kaskas: But, truly, for the transgressors is an evil place of return

56.Safi Kaskas: Hell, where they will burn. What an evil resting place!

57.Safi Kaskas: This! So let them taste boiling water and [foul] pus-

58.Safi Kaskas: and other such punishments.

59.Safi Kaskas: [Its inhabitants will say], "This is a crowd [of people] rushing in to where you are. No welcome for them. They will burn in the Fire."

60.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "Nor you! No welcome for you. You, [our leaders], brought this upon us, what an evil place to settle!

61.Safi Kaskas: "They will say, "Our Lord, whoever brought this upon us, double his punishment in the Fire,"

62.Safi Kaskas: and they will wonder, "Why we do not see men whom we used to count among the worst,

63.Safi Kaskas: whom we used to mock? Did our eyes miss them?"

64.Safi Kaskas: This is how it will really be, the bickering of the people of the Fire.

65.Safi Kaskas: Say [Prophet], "I am only here to give a warning, and there is no god but God, the One, the All- Conquering,

66.Safi Kaskas: Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Almighty, the Ever-Forgiving."

67.Safi Kaskas: Say, "It is tremendous news,

68.Safi Kaskas: yet you ignore it.

69.Safi Kaskas: I had no knowledge of what those on high bicker about,

70.Safi Kaskas: had it not been revealed to me. However, I am but a clear warner."

71.Safi Kaskas: [So mention] when your Lord said to the angels, " I am going to create a human being from clay,

72.Safi Kaskas: and when I have proportioned him and breathed of My spirit into him, then prostrate yourselves to him."

73.Safi Kaskas: The angels prostrated, all of them together,

74.Safi Kaskas: except Iblis ; he was arrogant and became a [rebel] who denied the truth.

75.Safi Kaskas: [God] said, "Iblis , what prevented you from prostrating yourself to what I created with My hands? Is it your arrogance, or do you think that you are so high above all others?"

76.Safi Kaskas: He said, "I am better than him. You created me from fire and created him from clay."

77.Safi Kaskas: [God] said, "Then be gone, you are expelled,

78.Safi Kaskas: and My curse will follow you until the Day of Judgment."

79.Safi Kaskas: [Iblis ] said, "My Lord, reprieve me until the Day they are resurrected."

80.Safi Kaskas: [God] said, "You are reprieved

81.Safi Kaskas: until the Day of the time well-known."

82.Safi Kaskas: [Iblis] said, "By your might, I will mislead them all,

83.Safi Kaskas: except for Your devoted worshipers among them."

84.Safi Kaskas: [God] said, "This is the Truth, and the Truth do I speak:

85.Safi Kaskas: I will fill Hell with you and those of them that follow you, all of you together."

86.Safi Kaskas: SAY : " I ask from you no reward for this [message], and I am not one of those who claim to be what they are not.

87.Safi Kaskas: This is no less than a reminder to all the worlds,

88.Safi Kaskas: and you will come to grasp its significance in the fullness of time!"

1.Safi Kaskas: This Book is sent down to you from God, the Almighty, the Wise.

2.Safi Kaskas: We have sent down the Book to you in Truth, so worship God, sincere in your faith in Him alone.

3.Safi Kaskas: Pure faith is owed to God alone. Those who take protectors besides Him [say], "We worship them only so that they may bring us nearer to God." God will judge between them concerning their differences.  God does not guide any liar and denier of the truth.

4.Safi Kaskas: If God had intended to take a son, He could have chosen anyone He willed from whatever He created, may He be exalted in His glory!  He is God, the One God, the One who holds absolute sway over all that exists.

5.Safi Kaskas: He created the heavens and earth in Truth. He wraps the night over the day and wraps the day over the night, and has made the sun and the moon subservient [to His laws], each running [its course] for an appointed time. He is the Almighty, the Ever-Forgiving.

6.Safi Kaskas: He created you from a single soul, from which He made its mate, and He gave you eight kinds of grazing livestock in pairs [male and female]. He creates you in your mothers' wombs, one creation after another, within threefold of darkness. That is God, your Lord; to Him belongs all Sovereignty. There is no deity except Him, so how can you lose site of the truth?

7.Safi Kaskas: If you deny the truth, God has no need of you. Yet He does not approve of ingratitude in His servants, but, if you do show gratitude, He welcomes it in you. No bearer of burdens will bear the burdens of another. Then you will return to your Lord, and He will inform you of what you have done.  He knows what is within your hearts.

8.Safi Kaskas: When a human being encounters some hard times, he calls upon his Lord, turning to Him [in repentance], but when He blesses him with His favors, he forgets his Lord whom he called before and he sets up equals to God in order to mislead others from His way. Say, "Enjoy your unbelief for a little, for you are included among the inhabitants of the Fire."

9.Safi Kaskas: Is one who worships devoutly during periods of the night-bowing down and standing [in prayer], being mindful of the Hereafter, and hoping for his Lord's mercy-[like one who does not]? Say, "Are those who know equal to those who do not know?" Only those who have understanding will keep this in mind.

10.Safi Kaskas: Say, "O My worshipers who have believed, be ever mindful of your Lord.  Good [reward] awaits those who persevere in doing good in this world. [Remember that] God's earth is spacious. They who are patient will be given their reward beyond all account."

11.Safi Kaskas: Say, "I have been commanded to worship God, dedicating my faith to Him.

12.Safi Kaskas: And I have been commanded to be the first [among you] to submit."

13.Safi Kaskas: Say," I fear the punishment of a terrible Day should I disobey my Lord."

14.Safi Kaskas: Say, "God [alone] do I worship, sincere to Him in my faith,

15.Safi Kaskas: so worship what you will besides Him." Say, "Truly doomed are the ones who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Truly, that is a self-evident loss."

16.Safi Kaskas: They will have curtains of fire above them and below them. With this God puts fear into His worshipers. So be ever mindful of Me, My worshipers.

17.Safi Kaskas: Those who have avoided the worship of false deities and turned toward God will have good news, so give good news to My worshipers

18.Safi Kaskas: who listen to what is said and follow what is best. Those are the ones God has guided, and those are the people endowed with insight.

19.Safi Kaskas: As for one who deserved the decree of punishment, can you [Prophet] save one who is already in the Fire?

20.Safi Kaskas: But those who are mindful of their Lord, for them are dwellings built one above the other, beneath which rivers flow. [This is] God's promise and God does not fail to deliver [His] promise.

21.Safi Kaskas: Do you not see that God sends down rain from the sky and guides it through the earth to flow as springs? Then with it He produces vegetation of varying colors, which later withers, and you see it turning yellow, then He turns it into waste. That is a reminder for those endowed with insight.

22.Safi Kaskas: Is one whose heart God has opened to submit to Him and who has received enlightenment from his Lord [like one whose heart rejects God]? Misery, then, to those whose hearts are hardened even more by the mention of God. They are clearly lost.

23.Safi Kaskas: God has sent down the best of narrations: a Book that is perfectly consistent within itself, repeating various statements [of the Truth] in forms that causes the skin of those who revere their Lord to shiver [in awe], after which their skin and their hearts soften at the mention of God. Such is God's guidance; He guides with it [the Qur'an] whoever is willing to be guided, but no one can guide those God leaves to stray.

24.Safi Kaskas: What about someone who shields his face against the worst of punishment on the Day of Resurrection [is he like one secure from it]? [On that day] it will be said to the unjust, "Taste what you have earned."

25.Safi Kaskas: Those before them also denied the truth, and punishment came upon them before they realize what is happening.

26.Safi Kaskas: God made them taste disgrace in this worldly life, but the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.

27.Safi Kaskas: We have cited in this Qur'an every [kind of] example for people, so that they might remember.

28.Safi Kaskas: [It is] an Arabic Qur'an, without any distortion, so that they might become mindful.

29.Safi Kaskas: [To this end], God presents an example: [consider] a man owned by quarreling partners, and another [who is] devoted exclusively to one master, are they considered equal in status? All praise be to God! But most of them do not know.

30.Safi Kaskas: You will die, and they will die.

31.Safi Kaskas: Then, on the Day of Resurrection, you will dispute with each other before your Lord.

32.Safi Kaskas: So who is more unjust than one who invents lies about God and denies the Truth when it has come to him? Is there not [enough] room in Hell for the unbelievers?

33.Safi Kaskas: He who promotes the truth and testifies to it, it is they who are mindful of God.

34.Safi Kaskas: They will have with their Lord whatever they desire. This is the reward for those who do good;

35.Safi Kaskas: that God may remove from them the worst of their deeds and reward them according to the best of what they have done.

36.Safi Kaskas: Is not God adequately sufficient for His worshiper? [Yet], they threaten you with others beside Him. If God allows someone to be lost, for him there is no guide,

37.Safi Kaskas: and whomever God guides, no one can mislead him. Is not God Almighty and capable of retribution?

38.Safi Kaskas: If you asked them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" They would say, "God." So say, "Then do you see those you pray to besides God? If God wishes to harm me, can they remove His harm; or if He wants to show me a blessing, can they withhold His blessing?" Say, "God suffices for me; all those who truly trust put their trust in Him"

39.Safi Kaskas: Say, "My people, do all you can, and so will I. Eventually you will know

40.Safi Kaskas: who will receive a shameful punishment, and on whom will fall a lasting punishment."

41.Safi Kaskas: We sent down to you the Book offering the Truth to humankind. So whoever is guided, it is for his own good; and he who strays only does so to his own detriment. You are not their guardian.

42.Safi Kaskas: God retrieves people's souls at the time of their death, and the souls of the living during their sleep. He then keeps those for which He has decreed death and releases the others until an appointed term.  There are signs in this for people who reflect.

43.Safi Kaskas: Or have they taken intercessors besides God? Say, "Even though they do not have any power, nor do they reason?"

44.Safi Kaskas: Say, "To God belongs all intercession. To Him belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. Then to Him you will all return."

45.Safi Kaskas: The hearts of those who do not believe in the Hereafter shrink with disgust when God alone is mentioned, but when those other than Him are mentioned, they suddenly rejoice.

46.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Our God, the Programmer of the heavens and the earth, Knower of all that is beyond our ability to witness and all that we can witness, You will judge between your worshipers concerning their differences."

47.Safi Kaskas: If the unjust owned everything on earth and the like of it with it, they would gladly offer it to ransom themselves from the terrible suffering on the Day of Resurrection, but there will appear to them from God what they never expected.

48.Safi Kaskas: The evils of their deeds will become clear to them, and they will be surrounded by what they used to ridicule.

49.Safi Kaskas: If hard times touch man, he calls on Us. Then, when We favor him with a Our blessing, he says, "I have only been given this only because of my knowledge." In fact, it is only a test, though most of them do not know.

50.Safi Kaskas: Those [who lived] before them said [the same thing], but what they had earned did not do them any good,

51.Safi Kaskas: for the evil of their deeds caught up with them. [Similarly,] the evil deeds of those who have wronged themselves among these people will also catch up with them, and they will not be able to evade God.

52.Safi Kaskas: Do they not know that God expands and restricts His provision for whomever He wills? In this are signs for a People who believe.

53.Safi Kaskas: Say, "My worshipers who have transgressed against themselves do not despair of God's mercy, for God forgives all sins. He is the Ever-Forgiving, the Mercy-Giver."

54.Safi Kaskas: Turn in repentance to your Lord and submit to Him before the punishment comes upon you and you cannot be helped.

55.Safi Kaskas: Follow the best teaching sent down to you from your Lord before the punishment comes upon you suddenly, when you are not expecting it,

56.Safi Kaskas: so that a soul may not say, "How sorry I am for having neglected my duty to God and having been among the mockers;"

57.Safi Kaskas: or say, "Had God guided me, I would have been among those who are mindful of God;"

58.Safi Kaskas: or say, when it sees the punishment, "If only I had another chance to be among those who do good."

59.Safi Kaskas: [But God will reply] "No! My verses did come to you, but you denied them, turned arrogant, and denied the truth.

60.Safi Kaskas: On the Day of Resurrection you will see those who lied about God with their faces darkened [by grief and sorrow]. Is not Hell the proper place for the arrogant?

61.Safi Kaskas: God will save those who were mindful of Him by the virtue of their successful choices; no harm will touch them, nor will they grieve.

62.Safi Kaskas: God is the Creator of all things, and He is the Guardian over all things.

63.Safi Kaskas: The keys of the heavens and the earth are His. Those who reject the verses of God, it is they who are the doomed.

64.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Do you order me to worship something other than God, you ignorant people?"

65.Safi Kaskas: Yet, It has already been revealed to you, and to those before you, that "If you should associate [anything] with God, your work will be in vain, and you will surely be among the doomed.

66.Safi Kaskas: Then, worship [only] God and be among the grateful."

67.Safi Kaskas: [The unbelievers] have not valued God the way He ought to be valued. The whole earth will lie within His grasp on the Day of Resurrection, while heaven will be folded up in His right hand. May He be exalted in His glory, high above anything they associate with Him.

68.Safi Kaskas: The Horn will be blown, and whoever is in the heavens and the earth will be stunned, except whom God wills. Then it will be blown again, and they will stand, looking on.

69.Safi Kaskas: And the earth will shine with the light of its Lord. The Book will be set in place, and the prophets and the witnesses will be brought in. Judgment will be passed among them equitably, and they will not be wronged.

70.Safi Kaskas: Every soul will be fully compensated [for] what it has done, for He knows best what they do.

71.Safi Kaskas: Those who denied the truth will be driven to Hell in crowds. When they reach it, its gates will open and its custodians will say, "Did not messengers from among you come to you, reciting to you the verses of your Lord, and warning you of the meeting of this Day of yours?" They will say, "Yes, but the decree of punishment is justified against the unbelievers.

72.Safi Kaskas: They will be told, "Enter the gates of Hell and stay there eternally. How evil is the residence of the arrogant."

73.Safi Kaskas: But those who were mindful of their Lord will be driven to Paradise in crowds. When they reach it, its gates will open, and custodians will say, "Peace be upon you; you have done well, so enter it to reside there eternally."

74.Safi Kaskas: And they will say, "Praise be to God, who has fulfilled His promise to us and made us inherit the land, letting us settle in Paradise wherever we will. How excellent is the reward for those who act on their faith."

75.Safi Kaskas: You will see the angels hovering around the Throne of His majesty, glorifying their Lord with praise. It will be judged between them equitably, and it will be said, "All praise be to God, Lord of the worlds."

1.Safi Kaskas: Ha Meem,

2.Safi Kaskas: the revelation of the Book is from God, the Almighty, the All-knowing.

3.Safi Kaskas: Forgiver of sin, Acceptor of repentance, Severe in punishment and Infinite in favor, there is no god except Him, and to Him is the ultimate return.

4.Safi Kaskas: No one argues about God's signs except the unbelievers, so do not be deceived by their freedom to move around in the land.

5.Safi Kaskas: Before them the people of Noah rejected the truth, as did the parties after them. Every nation plotted to destroy their messenger and argued to defeat truth with falsehood. So, I seized them. What a punishment it was.

6.Safi Kaskas: In this way, your Lord's sentence was passed against those who denied the truth, that they would be the inhabitants of the Fire.

7.Safi Kaskas: Those who carry the Throne of His majesty, and those around it, praise their Lord's limitless glory, and believe in Him, and ask forgiveness for the believers, [saying], "Our Lord, Your mercy and knowledge have encompassed all things, so forgive those who repent and follow Your path, and spare them from the punishment of Hell.

8.Safi Kaskas: Our Lord, admit them to Gardens of Eden, which You have promised them, together with the righteous among their fathers, their spouses and their offspring.  You are the Almighty, the Wise.

9.Safi Kaskas: And guide them away [from committing] evil deeds. You would be Merciful that Day to anyone you have guided away [from committing] evil deeds, and that is the supreme triumph."

10.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers will be told [on the same Day], "When you were called to believe and rejected it, God's disgust with you was even greater than the self-disgust you now feel."

11.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "Our Lord, twice You caused us to die, and twice You gave us life. We now admit our sins.  Is there possibly a way out?"

12.Safi Kaskas: [They will be told] "That is because, when God alone was called upon, you denied Him, but when others were associated with Him, you believed.  Judgment belongs to God, the Most High, the Most Great."

13.Safi Kaskas: It is He who shows you His signs, and sends down provisions from the sky to sustain you, but only the one who turns to God will take heed,

14.Safi Kaskas: so call upon God and dedicate your faith sincerely to Him, even though it is resented by unbelievers.

15.Safi Kaskas: He is high above [all] ranks, the Lord of the Throne. He confers the Spirit by His command on whoever He wills of His worshipers to warn of the Day when they will meet Him.

16.Safi Kaskas: The Day they will emerge, when nothing about them is concealed from God. "To whom belongs [all] sovereignty this Day?" "To God, the One, the All-Conquering."

17.Safi Kaskas: This Day every soul will be rewarded for what it earned. There will be no injustice today, for God is swift to settle accounts.

18.Safi Kaskas: And warn them, of the Imminent Day, when the hearts are at the throats, choking them. The unjust will have no dependable friend and no intercessor [who is] obeyed.

19.Safi Kaskas: God knows the eyes' deceptive glances and what the hearts conceal.

20.Safi Kaskas: God judges with Truth, while those besides Him whom they invoke will not judge with anything at all.  It is God who is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing.

21.Safi Kaskas: Have they not traveled through the land and seen the fate of those [who lived] before them? They were mightier than they are, and they left more impact on the land, but God seized them for their sins, and they had no protector from God.

22.Safi Kaskas: This is because they repeatedly rejected the self-evident signs their messengers brought them, so God seized them.  He is All-Strong and severe in punishment.

23.Safi Kaskas: We sent Moses with Our signs and a clear authority

24.Safi Kaskas: to Pharaoh, Haman and Korah, but they said, "[He is] a lying magician."

25.Safi Kaskas: Then, when he brought them the Truth from Us, they said, "Kill the sons of those who have believed with him and spare the women." But the schemes of the unbelievers can only fail.

26.Safi Kaskas: Pharaoh said, "Let me kill Moses and let him appeal to his Lord.  I fear that he may change your religion or spread disorder in the land."

27.Safi Kaskas: But Moses said, "I have sought refuge in my Lord and yours from every arrogant tyrant who does not believe in the Day of Reckoning."

28.Safi Kaskas: A believing man from Pharaoh's family, who concealed his faith, said, "Are you going to kill a man [merely] because he says, 'My Lord is God, 'when he has brought you clear signs from your Lord? If he is lying, then the consequence of his lie will be on him, but if he is truthful, then some of what he promises you will happen to you.  God does not guide the blatant liars.

29.Safi Kaskas: My people, you reign today, masters in the land, but who will protect us from God's mighty punishment if it should come to us?" Pharaoh said, "I show you only what I see, and I am guiding you along the right path."

30.Safi Kaskas: But the believer said, "My people, I fear for you a day as befell the parties [who opposed their messengers],

31.Safi Kaskas: Like what happen to Noah's people, Aad and Thamud and those after them. God does not want any injustice for His worshipers.

32.Safi Kaskas: My people, I fear for you the Day of Calling

33.Safi Kaskas: the Day when you will turn away, hoping to flee, with no one to protect you from God. Whomever God allows to stray has no guide.

34.Safi Kaskas: Joseph had already come to you with clear evidence, but you never stopped doubting what he brought to you until, when he perished, you said, 'God will never send a messenger after him.' This is how God lets those who never cease doubting to stray."

35.Safi Kaskas: Those who argue about God's revelations without having been given an authority are doing something despised by God and by those who believe. This is how God seals up the heart of every arrogant tyrant.

36.Safi Kaskas: [Then] Pharaoh said, "Haman, build me a tower that I may gain means of access,

37.Safi Kaskas: access to the heavens, so that I may have a look at this god of Moses, though I think he is a liar." This is how Pharaoh's evil deeds were made to appear good to him, and he was diverted from the [right] way. Pharaoh's scheming led to nothing but ruin.

38.Safi Kaskas: But he who believed said, "My people, follow me, I will guide you through the correct path.

39.Safi Kaskas: My people, this worldly life is only temporary enjoyment, but the Hereafter is the lasting home.

40.Safi Kaskas: Whoever does a bad deed will be repaid with its like, but whoever does good and is a believer, whether male or female, they will enter Paradise, where they will be provided for without measure.

41.Safi Kaskas: My people, how is it that I call you to salvation while you call me to the Fire?

42.Safi Kaskas: You call me to deny God and to associate with Him something of which I have no knowledge, whereas I call you to the Almighty, the Ever-Forgiving.

43.Safi Kaskas: Without a doubt, that to which you call me has no foundation either in this world or in the Hereafter, [nor is there doubt] that our return is to God, whereas those who overstate (their disbelieve] shall inhabit the Fire.

44.Safi Kaskas: You will remember what I say to you, so I entrust myself to God, for God is well aware of [His] worshipers."

45.Safi Kaskas: So God protected him from the evils they plotted, while a terrible punishment encompassed Pharaoh's clan,

46.Safi Kaskas: the Fire, to which they will be exposed morning and evening. On the Day the Hour comes [it will be said], "Admit Pharaoh's clan to the most intense punishment."

47.Safi Kaskas: In the Fire, they will bicker, and the meek will say to those who were arrogant, "We were your followers, so can you provide us some relief from the Fire?"

48.Safi Kaskas: But those who were arrogant will say, "We are all in it together.  God has judged between the worshipers."

49.Safi Kaskas: Those in the Fire will say to the keepers of Hell, "Pray to your Lord to lighten our punishment for a day."

50.Safi Kaskas: [The keepers] will say, "Did not your messengers come to you with clear evidence?" They will say, "Yes." [The keepers] will reply, "Then pray [yourselves], but the prayers of the unbelievers will always be in vain."

51.Safi Kaskas: We will surely support Our Messengers and those who believe during this life; and, on the Day when the witnesses arise

52.Safi Kaskas: The Day when excuses will not benefit the unjust- they will be rejected and they will have the worst of homes.

53.Safi Kaskas: We gave Moses guidance, and We made the Children of Israel heirs to the Book

54.Safi Kaskas: as guidance and a reminder for those with understanding.

55.Safi Kaskas: Be patient, for God's promise is true. And ask forgiveness for your sin, and glorify your Lord with praise evening and morning.

56.Safi Kaskas: Those who dispute God's revelations without any authority to do so have nothing within their hearts except arrogance, which they will never be able to satisfy, so seek refuge in God, for He is the All-Hearing, the All-Seeing.

57.Safi Kaskas: The creation of the heavens and earth is far greater than the creation of human beings, but most people do not know.

58.Safi Kaskas: The blind and the seeing are not the same, nor are those who believe and do good deeds equal to the evildoers. How seldom you reflect.

59.Safi Kaskas: The Hour is sure to come, there is no doubt about it, but most people do not believe.

60.Safi Kaskas: Your Lord says, "Call upon Me, and I will answer you, but those who are too proud to worship Me will enter Hell, humiliated."

61.Safi Kaskas: It is God who made the night for you so that you may rest, and the day [so that you may] see.  God is truly gracious to people, but most people are not thankful.

62.Safi Kaskas: Such is God, your Lord, Creator of all things. There is no God but Him, so how can you be so misled?

63.Safi Kaskas: Thus it is: those who reject God's signs are misled.

64.Safi Kaskas: It is God who made the earth for you to settle and the heaven as a canopy. He designed you, and perfected your design, and provided you with wholesome things. Such is God, your Lord, so blessed be God, Lord of the worlds.

65.Safi Kaskas: He is the Ever-Living. There is no God except Him, so call on Him, making your faith sincerely His. Praise be to God, Lord of the worlds.

66.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Now that clear evidence has come to me from my Lord, I have been prohibited from worshiping those you call upon besides God, and I am commanded to submit to the Lord of the worlds."

67.Safi Kaskas: It is He who created you from dust, then from a fertilized ovum, then from a clinging leach like; then He brings you out as infants; then He allows you to reach maturity; and then you become elderly, although some of you die sooner-so that you may reach a predetermined age, and perhaps you may understand.

68.Safi Kaskas: It is He who gives life and death; when He decides on a thing, He simply says, "Be," and It is.

69.Safi Kaskas: Do you not see how misled are those who dispute God's signs,

70.Safi Kaskas: those who deny the Book and the messages We sent with Our Messengers? They will surely come to know,

71.Safi Kaskas: when they have shackles and chains around their necks, and are dragged

72.Safi Kaskas: in boiling water, and are then thrown into the Fire, where they will be consumed.

73.Safi Kaskas: It will then be said to them, "Where are those [associates] whom you used to consider divine

74.Safi Kaskas: other than God?" They will say, "They have departed from us; or, rather, those we used to call upon proved to be nothing. [They will be told,] "This is how God let those who deny the truth stray,

75.Safi Kaskas: all because you used to rejoice on earth in things other than the truth, and you were full of vanity.

76.Safi Kaskas: Enter the gates of Hell, to remain there eternally, a terrible home for the arrogant."

77.Safi Kaskas: So be patient, [Prophet,] for God's promise is true. Whether We show you some of what We have promised them or We cause you to die, It is to Us that they will be returned.

78.Safi Kaskas: We have sent messengers before you. Some We have told you about, and others We did not. No messenger can produce a miracle except with God's permission. Then, when God's command comes, just judgment will be passed, and those who followed falsehood will be lost then and there.

79.Safi Kaskas: It is God who made the domestic animals, some for you to ride, and some to eat.

80.Safi Kaskas: You have other benefits from them as well. You can reach any destination you wish on them, and on them and on ships, you are transported.

81.Safi Kaskas: And [thus] He shows you His signs. So, which of God's signs do you deny?

82.Safi Kaskas: Have they not traveled through the land and seen the fate of those who lived before them? They were more numerous than they are, and had greater power, and left more impressive marks on the land. Yet what they achieved was of no use to them.

83.Safi Kaskas: When their messengers came to them with self-evident signs, they showed satisfaction with the knowledge they had, and so they were engulfed by the very punishment they had mocked.

84.Safi Kaskas: Then, when they saw Our might, they said," We believe in God alone, and we reject what we used to associate with Him."

85.Safi Kaskas: But believing after seeing Our might did not help them at all. This has been God's way of dealing with His worshipers, and those who denied the truth were lost, then and there.

41.SurahEnglishNames: Explained in Detail, Revelations Well Expounded

1.Safi Kaskas: Ha Meem,
