2.Safi Kaskas: revelations have come down to you from the Merciful-to-All, the Mercy Giver,

3.Safi Kaskas: a Book whose verses have been made clear, an Arabic Qur'an for people who know,

4.Safi Kaskas: giving good news and warning. Yet, most of them turn away, so they do not hear,

5.Safi Kaskas: and they say, "There is a barrier between our hearts and what you call us to, and there is heaviness in our ears. There is a curtain between us and you. So do whatever you want, and so shall we."

6.Safi Kaskas: Say, "I am only a human like you. It has been revealed to me that your god is but One God. So be upright towards Him, and seek His forgiveness." How terrible it is for the idolaters,

7.Safi Kaskas: those who do not give the purifying alms and refuse to believe in the Hereafter.

8.Safi Kaskas: Those who believe and do good deeds will have an endless reward.

9.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Do you deny the One who created the earth in two days, and attribute equals to Him? That is the Lord of the worlds."

10.Safi Kaskas: He placed firm mountains over it, and He blessed it and apportioned its provisions to all who would seek them, [all] in four days.

11.Safi Kaskas: Then He turned to the Heaven while it was smoke and said to it and to the earth, "Come willingly or unwillingly." They said, "We come willingly."

12.Safi Kaskas: He decreed that they are seven heavens in two days, and He revealed to each its mandate. And We decorated the lower heaven with lanterns and protection. Such is the design of the Almighty, the All-Knowing.

13.Safi Kaskas: If they turn away, say, "I have warned you of a thunderbolt like the one which struck Aad and Thamud

14.Safi Kaskas: when their messengers came to them from all around them, saying "Do not worship anyone but God." They said, "Had our Lord willed, He would have sent down angels; therefore, we reject the message with which you were sent."

15.Safi Kaskas: As for Aad, they were arrogant in the land, opposed justice, and said, "Who could have a power greater than ours?" Did they not see that God who created them is more powerful than they? But they continued to reject Our signs,

16.Safi Kaskas: so We sent a screaming wind upon them for a few miserable days to make them taste the punishment of disgrace in this worldly life; but the punishment of the Hereafter will be more humiliating, and they will not be helped.

17.Safi Kaskas: As for Thamud, We guided them, but they preferred blindness over guidance, so the thunderbolt of humiliating punishment seized them, just as they deserved.

18.Safi Kaskas: And We saved those who believed and were mindful of God.

19.Safi Kaskas: On the Day when God's enemies will be herded to the Fire, driven in rows,

20.Safi Kaskas: until, when they have reached it, their hearing, their sight and their skins will testify against them concerning what they were doing.

21.Safi Kaskas: They will ask their skins, "Why did you testified against us?" They will say, "God, who gave speech to everything, has given us speech; it is He Who created you the first time, and to Him you will return.

22.Safi Kaskas: You did not even try to conceal yourselves from your hearing or your sights or your skins to prevent them from testifying against you, but you assumed that God did not know much of what you were doing.

23.Safi Kaskas: It is this thought which you assumed about your Lord that led you to ruin, so that you became doomed.

24.Safi Kaskas: So [even] if they are patient, the Fire will be their home, and if they plead for a favor, none will be given them,

25.Safi Kaskas: [for] We had assigned them companions, who made what is before them and what was behind them seem alluring. But the sentence has already been passed against them, together with generations of jinn and men before them: they were doomed.

26.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers say, "Do not listen to this Qur'an but talk over it, so that you may prevail."

27.Safi Kaskas: But We will surely cause the unbelievers to taste a severe punishment, and We will reward them according to the worst of their deeds.

28.Safi Kaskas: Such is the repayment of God's enemies, the Fire, where they will have their permanent home as payment for having disregarded Our revelations.

29.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers will say, "Our Lord, show us those jinn and men who misled us; we will trample them under our feet so that they become the lowest of the low."

30.Safi Kaskas: Those who say, "Our Lord is God," and then stay on the right course, on them the angels will descend on them and say, "Do not fear or grieve, but [rather] rejoice in the news of Paradise, which you have been promised

31.Safi Kaskas: we are your allies in this life and in the Hereafter, where you will have whatever your souls desire, and you will have whatever you wish

32.Safi Kaskas: as a welcoming  gift from the Most Forgiving, the Mercy Giver."

33.Safi Kaskas: Who speaks better than someone who calls people to God, does good deeds, and says, "I am among those who submit to God."

34.Safi Kaskas: Good and evil are never equal. Repel evil with good, and your enemy will become like an intimate friend.

35.Safi Kaskas: But, none will attain it except those who are steadfast in patience, and none will attain it except the very fortunate.

36.Safi Kaskas: And when a temptation from Satan provokes you, seek refuge in God; He is the All-Hearing and the All-knowing.

37.Safi Kaskas: Among His signs are the night, the day, the sun and the moon. Do not bow down in worship to the sun, nor to the moon, but bow down to God, Who created them, if it is Him that you worship.

38.Safi Kaskas: But if they respond arrogantly, [it matters not] for those who are near your Lord praise His limitless glory by night and by day, and never grow tired.

39.Safi Kaskas: Another of His signs is that you see the earth humbly desolate, but when We send down rain on it, it quivers and swells.  He who revived it will revive the dead. He has power over all things.

40.Safi Kaskas: Those who distort Our verses are not hidden from Us. Does he who is thrown into the Fire fare better than he who will arrive securely on the Day of Resurrection? Do what you want; He Sees everything you do.

41.Safi Kaskas: Those who reject this Reminder after it has come to them [are losers], as it is a mighty Book

42.Safi Kaskas: that falsehood cannot approach neither openly or secretly, [one] sent down from the All-Wise and Praiseworthy.

43.Safi Kaskas: Nothing has been said to you [Prophet] that was not said to the messengers before you.  Your Lord is a Lord of Forgiveness, but also of painful punishment.

44.Safi Kaskas: Had We made it a Qur'an in a foreign language, they would have said, "If only its verses were made clear." What? A [book in a] foreign language to an Arab?" Say, "It is guidance and healing for those who believe, but for those who do not believe, it is heaviness in their ears, and it is blindness for them, as if they were being called from a distant place."

45.Safi Kaskas: We gave Moses the Book, but there was disagreement about it, and had it not for a prior decree from your Lord, their differences would already have been settled. But they are still suspicious and in doubt about it.

46.Safi Kaskas: Whoever does good works, does so for his own soul; and whoever does evil, does so to its detriment. Your Lord is never unjust to His worshipers.

47.Safi Kaskas: Knowledge of the Hour belongs solely to him; no fruit emerges from its husk nor does a female conceive or give birth without His knowledge. On the Day when He calls out to them, "Where are My associates?" They will then say, "We admit to You, none of us witnessed any.

48.Safi Kaskas: What they used to pray to before will forsake them, and they will realize that they have no escape.

49.Safi Kaskas: A human being never tires of praying for good things; but when hard times afflict him, he despairs and loses hope.

50.Safi Kaskas: And if We let him taste mercy from Us, after hard times have afflicted him, he will say, "This is my due, and I do not think the Hour [of Judgment] is going to come; but even if I were to be returned to my Lord, I will [surely] have the very best reward from Him." But We will inform the unbelievers of what they did, and We will make them taste an awful punishment.

51.Safi Kaskas: And whenever We're gracious to a human being, he turns away and distances himself, but when hard times touch him, he starts endless prayers.

52.Safi Kaskas: Say, "What if this revelation is truly from God, and you are rejecting it? Who is more misguided than he who is cutoff and alienated [from God]?"

53.Safi Kaskas: We will show them Our signs on the horizons and in themselves, until it is clear to them that this is the Truth. Is it not sufficient that your Lord is a Witness over all things?

54.Safi Kaskas: Surely, they are in doubt about meeting their Lord. Surely, He encompasses everything.

1.Safi Kaskas: Ha Meem.

2.Safi Kaskas: A'yn Seen Qaf,

3.Safi Kaskas: thus God, the Almighty, the Wise reveals to you, as He did to those before you.

4.Safi Kaskas: To Him belongs everything in the heavens and everything on earth. He is the Most High, the Most Great.

5.Safi Kaskas: The heavens above them almost burst apart [from awe of Him], while the angels praise their Lord's limitless glory and ask forgiveness for those on earth. God is indeed the Ever Forgiving, the Mercy giver.

6.Safi Kaskas: As for those who take others than Him as protectors, God is in charge of them and you are not their keeper.

7.Safi Kaskas: Thus We have revealed to you an Arabic Qur'an that you may warn this main city and all others around it and to give warning of the Day of Gathering, about which there is no doubt, when some will be in the Garden and some in the Blazing Fire.

8.Safi Kaskas: Had God willed, He could have made them one community, but He admits into His mercy him that wills. As for the unjust, they will have no protector and no helper.

9.Safi Kaskas: Or do they think that they have protectors other than Him? God is the Protector, for He gives life to the dead, and He is able to do all things.

10.Safi Kaskas: Whatever matters you differ about, is for God to judge. Such is God, my Lord, in whom I trust, and unto Him I repent,

11.Safi Kaskas: the Creator of the heavens and earth who separated them and gave each a purpose. He has made mates for you from among yourselves, and gave mates to the animals, so that you may multiply. There is nothing like Him. He is the All-Hearing, the All- Seeing.

12.Safi Kaskas: To Him belongs control of the heavens and the earth. He provides abundantly or scarcely to whoever He wills.  He is, the All-knowing.

13.Safi Kaskas: He has ordained for you the same faith He commanded Noah, and what We have revealed to you, and what We commanded Abraham and Moses and Jesus: "You shall uphold the faith and do not break up into factions." Although what you are calling the idolaters to do is too hard for them. [However] God draws to Himself everyone who is willing, and guides unto Himself everyone who turns to Him.

14.Safi Kaskas: Yet they [the followers] split into factions, out of rivalry between them only after they came to know the truth. Judgment between them would have been pronounced, were it not for a decision from your Lord to postpone it until a set time. Yet those who have inherited the Book after them are in grave doubt about it.

15.Safi Kaskas: Therefore, go on inviting them and stay the course as you have been commanded. Do not follow their whims and desires but say, "I have believed in what God has sent down of the Book, and I have been commanded to judge equitably between you. God is our Lord and your Lord. We have our deeds, and you have your deeds. Let there be no quarrel between us and you. God will bring us all together, and to Him is the ultimate return."

16.Safi Kaskas: And those who argue about God after having answered His call, their argument has no basis whatsoever with their Lord. Anger enfolds them, and a severe punishment awaits them.

17.Safi Kaskas: It is God who has sent down the Book with the Truth and the Balance. For all you know, the Hour might be near.

18.Safi Kaskas: Those who do not believe in it seek to hasten it; but those who believe are concerned about it, as they know it is the Truth. Unquestionably, those who question the Hour are in extreme error.

19.Safi Kaskas: God is very gentle with His worshipers; He provides for whomever He wills. He is the All- Powerful, the Almighty.

20.Safi Kaskas: If anyone desires the harvest of the Hereafter, We will increase for him his harvest.  And if he desires the harvest of this world, We will give him a share of it, but He will have no share of the Hereafter.

21.Safi Kaskas: Or do they have partners who have ordained for them some faith that is not authorized by God? Were it not for [God's] decisive word, Judgment would have been made between them. The unjust will have a painful punishment.

22.Safi Kaskas: You will see the unjust worried about what they have committed, as they will have to answer for it. While those who have believed and done good deeds are in flowering meadows of the Gardens, having whatever they wish from their Lord: that is the supreme blessing.

23.Safi Kaskas: This is the good news God gives to His worshipers who believe and do good deeds.Say, "I do not ask you any wage for it, except affection due to kin." Whoever does a good deed, We will increase it for him. God is Ever Forgiving and Most Appreciative.

24.Safi Kaskas: Or do they say, "He falsely claimed lies about God?"  If God so willed, He could have sealed your heart, exterminated falsehood and confirmed the Truth with His Words.  He has full Knowledge of what is in the hearts.

25.Safi Kaskas: It is He who accepts repentance from his worshipers and forgives bad deeds, He knows what you do.

26.Safi Kaskas: He answers those who have believed and done good deeds and increases for them out of His grace. But the unbelievers will have a severe punishment.

27.Safi Kaskas: Were God to expand provision to His worshipers, they would have committed tyranny on earth. But He sends down whatever He wills in due measures. He is, well Acquainted and Fully Aware of His worshipers.

28.Safi Kaskas: It is He who sends down the rain after they have lost hope and unfolds His mercy. He is the Protector, the Praiseworthy.

29.Safi Kaskas: Among His signs is the creation of the heavens and earth and the creatures He has spread throughout them: He is Able to gather them together if He so wishes.

30.Safi Kaskas: Whatever disaster strikes you, It is for what your hands have done; Yet He forgives much.

31.Safi Kaskas: On earth you will not be beyond God's reach. You do not have any protector or helper besides God.

32.Safi Kaskas: Among His Signs are ships floating like mountains through the sea.

33.Safi Kaskas: If He wills, He could have settled down the winds, leaving them motionless on its surface. Surely in that are signs for every patient and grateful person.

34.Safi Kaskas: Or He could destroy them for what they have earned; yet He pardons much.

35.Safi Kaskas: Those who argue about Our signs know that there is no escape for them.

36.Safi Kaskas: Whatever you have been given is only the provision of this life. But that which is with God is better and more enduring for those who believe and trust in their Lord;

37.Safi Kaskas: those who avoid major sins and gross indecencies, and even if they become angry, they will forgive;

38.Safi Kaskas: and those who respond to their Lord, pray regularly, conduct their affairs by mutual consultation, and give of what We have provided for them;

39.Safi Kaskas: and those who, when tyranny strikes them, they defend themselves.

40.Safi Kaskas: The retribution for a bad deed is one like it, but whoever forgives and makes peace will have his reward with God. He certainly does not like those who do wrong.

41.Safi Kaskas: Yet whoever defends himself after having been wronged, there is no blame on them.

42.Safi Kaskas: Blame lies on those who wrong others and transgress in the land without any justification. Those will have a painful punishment.

43.Safi Kaskas: As for him who endures patiently and forgives, that is a sign of real resolve.

44.Safi Kaskas: Whoever God lets go astray will have no protector apart from Him. And you will see the transgressors, when they see the punishment, saying, "Is there a way of going back?"

45.Safi Kaskas: As they are exposed to the Fire, you will see them humbled from humiliation, glancing around covertly. While those who believed will say, "The losers are those who lost themselves and their kin on the Day of Resurrection." Verily, the unjust are in an enduring punishment

46.Safi Kaskas: they have no allies to support them apart from God. Anyone God lets go astray will find no way out.

47.Safi Kaskas: Respond to your Lord before a Day comes from God's judgment that cannot be turned back. You will have no refuge on that Day and no means of denial.

48.Safi Kaskas: But if they turn away, We did not send you as their guardian. Your only duty is to deliver the message. When We let man taste Our mercy, he rejoices in it; but if harm afflicts him for what his hands have done, then man turns to denial.

49.Safi Kaskas: The kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs to God. He creates what he wills. He gives daughters to whomever He wills, and He gives sons to whom He wills.

50.Safi Kaskas: Or, and He makes whom He wills sterile.  He is All-knowing and Able to do all things.

51.Safi Kaskas: God will not speak to any human being except by revelation or from behind a veil, or by sending a messenger who then reveals, by His permission, whatever He wills.  He is Most High and All Wise.

52.Safi Kaskas: Accordingly We have revealed to you a Spirit of Our command. You did not know what is the Book or what faith is, but We have made it an enlightenment, guiding with it whom We wish of Our worshipers. You indeed guide to a straight path

53.Safi Kaskas: the path of God, to whom belongs everything that is in the heavens and earth. Truly, all will eventually return to God.

43.SurahEnglishNames: Ornaments of Gold, Luxury, The Embellishment

1.Safi Kaskas: Ha Meem,

2.Safi Kaskas: by the Book that make things clear,

3.Safi Kaskas: We have caused it to be an Arabic Qur'an that you may understand.

4.Safi Kaskas: It is in the Source of the Book with Us, exalted and full of Wisdom.

5.Safi Kaskas: Should we then withdraw the Reminder from you, because you are excessive in your rejection?

6.Safi Kaskas: How many prophets We sent among the earlier people

7.Safi Kaskas: and they used to ridicule every one of them.

8.Safi Kaskas: We destroyed people mightier than these, and their example has gone down in history.

9.Safi Kaskas: And if you ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth?" they would say, "They were created by the Almighty, the All-knowing."

10.Safi Kaskas: It is He who made the earth a cradle for you and made pathways in it for you, that you might be guided.

11.Safi Kaskas: It is He who sends down rain from the sky in measured portions; We resurrect with it a dead town back to life. Similarly you will be brought forth.

12.Safi Kaskas: It is He who created the pairs, all of them, and has made it possible for you to ride ships and animals

13.Safi Kaskas: That you may settle on their backs and remember your Lord's blessings when you have settled and say. "Exalted in His glory is He who subjected this to us. We on our own would not have been able to have it.

14.Safi Kaskas: We will surely return to our Lord."

15.Safi Kaskas: Yet they attribute to Him only some of what He has created. Man is clearly ungrateful.

16.Safi Kaskas: Or has He taken daughters for himself and favored you with sons?

17.Safi Kaskas: Yet when any of them is given the good news of what he himself attributes to the Merciful, his face darkens, and he suppresses grief;

18.Safi Kaskas: what [am I to have a daughter], someone to be brought up in ornaments but cannot help in a fight?

19.Safi Kaskas: Yet, they designated the angels, who are created to worship the Merciful, as females. Have they witnessed their creation? Their claim will be recorded, and they will be questioned about it.

20.Safi Kaskas: They say, "If the Merciful willed it, we would not have worshipped them." But they do not know that. They are merely guessing.

21.Safi Kaskas: Or have We given them a Book prior to this one, to which they are adhering?

22.Safi Kaskas: No they say, but "We found our fathers following this path, and we are guided by their footsteps."

23.Safi Kaskas: Similarly, every time We sent someone before you to a town to warn them, those corrupted by abundance would say, "We found our fathers following this path, and we are following in their footsteps."

24.Safi Kaskas: Say, even if I bring you better guidance than what you found your fathers following?" They reply, "We reject, what You have been sent with."

25.Safi Kaskas: So we punish them; reflect then on the end of those who rejected the truth.

26.Safi Kaskas: And when Abraham said to his father and his people, "I have nothing to do with what you worship

27.Safi Kaskas: I worship only the One who created me and gave me purpose, He will guide me."

28.Safi Kaskas: He made this as an enduring word remaining among Abraham's descendants that they might return [to it)

29.Safi Kaskas: Now, I let these people of yours [Prophet] and their forefathers have some enjoyment, until the Truth and a messenger who made things clear came to them.

30.Safi Kaskas: But when the Truth came to them, they said, "This is magic and we refuse to believe it."

31.Safi Kaskas: They also said, "If only this Qur'an was sent down to a great man from the two cities."

32.Safi Kaskas: Is it they who distribute your Lord's blessing? It is We who have allocated their livelihood among them in this life. We have raised some of them in rank, so that some would hire others for service. But your Lord's mercy is better than whatever they accumulate.

33.Safi Kaskas: Were it not that people might become a single community, We would have provided those who deny the Merciful-to-all, silver roofs for their houses and silver stairways to ascend

34.Safi Kaskas: and silver doors to their houses and furnishings on which to recline,

35.Safi Kaskas: and gold ornaments. But all that is merely the possessions of this life, while the Hereafter with your Lord is for those who are mindful of Him.

36.Safi Kaskas: Whoever overlooks the remembrance of the Merciful, We assign him a devil, for a companion.

37.Safi Kaskas: They hinder them from the path, though they think they are guided.

38.Safi Kaskas: Then, when such a person comes to Us, he says [to his companion] "I wish you had been as far away from me as east is from west. What an evil companion."

39.Safi Kaskas: Since you were both unjust, It will not benefit you today to know, that you are partners in the punishment.

40.Safi Kaskas: Can you make the deaf hear, or guide the blind and whoever is clearly misguided?

41.Safi Kaskas: Whether We take you away, We will afflict retribution on them.

42.Safi Kaskas: Or, We show you what We have promised them; for We have perfect ability to control them.

43.Safi Kaskas: So adhere to what is revealed to you. You are on a straight path.

44.Safi Kaskas: It is a remembrance for you and your people, and you are all going to be questioned.

45.Safi Kaskas: Ask those of Our messengers We sent before you; did We ever appoint any deities besides the Merciful to be worshipped?

46.Safi Kaskas: We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his inner circle. He said, "I am the Messenger of the Lord of the worlds."

47.Safi Kaskas: But when he came to them with Our signs, they laughed at them.

48.Safi Kaskas: Each sign We showed them was more marvelous than the previous one. So We afflicted them with punishment, so that they might return.

49.Safi Kaskas: They said "Magician, pray to your Lord for us, as He has a covenant with you, and We will be guided."

50.Safi Kaskas: But when We lifted the punishment from them, they broke their word.

51.Safi Kaskas: Then Pharaoh called out among his people; he said, "My people, does not the kingdom of Egypt belong to me, and these rivers that flow under my feet? Do not you see?

52.Safi Kaskas: Am I not better than this insignificant person who can barely make himself understood?

53.Safi Kaskas: Why then are not golden bracelets placed on him, or the angels are accompanying him?"

54.Safi Kaskas: He [Pharaoh] easily swayed his people, and they obeyed him. [To Us] they were disobedient people

55.Safi Kaskas: but when they continued to challenge Us, We inflicted Our punishment on them, and drowned them all:

56.Safi Kaskas: We made them a precedent and an example for the others.

57.Safi Kaskas: And when the son of Mary was given as an example, immediately your people [Prophet] loudly objected

58.Safi Kaskas: and they said, "who is better, our gods or him?" They cite him only for arguments sake. In fact, they are a confrontational people.

59.Safi Kaskas: [Jesus] was a servant whom We blessed, and We made him an example for the Children of Israel.

60.Safi Kaskas: Had We so willed, We could have made you into angels succeeding one another on earth.

61.Safi Kaskas: He [Jesus] is a [sign for] knowledge of the Hour, so have no doubt about it, and follow Me. This is a straight path.

62.Safi Kaskas: Never let Satan divert you. He is a clear enemy to you all.

63.Safi Kaskas: When Jesus came with clear evidence, he said, "I have brought you Wisdom and to clarify for you some of what you differ about. Be always mindful of God and obey me.

64.Safi Kaskas: God is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him. This is a straight path."

65.Safi Kaskas: But the factions differed among themselves. How terrible is the punishment of a painful Day to the unjust.

66.Safi Kaskas: What are they waiting for except for the Hour to come suddenly upon them when they are not expecting it?

67.Safi Kaskas: On that Day, close friends will be enemies to each other, except for those who are mindful of God

68.Safi Kaskas: "My worshipers, you have nothing to fear on that Day, nor will you grieve,

69.Safi Kaskas: those who believed in Our revelations and were submissive.

70.Safi Kaskas: Enter the Garden, you and your spouses, filled with Joy."

71.Safi Kaskas: Passed among them will be plates and cups of gold. They will have whatever their soul desire and whatever delights their eyes. There you will remain forever.

72.Safi Kaskas: That is the Garden which you are made to inherit because of what you have done.

73.Safi Kaskas: There will be much fruit for you to eat.

74.Safi Kaskas: Those who force others to reject Our messages will be in the punishment of Hell forever.

75.Safi Kaskas: It will not be allowed to be eased for them. In it, they will be crushed by despair.

76.Safi Kaskas: We did not wrong them, but it was they who were the unjust.

77.Safi Kaskas: They will call, "Malik, let your Lord finish us off!" He will say, "You are staying."

78.Safi Kaskas: We have given you the Truth, but most of you, hate the Truth.

79.Safi Kaskas: Or have they thought up some scheme? We too have been scheming

80.Safi Kaskas: Or do they think that We cannot hear their secrets and their private talk? Yes, We can, and Our messengers are with them writing it down.

81.Safi Kaskas: Say, "If the Merciful-to-all had a son, then I would be the first to worship him."

82.Safi Kaskas: Exalted is the Lord of the heavens and the earth in His glory, Lord of the Throne, totally above what they ascribe to Him.

83.Safi Kaskas: So, let them indulge in idle talk and play until they face that Day of theirs which they have been promised:

84.Safi Kaskas: It is He who is God in heaven, and God on earth. He is the All-Wise, the All-Knowing.

85.Safi Kaskas: And blessed is He Who has sovereignty over the heavens and the earth and everything between them. He alone has knowledge of the Hour. You will all be returned to Him.

86.Safi Kaskas: Those deities they invoke besides Him have no power of intercession; only those who testify to the Truth and have full knowledge.

87.Safi Kaskas: And if you asked them who created them, they would say, "God." Why do they mislead?

88.Safi Kaskas: As for his saying, "My Lord, these are people who do not believe."

89.Safi Kaskas: So forgive them and talk peace. Eventually they will come to know.

1.Safi Kaskas: Ha Meem,

2.Safi Kaskas: by the Book that makes things clear,

3.Safi Kaskas: We have revealed it on a Blessed Night; We have been warning.

4.Safi Kaskas: On that night every matter of wisdom is made distinct.

5.Safi Kaskas: A decree from Us. We have been sending messages

6.Safi Kaskas: as mercy from your Lord. He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

7.Safi Kaskas: The Sustainer of the heavens and the earth and everything between them, if you only can grasp this with certainty.

8.Safi Kaskas: There is no god but Him; He gives life and causes death. [He is] your Sustainer and the Sustainer of your forefathers from the beginning.

9.Safi Kaskas: Yet they who lack certainty toy with their doubts.

10.Safi Kaskas: So watch out for the Day when the sky will bring visible smoke

11.Safi Kaskas: enveloping all people; "This is a painful punishment."

12.Safi Kaskas: [Then they will say], "Our Lord, lift the punishment from us, we now believe."

13.Safi Kaskas: But how can this sudden remembrance benefit them? When a messenger explaining things clearly has already come to them,

14.Safi Kaskas: and they turned away from him saying, "He is tutored but possessed."

15.Safi Kaskas: We will postpone the punishment for a while. But you will eventually return to us.

16.Safi Kaskas: The Day when We will strike with the greatest assault, We will take retribution.

17.Safi Kaskas: We had already tested Pharaoh's people before them, when a noble messenger came to them,

18.Safi Kaskas: [saying], "Hand over to me the servants of God. I am a trustworthy Messenger to you,

19.Safi Kaskas: Never be arrogant with God. I come to you with clear authority.

20.Safi Kaskas: I have sought refuge with my Lord and your Lord, against your condemnation.

21.Safi Kaskas: If you don't believe me, then [at least] leave me alone."

22.Safi Kaskas: He then called out to his Lord that these were evil people.

23.Safi Kaskas: [God said], "Then set out with My servants by night. You will be pursued.

24.Safi Kaskas: Cross the sea quickly and leave it as is.  They are an army to be drowned."

25.Safi Kaskas: How many gardens and fountains did they leave behind?

26.Safi Kaskas: And crops and noble residences

27.Safi Kaskas: and that life of ease that they used to enjoy?

28.Safi Kaskas: So it was; Yet We passed it on to other people to inherit.

29.Safi Kaskas: Neither heaven nor earth wept for them, nor were they given a reprieve.

30.Safi Kaskas: And We saved the Children of Israel from the humiliating persecution

31.Safi Kaskas: from Pharaoh. He was an arrogant transgressor.

32.Safi Kaskas: And We chose them knowingly over all people

33.Safi Kaskas: and We gave them many revelations, that were an obvious trial.

34.Safi Kaskas: Yet these people say,

35.Safi Kaskas: "There is nothing but our one death, and we will not be resurrected.

36.Safi Kaskas: Bring back our forefathers, if you are telling the truth."

37.Safi Kaskas: Are they better than the people of Tubba' and those before them? We destroyed them, [for] they were among those who rejected our messages and have severed all relations to God,

38.Safi Kaskas: And We did not create the heavens and earth and everything between them to play a game.

39.Safi Kaskas: We created them with the Truth [for a meaningful purpose], but most of them do not know.

40.Safi Kaskas: The Day of Distinction is the appointed time for all of them.

41.Safi Kaskas: The Day when a friend will not be of any use to his friend, nor will they be helped

42.Safi Kaskas: except those on whom God has mercy.  He is the Almighty, the Merciful-to-all.

43.Safi Kaskas: The tree of Zaqqum

44.Safi Kaskas: is food for the sinner.

45.Safi Kaskas: It boils inside bellies like boiling oil,

46.Safi Kaskas: like the boiling of seething water.

47.Safi Kaskas: "Seize him and drag him into the midst of Hell,

48.Safi Kaskas: then pour scalding water over his head as punishment!'"

49.Safi Kaskas: "Taste it, you are the mighty one, the noble,

50.Safi Kaskas: this is what you used to dispute."

51.Safi Kaskas: But those who were mindful of God will be in a safe place;

52.Safi Kaskas: in the midst of Gardens and springs,

53.Safi Kaskas: wearing fine silk and brocade, facing each other.

54.Safi Kaskas: So it will be. And We shall pair them with Hoor Ein.

55.Safi Kaskas: Safe and secure, they will call there for every kind of fruit.

56.Safi Kaskas: Except the first death, they will not taste death there. He will protect them from the punishment of Hell,

57.Safi Kaskas: a grace from your Lord. That is the supreme triumph.

58.Safi Kaskas: We have made this Qur'an easy to understand in your own language that they might remember.

59.Safi Kaskas: So wait and watch; they are also on their watch.

1.Safi Kaskas: Ha Meem,

2.Safi Kaskas: the gradual revelations of the Book are from God, the Almighty, the Wise.

3.Safi Kaskas: In the heavens and earth are Signs for the believers.

4.Safi Kaskas: And in your creation and in the creatures He scattered are Signs for people gifted with inner certainty.

5.Safi Kaskas: The alternation of night and day, the sustenance God sends down from the sky, using it to revive the earth after its death, and the circulation of the winds are all Signs for people who use their reason.

6.Safi Kaskas: These are God's verses, We convey them to you, setting forth the Truth.If they deny God and His verses, what message will they then believe?

7.Safi Kaskas: How terrible it is to every sinful liar

8.Safi Kaskas: who hears God's revelations being recited to him, yet he persists arrogantly, as if he did not hear them. So give him the news of a painful punishment awaiting him.

9.Safi Kaskas: And when he does learn some of Our verses, he ridicules them. Such people will have a humiliating punishment.

10.Safi Kaskas: Hell awaits them. Nothing they have earned will be of any use to them, nor will those they have adopted as protectors instead of God. They will have a great punishment.

11.Safi Kaskas: This is true guidance. Those who have rejected the truth of their Lord's revelations will have a punishment of grievous pain.

12.Safi Kaskas: It is God who subjected the sea for you so that ships may sail with His approval and that you may seek His favor, and that you may give Him thanks.

13.Safi Kaskas: And He has subjected to you all that is in the heavens and on the earth; a blessing from Him.  There are signs in this for people who reflect.

14.Safi Kaskas: Tell the believers that they should forgive those who do not anticipate the Days of God as it is He alone who will hold people accountable for what they have earned.

15.Safi Kaskas: Whoever does good, benefits his own soul; and whoever does evil, harms his soul. Then you will all be returned to your Lord.

16.Safi Kaskas: We gave the Children of Israel the Book, Wisdom and prophecy. We provided them with good things and preferred them over all people.

17.Safi Kaskas: We gave them clear details of the matter [faith]. Yet, they differed out of rivalry between them, only after knowledge came to them. Your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection regarding their differences.

18.Safi Kaskas: Then We put you on a pathway of the matter, so follow it, and do not follow the whims and desires of those who do not know.

19.Safi Kaskas: They will not help you in any way if you decide to defy God. The unjust protect each other, while God is the Protector of those who are mindful of Him.

20.Safi Kaskas: This is clear insight for mankind and guidance and mercy for people gifted with inner certainty.

21.Safi Kaskas: Or do those who indulge in evil deeds assume that We will regard them the same as those who believe and do good deeds, that they will be alike whether in life or in death? How bad is their judgment?

22.Safi Kaskas: God created the heavens and earth in Truth, so that every soul may be rewarded according to its deeds. They will not be wronged.

23.Safi Kaskas: Have you considered him who has taken his whims and desires for his god? Then God knowingly allows him to stray, sealing his hearing and his heart, and has placed a veil over his vision. So who can guide him after God? Will you not reflect?

24.Safi Kaskas: They say, "There is nothing but our life in this world; we die, we live, and nothing but time destroys us." But they have no knowledge of this; they are only guessing.

25.Safi Kaskas: And when Our clear verses are recited to them, their only argument is to say, "Bring back our forefathers, if you are telling the truth."

26.Safi Kaskas: Say, "It is God who gives you life , then causes you to die, and then He gathers you for the Day of Resurrection, about which there is no doubt. But most people do not know."

27.Safi Kaskas: To God belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth. On the Day when the Hour takes place, on that Day those who dealt in falsehood will lose.

28.Safi Kaskas: You will see every nation on its knees; every nation summoned to its Book, "Today you are being repaid for what you did.

29.Safi Kaskas: This is Our record, it speaks about you in Truth.  We were recording what You have been doing."

30.Safi Kaskas: As for those who believed and did good deeds, their Lord will admit them into His mercy. That is the clear triumph.

31.Safi Kaskas: But for the unbelievers, "Were My verses not recited to you? But you were an arrogant and dissenting people.

32.Safi Kaskas: And when you were told, 'God's promise is true and there is no doubt about the Hour,' you said, 'We do not know what is the Hour. We're assuming that these are only speculations, and we're by no means certain.'

33.Safi Kaskas: The evil consequences of what they did will become evident to them, and the very thing they used to ridicule will haunt them.

34.Safi Kaskas: They were told, "Today We will ignore you as you ignored the encounter of this Day. The Fire will be your refuge, and you will have no helpers.

35.Safi Kaskas: That is because you took the verses of God in ridicule, and the worldly life enticed you." Therefore, today they will not get out of it and they will no longer have the opportunity to repent.

36.Safi Kaskas: All praise be to God, Lord of the heavens and Lord of the earth, Lord of the worlds.

37.Safi Kaskas: His alone is all majestic greatness within the heavens and the earth. He is the Almighty, the Wise.

46.SurahEnglishNames: The Wind-curved Sandhills, The Dunes, The Sandhills

1.Safi Kaskas: Ha Meem,

2.Safi Kaskas: the gradual revelations of the Book are from God, the Almighty, the Wise.

3.Safi Kaskas: We did not create the heavens and earth and everything in between them except in Truth and for a specified term. Yet the unbelievers continue to ignore what they have been warned about.

4.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Do you see those you pray to other than God? Show me what part of earth they have; or do they own a share in the heavens? Bring me a Book preceding this one, or a shred of knowledge, if you are truthful."

5.Safi Kaskas: Who can be more misguided than he who calls on others beside God that do not respond to him even till the Day of Resurrection? and are not even aware that callers are calling on them.

6.Safi Kaskas: And when people are gathered [that Day], they will be enemies to those who worshiped them, and they will renounce their worship.

7.Safi Kaskas: But when our clear verses are recited to them, the unbelievers say to the Truth when it comes to them: "This is obvious magic."

8.Safi Kaskas: Or do they say, "He has invented it?" Say, "If I have invented it, there is nothing at all you can do to protect me from God. He knows well what you are engaged in. He is sufficient Witness between me and you. He is the Most-Forgiving the Merciful-to-all."

9.Safi Kaskas: Say, "I am not different from the other messengers, and I do not know what will be done with me, or with you. I only follow what has been revealed to me. I only warn plainly."

10.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Have you considered: what if the Qur'an is really from God, and you are rejecting it? When a witness from the Children of Israel has already testified to its similarity [to earlier scripture] and believed in it, and yet you are too proud to do the same? God does not guide the unjust people."

11.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers say about the believers, "If it were anything good, they would not have preceded us to it." And since they were not guided by it, they will say, "This is an ancient lie."

12.Safi Kaskas: Yet before it, was the Book revealed to Moses, a guide and as a mercy. And this a Book confirming it in Arabic tongue to warn those who are unjust and to bring good news to those who do good.

13.Safi Kaskas: Those who say, "Our Lord is God," and then remained on a straight path, they will have nothing to fear, nor shall they grieve.

14.Safi Kaskas: Those are destined for Paradise, where they will dwell forever, a reward for what they used to do.

15.Safi Kaskas: We have instructed man to be kind to his parents. His mother carried him with difficulty and gave birth to him with difficulty. His bearing and weaning period is thirty months. Until, when he reaches his full strength, and is forty years of age, he says, "My Lord, help me to be grateful for the blessings You have bestowed on me and on my parents; help me to do the right deeds that are pleasing to you. Make my children good.  I have sincerely repented, and I am of those who submit to You."

16.Safi Kaskas: Those are the ones whose best deeds will be accepted and whose bad deeds will be overlooked. They will be among the dwellers of Paradise. This is the promise of truth which they had been promised.

17.Safi Kaskas: As for him who says to his parents, "Enough of you; Are you warning me that I will be resurrected when generations have passed and gone before me?" While they both cry for God's help, "Please believe! The promise of God is true." But he says, "These are only ancient tales"

18.Safi Kaskas: Those are the ones upon whom the verdict is justified, among nations that went before them of jinn and humans. They are truly doomed.

19.Safi Kaskas: Everyone will be ranked according to what they have done. He will pay them in full for their deeds, and they will not be wronged.

20.Safi Kaskas: On the Day when the unbelievers are exposed to the Fire: "You have squandered the good things you had in your worldly life, and you took your portion of pleasure there. So today you are being repaid with a punishment of humiliation, because of your unjustifiable arrogance on earth, and for transgressing all bounds."

21.Safi Kaskas: And mention, the brother of Aad, as he warned his people at the sand dunes. Others, delivering warnings, have come and gone before him and after him: "Worship  only God, they said. I fear for you the punishment of a terrible Day."

22.Safi Kaskas: They replied, "Did you come to turn us away from our gods? Then bring us the punishment you promise us, if you are telling the truth."

23.Safi Kaskas: He said, "Its knowledge is only with God, I only convey to you the message that I was sent with. But I see you are insolent people."

24.Safi Kaskas: When they saw a cloud approaching their valleys they said, "This is a cloud that will bring us rain." No, it is rather what you wanted to speed up : a wind, in which there is a painful punishment,

25.Safi Kaskas: it will destroy everything by the command of its Lord. That morning, there was nothing to be seen except their ruined dwellings. This is how We repay those who force others to reject Our messages.

26.Safi Kaskas: We had empowered them far better than We empowered you, and We gave them hearing, vision and hearts. But their hearing, vision and hearts were of no use to them as they were rejecting the signs of God; and so they became surrounded by the very punishment they used to ridicule.

27.Safi Kaskas: We have destroyed other towns around you, after We have diversified Our signs to them that perhaps they will return to the right path.

28.Safi Kaskas: Why then did those idols, whom they worshiped to bring them nearer to God, not help them? In fact, they abandoned them. It was all falsehood of their own making.

29.Safi Kaskas: We sent a group of jinn to you [Prophet) to listen to the Qur'an. When they heard it, they said "Listen quietly." Then when it was concluded, they went back to their people to warn them.

30.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Our people, We have heard a Book revealed after Moses confirming what is available of it, guiding to the Truth and to a straight path.

31.Safi Kaskas: Our people, respond to the Caller to God. Believe in Him; He will forgive you your sins and will protect you from a painful punishment.

32.Safi Kaskas: But he who does not respond to God's call can never escape God's reach on earth, and have no protectors besides Him. Those are clearly misguided."

33.Safi Kaskas: Do they not see that God, who created the heavens and earth and was never tired in doing so. Is He Able to bring the dead back to life? Yes indeed.  He is Able to do all things.

34.Safi Kaskas: On the Day when the unbelievers are exposed to the Fire "Is this not the truth?" They will say, "Yes, by our Lord." He will say, "Then taste the punishment for having rejected the Truth."

35.Safi Kaskas: Be patient, as were those messengers of firm resolve. And do not seek to hasten punishment for them. On the Day when they see what they are promised, it will seem as they had only stayed for an hour of a single day [on earth]. An announcement: will any be destroyed except the defiantly rebellious people?

1.Safi Kaskas: Those who reject the truth and turn others away from the path of God, He will let their deeds go to waste.

2.Safi Kaskas: While those who believe, and do good deeds and believe in what has been sent down to Muhammad as the Truth from their Lord, He will remove their bad deeds and relieve their concerns.

3.Safi Kaskas: That is because those who deny the truth follow falsehood, while those who believe follow the Truth from their Lord. In this way God shows to mankind their examples.

4.Safi Kaskas: So, when you encounter the unbelievers [in battle], strike at their necks. Then, once they are defeated, bind them firmly. Then either release them by grace, or by ransom, until the war is over. God could have defeated them Himself if He had willed, but He wants to test some of you by means of others. As for those who are killed in the cause of God, He will not let their deeds go to waste.

5.Safi Kaskas: He will guide them and will put their mind at ease

6.Safi Kaskas: And He will admit them to Paradise, which He has already made known to them.

7.Safi Kaskas: Believers, if you help God, He will help you and make you stand firm.

8.Safi Kaskas: As for the unbelievers, how miserable will they be?  God brought their deeds to nothing.

9.Safi Kaskas: They hated what God revealed, so He rendered their deeds worthless.

10.Safi Kaskas: Have they not journeyed through the land and seen the fate of those before them? God destroyed them, and a similar fate awaits all those who persist on denying the truth.

11.Safi Kaskas: That is because God is the protector of those who believe while those who deny the truth have no protector.

12.Safi Kaskas: God will admit those who have believed and done good deeds to Gardens with rivers flowing through them. While those who disbelieved, who enjoyed themselves, and eat like cattle eat, the Fire will be their final dwelling.

13.Safi Kaskas: And how many towns We have destroyed who were greater in power than your town which drove you out?  There was no helper for them.

14.Safi Kaskas: Is the one who has clear evidence from his Lord like someone whose evil deeds have been made to look attractive to him? So they follow their [own] whims and desires.

15.Safi Kaskas: The example of the Paradise promised to those who are mindful of God is that of a place that has rivers of pure water, and rivers of milk forever fresh, and rivers of wine delightful to all who drink it, and rivers of strained honey. They will have in it all kinds of fruits and forgiveness from their Lord. Is this like those who will abide eternally in the Fire and are given to drink boiling water that will cut through their bowels?

16.Safi Kaskas: Among them are those who listen to you, but when they leave you, they say to those given knowledge, "What was that he just said?" Those are the ones whose hearts God has sealed. They follow their own whims and desires.

17.Safi Kaskas: While those who were [willing to be] guided, God increases them in guidance and causes them to grow in God-consciousness.

18.Safi Kaskas: What are the unbelievers waiting for, other than the Hour to come upon them suddenly? Its Signs have already come. But what good will it be to remind them once the Hour has actually arrived?

19.Safi Kaskas: Know then that there is no god but God and ask forgiveness for your sins and for the believing men and women. God knows when you get up and when you lie down.

20.Safi Kaskas: Those who believe ask "why no chapter has been sent down [about fighting]." Yet when a decisive chapter is sent down, and fighting is mentioned in it, you see those with sickness in their hearts looking at you like someone about to faint from fear of death. It is more appropriate

21.Safi Kaskas: To show Obedience and good words. Then, when the decision to fight has been made, being true to God would have been better for them.

22.Safi Kaskas: Would you prefer to turn away and go spreading corruption on earth and sever your ties of kinship?

23.Safi Kaskas: Those are the ones that God has rejected, so He deafened them and blinded their vision.

24.Safi Kaskas: Will they not ponder the Qur'an? Or are there locks upon their hearts?

25.Safi Kaskas: Those who turned back in their tracks after guidance became clear to them, Satan enticed them and has given them false hope.

26.Safi Kaskas: That is because they said to those who hate what God has sent down, "We will obey you in certain matters." But God knows their secrets.

27.Safi Kaskas: How will it be when the angels gather them in death, beating their faces and their backs?

28.Safi Kaskas: That is because they pursued what displeases God and hated what pleases Him. So He rendered their deeds worthless.

29.Safi Kaskas: Or do those with sickness in their hearts think that God will not expose their malice?

30.Safi Kaskas: Had We willed, We could have show them to you, and you would have recognized them by their features; Yet you will surely know them by the tone of their speech. God knows all you do.

31.Safi Kaskas: We will test you, until We know those who strive among you, and those who are patient, and We will test the sincerity of your assertions.

32.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers who turn others away from the path of God and oppose the Messenger after guidance has become clear to them, will not hurt God in the least, but He will render their deeds worthless.

33.Safi Kaskas: Believers, obey God and obey the Messenger and do not let your deeds go to waste.

34.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers who turn others away from the path of God and then die while they are unbelievers, God will not forgive them.

35.Safi Kaskas: So do not waiver and call for peace while you have the upper hand. God is with you. He will not waste your deeds.

36.Safi Kaskas: This worldly life is only amusement and pastime. But if you believe and become mindful of God, He will give you your rewards and not ask you for your properties.

37.Safi Kaskas: Were He to ask you for them and put you under pressure, you would become tightfisted, and He would expose your unwillingness.

38.Safi Kaskas: Here you are, called upon to spend in the cause of God. Among you are those who are tightfisted; but whoever withholds only withholds from his own soul. God is the Rich Beyond Need, while you are the needy. And if you turn away, He will replace you with another people, and they will not be the likes of you.

1.Safi Kaskas: We have opened the way for you to a clear victory

2.Safi Kaskas: That God may forgive you your previous and later sins, complete His grace upon you and guide you on a straight path

3.Safi Kaskas: That God may help you to a mighty victory.

4.Safi Kaskas: It is He who sent down tranquility into the hearts of the believers that they would add faith to their faith. To God belong the forces of the heavens and earth. God is All-Knowing and All-Wise.

5.Safi Kaskas: He will admit the believing men and the believing women to Gardens with rivers flowing through them to remain there eternally and to remove their offenses. That, with God, is a great triumph

6.Safi Kaskas: And He will punish the hypocrite men and hypocrite women, and the idolater men and idolater women, those who harbor evil thoughts about God. They will suffer an evil turn of fate; God is angry with them, has rejected them, and has prepared Hell for them. What a miserable destination.

7.Safi Kaskas: And to God belongs the forces of heavens and earth. God is Almighty and All-Wise.

8.Safi Kaskas: We have sent you as a witness, a bearer of good news and a giver of warning.

9.Safi Kaskas: That you may believe in God and His Messenger, and honor Him, revere Him and to praise His limitless glory morning and evening.

10.Safi Kaskas: Those who pledge allegiance to you [Prophet], are actually pledging allegiance to God. God's hand is placed over theirs. Whoever breaks his pledge breaks it to his own detriment. And whoever fulfills his pledge with God, He will give him a great reward.

11.Safi Kaskas: The Dessert-Arabs who stayed behind [when you went to battle] will say to you, "We were preoccupied with our properties and our families, so ask forgiveness for us." They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts. Say, "If God intended harm for you or intended benefit, who can intervene for you? God is fully aware of what you do.

12.Safi Kaskas: But you thought that the Messenger and the believers will never return to their families, ever, and this seemed fine to your hearts. You harbored evil thoughts, and were corrupt people."

13.Safi Kaskas: For those who do not believe in God and His Messenger, We have prepared a blazing Fire

14.Safi Kaskas: To God belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He wills and punishes whom He wills. And ever is God Ever Forgiving, the Mercy Giver.

15.Safi Kaskas: As soon as you are about to depart on a war that promises gains, those who [previously] stayed behind will say, "Allow us to go with you". They wish to alter the Words of God. Say: "You may not go with us: God has said so before." They will say, "You envy us". How little they understand.

16.Safi Kaskas: Say to those Dessert-Arabs who stayed behind, "Eventually, you will be called to face people of great military might; you will either have to fight them, or they will submit to God's will. If you obey, God will give you a good reward; but if you turn away as you turned away before, He will punish you with a painful punishment."

17.Safi Kaskas: There is no blame on the blind, the lame or the ill. God will admit anyone who obeys Him and His Messenger to Gardens with rivers flowing through them; But He will painfully punish anyone who turns away.

18.Safi Kaskas: God was pleased with the believers when they pledged allegiance to you under the tree. He knew what was in their hearts, so He sent down tranquility to them, and rewarded them with an imminent victory

19.Safi Kaskas: and abundant gains to capture. God is the Almighty and All-Wise.

20.Safi Kaskas: God has promised you abundant future gains. He has expedited this for you [victory], and has held hostile people's hands back from you; that it may be a sign for the believers, and that He may guide you to a straight path.

21.Safi Kaskas: And there are yet other gains to come. God has already covered for you. God is Able to do all things.

22.Safi Kaskas: If the unbelievers had fought you, they would have turned back and fled. Then they will find neither a protector nor a helper.

23.Safi Kaskas: Such is God's way which is ongoing. You will never find any change in God's way.

24.Safi Kaskas: It is He who held their hands from you and your hands from them, in the Makah valley, after He gave you the upper hand over them. God is ever seeing of what you do.

25.Safi Kaskas: It is they who denied the truth, and barred you from the Sacred House, and prevented the offering from reaching its destination. Were it not for some believing men and believing women, whom you did not know, you were about to hurt them, and become unknowingly guilty. Thus God admits into His mercy whomever He wills. Had the unbelievers been clearly distinguishable, We would have inflicted on them a painful punishment.

26.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers had filled their hearts with fury, the fury of ignorance. But God sent down His tranquility on His Messenger and the believers, and made binding on them the word of God consciousness, to which they were most entitled and most deserving. God is Knowing of all things.

27.Safi Kaskas: God has fulfilled His Messenger's vision in Truth: "You will enter the Sacred House, God willing, in safety, with your heads shaved or hair shortened, with no fear. He knew what you did not know, and has granted you besides this, a victory soon to come.

28.Safi Kaskas: It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of Truth, to prevail over all religions. God suffices as a Witness.

29.Safi Kaskas: Muhammad is the Messenger of God.Those with him are tough on the unbelievers, yet compassionate to one another. You see them kneeling and bowing down, seeking God's blessings and His approval. Their faces bear the mark of their prostrations. Such is their example in the Torah. And their description in the Gospel is like a plant that sprouts, becoming strong, grows thick, and rises on its stem to the delight of the farmer. Through them God infuriates the unbelievers. God has promised forgiveness and a great reward to those among them, who believe and do good deeds.

49.SurahEnglishNames: The Private Apartments, The Inner Apartments, The Chambers

1.Safi Kaskas: Believers, do not put your opinions ahead of that of God and His Messenger, but remain mindful of God.  God is All-Hearing and All-knowing.

2.Safi Kaskas: Believers, do not raise your voices above the voice of the Prophet or be as loud when you are speaking to him like you do to one another, unless you want your deeds to become worthless without you realizing.

3.Safi Kaskas: Those who lower their voices before the Messenger of God, they are the ones whose hearts God has tested for being fully aware of Him. For them, there is forgiveness and great reward.

4.Safi Kaskas: But those who call you from outside your private chambers, most of them do not understand.

5.Safi Kaskas: Had they been patient until you came out to them, it would have been better for them. But God is Ever Forgiving and Merciful-to-all.

6.Safi Kaskas: Believers, if a known wicked person brings you news, investigate, to avoid harming people out of ignorance and later regret what you have done.

7.Safi Kaskas: Be aware that God's Messenger is among you. Had he obeyed you in many things, you would suffer hardship. But God has endeared your faith to you and made it pleasing to your hearts and made disbelief, mischief, and rebellion hateful to you. These are the rightly guided

8.Safi Kaskas: a favor and a blessing from God. God is All-knowing and All-Wise.

9.Safi Kaskas: If two groups of believers should fight each other, then try to reconcile them. But if one of them oppresses the other, then fight the oppressing group until it complies with God's command. Once it has complied, make peace between them with justice and be equitable.  God loves those who are equitable.

10.Safi Kaskas: The believers are brothers so make peace between your brothers and remain mindful of God that you may receive mercy.

11.Safi Kaskas: Believers, no men shall ridicule others, for they may be better than them. Nor shall any women ridicule other women, for they may be better than them. Nor shall you slander one another, nor shall you call each other names. How bad it is to be called disobedient after accepting faith! Those who do not repent of this behavior are unjust.

12.Safi Kaskas: Believers, avoid being suspicious. Some suspicions are sinful. And don't spy or backbite one another. Would any of you like to eat the flesh of his dead brother? No, you would hate it. So remain mindful of God. God is the Acceptor of repentance, the Mercy giver.

13.Safi Kaskas: People, We created you from a male and a female, and made you nations and tribes so that you may know one another. The best among you in the sight of God is the one who is most mindful of God.  God is All-knowing and All-Aware.

14.Safi Kaskas: The Desert-Arabs say, "We have believed." Say, "You have not believed yet; but say [instead], 'We have submitted,' for faith has not yet entered your hearts. But if you obey God and His Messenger, He will not diminish any of your deeds.  God is Ever Forgiving and Merciful-to-all."

15.Safi Kaskas: The believers are those who believe in God and His Messenger, leave all doubt behind, and strive with their wealth and their persons for God's cause. Those are the ones who are true to their word.

16.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Do you presume to inform God about your religion, when God knows everything in the heavens and earth, and God has full Knowledge of all things?"

17.Safi Kaskas: They consider it a favor to you that they have submitted. Say, "Do not consider your submission a favor to me; it is God who has done you a favor, by guiding you to faith, if you are truly sincere."

18.Safi Kaskas: God knows all that is beyond our senses of the heavens and the earth. God sees everything you do.

1.Safi Kaskas: Qaf and the Glorious Qur'an.

2.Safi Kaskas: They marveled that someone from among their midst has come to them with a warning. The unbelievers say, "This is an amazing thing.

3.Safi Kaskas: Once We have died and become dust? That is a most unlikely return."

4.Safi Kaskas: We know how many of them the earth consumes, and We keep a comprehensive record [about each one of them].

5.Safi Kaskas: But when the Truth came to them, they denied it; they are in a state of confusion.

6.Safi Kaskas: Have they not looked at the sky above them, how We structured it, and beautified it with all its gateways?

7.Safi Kaskas: And the earth, how We spread it out and placed on it firm mountains, and made every beautiful pair of plants grow in it

8.Safi Kaskas: This is an insight and a reminder to every worshiper who willingly turns to God.

9.Safi Kaskas: And We sent down blessed rain from the sky and grew gardens and grain to harvest.

10.Safi Kaskas: And soaring palm trees, with clustered dates

11.Safi Kaskas: as provision for the worshipers.  By it [the rain] We gave life to a dead town. This is how the emergence [from the graves] will take place.

12.Safi Kaskas: Before them the people of Noah denied the truth, and so did the dwellers of Rass, Thamud

13.Safi Kaskas: Aad, Pharaoh and the brothers of Lot,

14.Safi Kaskas: the woods-dwellers and the people of Tubba'. All of these people rejected their messengers, so My threat was justly fulfilled.

15.Safi Kaskas: Were We exhausted by the first creation? But they are dubious of a new creation.

16.Safi Kaskas: We have created man and We know what his inner soul is whispering. We are closer to him than his jugular vein

17.Safi Kaskas: as he receives the two recording agents, seated one on the right and one on the left.

18.Safi Kaskas: He does not utter any word, without a vigilant observer present with him.

19.Safi Kaskas: Eventually, the trance of death will come with the Truth. This is what you were trying to evade.

20.Safi Kaskas: The Horn will be blown. This is the Promised Day.

21.Safi Kaskas: Every soul will come, with it a driver and a witness.

22.Safi Kaskas: "You did not pay much attention to this day, but as We lifted your veil from you, your vision today is keen."

23.Safi Kaskas: His inseparable companion, will say, "This is what I have recorded."

24.Safi Kaskas: [God will say], "Cast into Hell everyone who stubbornly denied  the truth,

25.Safi Kaskas: everyone who prevented good from reaching others, aggressor, who caused others to doubt,

26.Safi Kaskas: who made other  gods as equal with God;   then cast him into  severe punishment."

27.Safi Kaskas: His [evil] companion will say, "Our Lord, I did not make him transgress, but he [himself], was extremely lost."

28.Safi Kaskas: [God] will say, "Do not feud in My presence, when I had warned you in advance.

29.Safi Kaskas: My judgment, once given, is not subject to change and I do not wrong My servants."

30.Safi Kaskas: On the Day We will say to Hell, "Are you full?" And it will say, "Are there some more?"

31.Safi Kaskas: And Paradise will be brought near to those who were ever mindful of God, it will not be far

32.Safi Kaskas: [It will be said], "This is what you were promised. for every repentant, keeper of his covenant with God

33.Safi Kaskas: who feared the Merciful although He was beyond his perception and came with a repenting heart.

34.Safi Kaskas: Enter it in peace. This is the Day of Eternity."

35.Safi Kaskas: Whatever they want there, they will have and with Us is still more.

36.Safi Kaskas: How many a generation We destroyed before them, who were more powerful and had searched every land. Was there any escape?

37.Safi Kaskas: There is a reminder in this for whoever has a heart or cared to listen and witness.

38.Safi Kaskas: And We did create the heavens and earth and everything between them in six days, and We were not the least weary.

39.Safi Kaskas: So [Prophet] endure what they say and praise your Lord's limitless glory before the rising of the sun and before its setting,

40.Safi Kaskas: and glorify Him part of the night and after prostration.

41.Safi Kaskas: Listen for the Day when the Caller will call out from a place that is near.

42.Safi Kaskas: The Day they will hear the blast in all Truth, that is the Day of Emergence [from the graves].

43.Safi Kaskas: It is We who give life and cause death, and to Us is their final destination

44.Safi Kaskas: The Day when the earth cracks as they emerge rapidly; That is an easy gathering for Us.

45.Safi Kaskas: We know best what they say, and you are not there to force them. So remind with the Quran those who fear My warning.

1.Safi Kaskas: By those [winds] scattering dust,

2.Safi Kaskas: and those heavily laden [with water]

3.Safi Kaskas: and those sailing with ease

4.Safi Kaskas: and those distributing [rain] as ordained,

5.Safi Kaskas: what you are promised is true.

6.Safi Kaskas: The judgment will come.

7.Safi Kaskas: By the sky that is woven,

8.Safi Kaskas: you differ in what you say [about this message].

9.Safi Kaskas: He who deceives himself is misled away from it.

10.Safi Kaskas: The speculators destroy themselves

11.Safi Kaskas: they are unaware that they are lost in ignorance.

12.Safi Kaskas: They ask, "When is the Day of Judgment?"

13.Safi Kaskas: The Day they will be tested when they see the Fire

14.Safi Kaskas: [And will be told], "Taste your scheme. This is what you were rushing toward."

15.Safi Kaskas: While those who were mindful of God will be among Gardens and springs,

16.Safi Kaskas: accepting what their Lord has given them. Verily, they were those who do good.

17.Safi Kaskas: They used to sleep a little at night,

18.Safi Kaskas: and at dawn they would pray for forgiveness,

19.Safi Kaskas: and assign a share of their wealth to the needy and the deprived.

20.Safi Kaskas: For the certain [in faith], they are signs on earth

21.Safi Kaskas: and in yourselves, will you not see?

22.Safi Kaskas: And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.

23.Safi Kaskas: By the Lord of the heaven and earth, it is as true as the fact that you speak.

24.Safi Kaskas: Has the story of Abraham's honored guests reached you?

25.Safi Kaskas: When they entered to see him, they said, "Peace." He answered, "Peace to you strangers."

26.Safi Kaskas: Then he went off to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf

27.Safi Kaskas: and placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"

28.Safi Kaskas: He then began to feel apprehensive. They said, "Do not fear," and gave him good news of a boy who would be gifted with knowledge.

29.Safi Kaskas: His wife approached with a scream, struck her face and protested, "A barren old woman [like me]!"

30.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Thus said your Lord; He is the All-Wise, the All-knowing."

31.Safi Kaskas: [Abraham] then enquired, "What is your business, messengers?"

32.Safi Kaskas: They said, " We have been sent to a dissenting people

33.Safi Kaskas: to send down on them rocks of clay,

34.Safi Kaskas: marked by your Lord for those who  rejected His messages and have severed all relations with God

35.Safi Kaskas: So We brought out the believers that were in town.

36.Safi Kaskas: But found only one household of people who submitted to God.

37.Safi Kaskas: And We left in town a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.

38.Safi Kaskas: There is another sign in Moses, when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.

39.Safi Kaskas: But Pharaoh turned away with his supporters and said," A magician or a madman."

40.Safi Kaskas: So We seized him and his soldiers and threw them into the sea. Pharaoh was to blame.

41.Safi Kaskas: And a sign in Aad, when We unleashed against them the devastating wind.

42.Safi Kaskas: It spared nothing it came upon, and left it like decayed ruins.

43.Safi Kaskas: And a sign in Thamud, it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a while."

44.Safi Kaskas: But they defied their Lord's command, so the thunderbolt struck them as they looked.

45.Safi Kaskas: They were unable to rise, nor could they find help.

46.Safi Kaskas: And before that the people of Noah. They were wicked people.

47.Safi Kaskas: We built the universe with power, and We are steadily expanding it.

48.Safi Kaskas: And the earth We spread it out, How well We smoothed it out.

49.Safi Kaskas: And of all things We created two mates; perhaps you will reflect.

50.Safi Kaskas: So flee towards God. I am sent from Him with a clear warning for you.

51.Safi Kaskas: And do not set up any other god with God. I come to you with a clear warning from Him.

52.Safi Kaskas: Similarly, every time a messenger came to those before them, they said, "A magician or a madman."

53.Safi Kaskas: Did they recommend it to one another? Rather, they are people full of tyranny.

54.Safi Kaskas: So turn away from them, you are not to blame.

55.Safi Kaskas: And go on reminding them. It is good for the believers to be reminded.

56.Safi Kaskas: I only created jinn and human beings to worship Me.

57.Safi Kaskas: I do not require any provision from them, nor do I require them to feed Me.

58.Safi Kaskas: It is God who is the Provider to all, the Possessor of Power, the Strong.

59.Safi Kaskas: Those who were unjust have their share of bad deeds just like their predecessors, so let them not rush My punishment.

60.Safi Kaskas: How terrible for the unbelievers their Day which they are promised.

1.Safi Kaskas: By the mountain called Al Tur,

2.Safi Kaskas: and [by] a Book inscribed

3.Safi Kaskas: In a wide open parchment,

4.Safi Kaskas: and [by] the frequented House,

5.Safi Kaskas: and [by] the canopy raised high,

6.Safi Kaskas: and [by] the surf-swollen sea,

7.Safi Kaskas: the punishment of your Lord will occur.

8.Safi Kaskas: Nothing can prevent it.

9.Safi Kaskas: On the Day heaven sways with agitation

10.Safi Kaskas: and the mountains shift about,

11.Safi Kaskas: how terrible it is that Day, for the unbelievers,

12.Safi Kaskas: who are chatting carelessly to amuse themselves.

13.Safi Kaskas: The Day they are forcefully shoved into the fire of Hell

14.Safi Kaskas: "This is the Fire which you didn't believe in.

15.Safi Kaskas: Is this magic, or do you still not see?

16.Safi Kaskas: Burn in it. Then be patient or impatient, it is all the same for you. You are only being repaid for what you have done."

17.Safi Kaskas: Those who were mindful of God will be in Gardens and bliss,

18.Safi Kaskas: rejoicing in what their Lord has given them. For their Lord has spared them the suffering of Hell.

19.Safi Kaskas: "Eat and drink enjoyably, a reward for what You have done."

20.Safi Kaskas: Reclining on luxurious furniture, beautifully arranged laced, We will pair them with Hoor Ein.

21.Safi Kaskas: Those who believed and whose offspring followed them in faith, We will unite them with their offspring without depriving anybody of their reward for their deeds. Each one according to what he has earned

22.Safi Kaskas: And We will provide them with any fruit and meat they desire.

23.Safi Kaskas: They pass around a cup which does not lead to either idle talk, or sin.

24.Safi Kaskas: Circulating among them to serve them, will be youths like hidden pearls

25.Safi Kaskas: They will approach one another, wondering,

26.Safi Kaskas: they will say "When we were previously among our families we used to live in fear.

27.Safi Kaskas: But God blessed us, and spared us the suffering of the Scorching Fire.

28.Safi Kaskas: Before this, we used to pray to Him.  It is He who is the Most Kind, the Merciful-to-all."

29.Safi Kaskas: So go on reminding.By the grace of your Lord, you are neither an oracle nor a madman.

30.Safi Kaskas: Or do they say [of you], "He's only a poet let's wait to see what time will do to him?"

31.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Go on waiting, I will be waiting with you."

32.Safi Kaskas: Or is it their dreams compelling them to say this? Or are they people full of tyranny?

33.Safi Kaskas: Or do they say, "He has simply made it up?" Rather, they do not want to believe.

34.Safi Kaskas: Then let them produce something like it, if they are truthful.

35.Safi Kaskas: Or were they created out of nothing? Or are they the creators?

36.Safi Kaskas: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? In truth, they are not certain of anything.

37.Safi Kaskas: Or do they possess your Lord's treasuries? Or do they have control over them?

38.Safi Kaskas: Or do they have a stairway [into the heaven] to climb and eavesdrop? Then let their eavesdropper produce clear proof.

39.Safi Kaskas: Or does He have daughters while you have sons?

40.Safi Kaskas: Or do you demand a wage from them that would burden them with debt?

41.Safi Kaskas: Or if they know the future, so they write [it] down?

42.Safi Kaskas: Or are they plotting against you? The plot will fall back on the unbelievers

43.Safi Kaskas: Or do they have a god other than God? May He be exalted in His glory. God is far above anything they associate with Him.

44.Safi Kaskas: Even if they were to see a piece the sky falling, they would say, "Just a heap of clouds."

45.Safi Kaskas: So leave them until they meet their Day in which they will be stunned,

46.Safi Kaskas: the Day when their plotting will not do them any good, nor will they be helped.

47.Safi Kaskas: Another punishment awaits the unjust, but most of them are unaware of it.

48.Safi Kaskas: So wait patiently for your Lord's judgment, for you are before Our eyes. And praise your Lord of limitless glory when you arise.

49.Safi Kaskas: And glorify Him at night, and at the time when the stars retreat.

1.Safi Kaskas: By the falling star,

2.Safi Kaskas: your friend has not strayed, nor has he erred,

3.Safi Kaskas: Nor does he speak from his own whims.

4.Safi Kaskas: It is a revealed revelation,

5.Safi Kaskas: taught to him by one with mighty powers

6.Safi Kaskas: and splendor who stood still

7.Safi Kaskas: while he was at the highest horizon.

8.Safi Kaskas: Then he drew near coming down

9.Safi Kaskas: to within two bows' length or closer.

10.Safi Kaskas: Then God [through that angel] revealed to His servant what He revealed.

11.Safi Kaskas: The heart did not doubt what it saw.

12.Safi Kaskas: Do you dispute with him what he saw?

13.Safi Kaskas: Indeed, he saw him in another descent,

14.Safi Kaskas: at the Sidra beyond which none may pass,

15.Safi Kaskas: near the Garden of Refuge

16.Safi Kaskas: where that Sidra was shrouded [in mystery] with what shrouded it.

17.Safi Kaskas: The eye did not waver, nor did it exceed its limit.

18.Safi Kaskas: He saw some of the greatest signs of his Lord.

19.Safi Kaskas: So have you considered al-Lat and al-'Uzza?

20.Safi Kaskas: and Manat, the third, the other one?

21.Safi Kaskas: Why do you chose for yourself male offspring and assign to God the female?

22.Safi Kaskas: That, then, is an unfair distribution.

23.Safi Kaskas: These [allegedly divine beings] are nothing but names, which you [who worship them] and your forefathers have invented. God sent no authority for them. They [who worship them] follow nothing but guesswork and their egotistical whims, although guidance has come to them [your people] from their Lord.

24.Safi Kaskas: Should man have whatever he wishes for,

25.Safi Kaskas: when this life and the life to come belong only to God?

26.Safi Kaskas: There are many angels in the heavens whose intercession is of no benefit at all until God gives permission to whomever He wills, and approves.

27.Safi Kaskas: Those who do not believe in the Hereafter give the angels female names,

28.Safi Kaskas: they have no knowledge of this. They only follow guesswork. Guesswork is no substitute at all for the Truth.

29.Safi Kaskas: So pay no attention to whoever turns away from Our message and desires only this worldly life.

30.Safi Kaskas: That is the extent of their knowledge. Your Lord knows best who strayed from His path, and He knows best who is guided.

31.Safi Kaskas: To God belongs everything in the heavens and on earth. He will repay those who do evil according to their deeds, and reward those who do good with the best,

32.Safi Kaskas: those who avoid major sins and indecencies, except for minor lapses excepted; your Lord's forgiveness is vast. He knows you well, ever since He created you from the earth and ever since you were embryos in your mothers' wombs. So do not attest to your own virtues; He knows best those who are mindful of Him.

33.Safi Kaskas: Have you seen the one who turned away

34.Safi Kaskas: and gave a little and then held back?

35.Safi Kaskas: Does he have knowledge of all that is beyond, enabling him to see the future?

36.Safi Kaskas: Or has he not been told what was in the scrolls of Moses

37.Safi Kaskas: and [of] Abraham, who fulfilled his duty,

38.Safi Kaskas: that no bearer of burdens will bear the burdens of another,

39.Safi Kaskas: that a human being attains only what he strives for,

40.Safi Kaskas: and that his striving will be seen.

41.Safi Kaskas: Then he will receive for it the fullest reward.

42.Safi Kaskas: The ultimate end is to your Lord,

43.Safi Kaskas: that It is He who causes [one] to laugh and weep.

44.Safi Kaskas: That it is He who causes death and gives life,
