45.Safi Kaskas: that He creates the two mates - the male and female

46.Safi Kaskas: from a fertilized ovum following ejaculation

47.Safi Kaskas: that the next creation is incumbent upon Him.

48.Safi Kaskas: That it is He who enriches and impoverishes,

49.Safi Kaskas: that it is He who is the Lord of Sirius,

50.Safi Kaskas: that it is He who destroyed the first people of Aad

51.Safi Kaskas: and Thamud. He spared no one.

52.Safi Kaskas: And before that the people of Noah who were most unjust and most oppressive.

53.Safi Kaskas: That it is He who brought down the ruined cities

54.Safi Kaskas: And covered them by that whatever He covered them.

55.Safi Kaskas: Which then of your Lord's blessings do you doubt?

56.Safi Kaskas: This is a warning just like the earlier warnings.

57.Safi Kaskas: The inevitable Day draws near.

58.Safi Kaskas: No one, besides God, can disclose it.

59.Safi Kaskas: Do you marvel at this discourse?

60.Safi Kaskas: And you laugh and do not weep

61.Safi Kaskas: While you are lost in your playfulness?

62.Safi Kaskas: So bow down before God and worship [Him].

1.Safi Kaskas: The Hour has come near, and the moon has split.

2.Safi Kaskas: If they see a sign, they turn away and say, "same old magic."

3.Safi Kaskas: They rejected the truth and followed their desires. But everything has its time.

4.Safi Kaskas: Stories to warn them have already come, that should have restrained them.

5.Safi Kaskas: Profound Wisdom, yet these warnings had no effect.

6.Safi Kaskas: So, turn away from them. The Day the Caller calls to something terrible,

7.Safi Kaskas: with their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were swarming locusts,

8.Safi Kaskas: scrambling towards the Caller. The unbelievers will cry, "This is a disastrous Day."

9.Safi Kaskas: Before them the people of Noah rejected the truth, they rejected Our servant saying, "A madman," and he was rebuked.

10.Safi Kaskas: So he called upon his Lord, "I am overwhelmed, [please] help me."

11.Safi Kaskas: So We opened the floodgates of heaven with torrential rain,

12.Safi Kaskas: made the earth burst with gushing springs, and the waters met for an already destined purpose.

13.Safi Kaskas: And We carried him on a craft of planks and nails,

14.Safi Kaskas: sailing before our watchful eyes, a reward for him who was rejected.

15.Safi Kaskas: We left it as a sign, who then is willing to take it to heart?

16.Safi Kaskas: How terrible was My punishment and My warning.

17.Safi Kaskas: Hence, We made it easy to understand this Qur'an and to remember it. Who, then, is willing to keep it in mind?

18.Safi Kaskas: The people of Aad rejected the truth. How then was My punishment and My warning?

19.Safi Kaskas: We unleashed upon them a screaming wind, on a day of continuous catastrophe,

20.Safi Kaskas: plucking people away, as if they were trunks of uprooted palm trees.

21.Safi Kaskas: How terrible was My punishment and My warning.

22.Safi Kaskas: Hence, We made it easy to bear this Qur'an in mind. Who, then, is willing to keep it in mind?

23.Safi Kaskas: The people of Thamud rejected the warnings

24.Safi Kaskas: They said, "Are we to follow a human being, one of us?  We would then be misguided and quite insane.

25.Safi Kaskas: Why should he alone from among all of us be chosen to receive the message? He is nothing but a wicked liar."

26.Safi Kaskas: They will know tomorrow who the wicked liar is.

27.Safi Kaskas: We are sending the she-camel as a test for them. Just watch them and be patient.

28.Safi Kaskas: Tell them that the water is to be shared between them, with each share equitably apportioned.

29.Safi Kaskas: But they called their friend, who dared to slaughter [her].

30.Safi Kaskas: How then was My punishment and My warning.

31.Safi Kaskas: We released against them a single blast, and they became like crumbling twigs.

32.Safi Kaskas: Hence, We made it easy to bear this Qur'an in mind. Who, then, is willing to keep it in mind?

33.Safi Kaskas: The people of Lot rejected the warnings.

34.Safi Kaskas: We unleashed upon them a shower of stones, except for the family of Lot; We rescued them before dawn

35.Safi Kaskas: as a blessing from us. Thus We reward those who are thankful.

36.Safi Kaskas: Lot had already warned them of Our assault, but they dismissed the warning.

37.Safi Kaskas: They even lusted for his guest, so We blinded their eyes. "Taste My punishment and [the fulfillment of] My warnings."

38.Safi Kaskas: Early morning brought them enduring punishment.

39.Safi Kaskas: So taste My punishment [which is the fulfillment of] My warning

40.Safi Kaskas: Hence, We made it easy to bear this Qur'an in mind. Who, then, is willing to keep it in mind?

41.Safi Kaskas: The people of Pharaoh also received warnings.

42.Safi Kaskas: They rejected all Our signs, so We seized them as only the Almighty, the Dominant will

43.Safi Kaskas: Are those among you who deny the truth any better than these others, or do you have immunity in the Books?

44.Safi Kaskas: Or do they say, "We are united and bound to win"?

45.Safi Kaskas: They will all be defeated, and they will turn their backs and flee.

46.Safi Kaskas: Rather the Hour is their appointed time and the Hour is more disastrous and bitter.

47.Safi Kaskas: Those who force others to reject God's messages are misguided and insane.

48.Safi Kaskas: The Day when they are dragged on their faces into the fire: "Taste the scorching touch of Saqar."

49.Safi Kaskas: We have created all things in precise measure.

50.Safi Kaskas: Our command is but one word, like a twinkling of an eye.

51.Safi Kaskas: And We have already destroyed the likes of you. Who, then, is willing to take heed?

52.Safi Kaskas: Everything they have done is noted in their records.

53.Safi Kaskas: Every action small or big is written down.

54.Safi Kaskas: Those who are mindful of God will be among Gardens and rivers,

55.Safi Kaskas: In a seat of honor in the presence of a Sovereign who determines all things.

55.SurahEnglishNames: The Beneficent, The Mercy Giving, The Merciful

1.Safi Kaskas: The Merciful-to-all

2.Safi Kaskas: taught the Qur'an,

3.Safi Kaskas: created man,

4.Safi Kaskas: taught him articulate speech.

5.Safi Kaskas: The sun and the moon run on precise calculations.

6.Safi Kaskas: The stars and the trees submit to Him.

7.Safi Kaskas: The skies, He raised high and has established the balance

8.Safi Kaskas: That you may not transgress in the balance,

9.Safi Kaskas: but weigh with justice, and do not violate the balance.

10.Safi Kaskas: The earth, He laid out for all living creatures.

11.Safi Kaskas: In it are fruits, and date-palms in clusters.

12.Safi Kaskas: And grains on flourishing stems and fragrant plants.

13.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

14.Safi Kaskas: He created Humankind from dry clay, ringing like pottery.

15.Safi Kaskas: And He created the jinn from a fusion of fire.

16.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

17.Safi Kaskas: He is Lord of the two sunrises and Lord of the two sunsets.

18.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

19.Safi Kaskas: He merged the two seas, converging together,

20.Safi Kaskas: with a barrier they do not over run between them.

21.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

22.Safi Kaskas: From out of both comes pearl and coral.

23.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

24.Safi Kaskas: His are all floating objects, raised above the sea like mountain peaks.

25.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

26.Safi Kaskas: Everyone on it is perishing;

27.Safi Kaskas: but forever will remain the Face of your Lord, full of Majesty and Glory.

28.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

29.Safi Kaskas: To Him turn everyone in the heavens and on earth for their needs; and every day He manifests Himself in yet another way.

30.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

31.Safi Kaskas: We will soon attend to your judgment, you burdensome two.

32.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

33.Safi Kaskas: Jinn and Humankind, if you are able to break through the confines of the heavens and earth, then break through them. You will not break through except with authority.

34.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

35.Safi Kaskas: A flash of fire and brass will be sent against you, and you will not be helped.

36.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

37.Safi Kaskas: And when the heaven is split open and becomes rose-colored like oil

38.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

39.Safi Kaskas: On that Day, no human and no jinn will be asked about his sins.

40.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

41.Safi Kaskas: Those who forced others to reject Our messages, will be known by their marks, and they will be seized by the foreheads and the feet.

42.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

43.Safi Kaskas: This is Hell, which those who forced others to reject Our messages denied.

44.Safi Kaskas: They will circulate them between fire and scalding water.

45.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

46.Safi Kaskas: But for he who feared to be one day in the Presence of his Lord are two Gardens

47.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

48.Safi Kaskas: With shading branches.

49.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

50.Safi Kaskas: In them are two flowing springs.

51.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

52.Safi Kaskas: and they have pairs of every kind of fruits.

53.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

54.Safi Kaskas: They will be reclining on couches lined with silk brocade, and the fruit of the two Gardens are near at hand.

55.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

56.Safi Kaskas: In them are creature-mates of modest gaze, untouched before them by man or jinn.

57.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

58.Safi Kaskas: As though they were rubies and coral.

59.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

60.Safi Kaskas: Will the reward for goodness be anything but goodness?

61.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

62.Safi Kaskas: And beneath them are two other gardens

63.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

64.Safi Kaskas: Dark green.

65.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

66.Safi Kaskas: With two gushing springs.

67.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings do you both deny?

68.Safi Kaskas: In them are fruits, date-palms and pomegranates.

69.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

70.Safi Kaskas: In them are sweet and lovely creatures

71.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

72.Safi Kaskas: Hoor, kept close in their pavilions

73.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

74.Safi Kaskas: Untouched before them by man or jinn

75.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

76.Safi Kaskas: Reclining on green cushions and beautiful fine carpets.

77.Safi Kaskas: So which of your Lord's blessings will you deny?

78.Safi Kaskas: Blessed be the name of your Lord, full of Majesty and Glory.

56.SurahEnglishNames: The Event, The Inevitable, That Which is Coming

1.Safi Kaskas: When the Inevitable Event occurs,

2.Safi Kaskas: no one will deny its occurrence.

3.Safi Kaskas: Lowering some and raising others.

4.Safi Kaskas: When the earth is shaken violently

5.Safi Kaskas: and the mountains are crushed and crumble

6.Safi Kaskas: and become scattered dust,

7.Safi Kaskas: then you [human beings] will be divided into three separate groups:

8.Safi Kaskas: Those on the right. What of those on the right?

9.Safi Kaskas: And those on the left. What of those on the left?

10.Safi Kaskas: And those who are ahead upfront,

11.Safi Kaskas: they are the ones brought near

12.Safi Kaskas: in the Gardens of Bliss

13.Safi Kaskas: They are a large group of the earlier generations

14.Safi Kaskas: and a few of later generations,

15.Safi Kaskas: They recline on luxurious woven couches.

16.Safi Kaskas: Reclining on them, facing each other

17.Safi Kaskas: circulating  among them will be ever youthful beings

18.Safi Kaskas: with vessels, pitchers and a cup of a pure drink

19.Safi Kaskas: causing no headache and no intoxication.

20.Safi Kaskas: There will be a selection of fruits

21.Safi Kaskas: and any bird meat they desire

22.Safi Kaskas: and Hoor Ein

23.Safi Kaskas: like well-protected pearls,

24.Safi Kaskas: a reward for what they used to do.

25.Safi Kaskas: They will hear no idle or sinful talk there,

26.Safi Kaskas: only the greeting: "Peace, peace."

27.Safi Kaskas: Those on the right, what of those on the right?

28.Safi Kaskas: [They will be] among thorns free lotus trees

29.Safi Kaskas: and fruit-laden acacias

30.Safi Kaskas: and extended shade,

31.Safi Kaskas: outpouring water

32.Safi Kaskas: abundant fruits

33.Safi Kaskas: neither withheld nor forbidden,

34.Safi Kaskas: on elevated daybeds

35.Safi Kaskas: We have specially created them

36.Safi Kaskas: originals,

37.Safi Kaskas: perfectly created and perfectly matching.

38.Safi Kaskas: For those of the right

39.Safi Kaskas: a group of the earlier generation

40.Safi Kaskas: and a group of the later generation.

41.Safi Kaskas: Those of the left, what of those on the left?

42.Safi Kaskas: [They will be] amidst scorching fire and scalding water

43.Safi Kaskas: and a shade of black smoke,

44.Safi Kaskas: neither cool nor refreshing.

45.Safi Kaskas: They used to live luxuriously,

46.Safi Kaskas: but they persisted in the greatest offenses against God,

47.Safi Kaskas: And they used to say, "When we're dead and turned to dust and bones, shall we then be resurrected,

48.Safi Kaskas: and our forefathers too?"

49.Safi Kaskas: Say, "The former and the later people

50.Safi Kaskas: will all be gathered on a predetermined Day."

51.Safi Kaskas: Then you, you who are misguided and reject the truth,

52.Safi Kaskas: will be eating from trees of Zaqqum.

53.Safi Kaskas: You will be filling your bellies with it,

54.Safi Kaskas: drinking boiling water on top of it,

55.Safi Kaskas: drinking it like thirsty camels.

56.Safi Kaskas: That will be their welcome on Judgment Day.

57.Safi Kaskas: We created you, so why you do not believe?

58.Safi Kaskas: Have you seen the semen which you ejaculate?

59.Safi Kaskas: Is it you who creates it, or are We the Creator?

60.Safi Kaskas: We have decreed death among you, and nothing can stop Us

61.Safi Kaskas: if We want to replace you and to recreate you in a way that you know nothing about.

62.Safi Kaskas: You have already known the first creation, so will you not remember?

63.Safi Kaskas: Have you seen what you cultivate?

64.Safi Kaskas: Is it you who makes it grow, or are We the grower?

65.Safi Kaskas: If We wish, We can turn it into ruins, and you would be left to wonder,

66.Safi Kaskas: [Saying], "we are now in debt;

67.Safi Kaskas: Rather, We have been deprived."

68.Safi Kaskas: And have you seen the water that you drink?

69.Safi Kaskas: Is it you who sent it down from the clouds, or are We the Sender?

70.Safi Kaskas: If We wish, We can make it bitter, why then you are not grateful?

71.Safi Kaskas: And have you seen the fire that you kindle?

72.Safi Kaskas: Is it you who produced its tree, or are We the Producer?

73.Safi Kaskas: We have made it a reminder and provision for all who kindle it,

74.Safi Kaskas: exalt, then, the glory of your Lord's Name; the Magnificent.

75.Safi Kaskas: I swear by the positioning of the stars,

76.Safi Kaskas: a tremendous oath, if you only knew,

77.Safi Kaskas: it is a noble Qur'an

78.Safi Kaskas: kept in a well-protected record;

79.Safi Kaskas: where none will be allowed to touch it except the purified,

80.Safi Kaskas: revealed gradually by the Lord of the worlds.

81.Safi Kaskas: Is it then this statement that you are ridiculing

82.Safi Kaskas: and you deny it as if your livelihood depends on it?

83.Safi Kaskas: Why then, when the soul at death reaches the throat,

84.Safi Kaskas: and you are at that time looking on,

85.Safi Kaskas: when we're closer to him than you are, but you do not see.

86.Safi Kaskas: Why then, if you are not dependent on Us,

87.Safi Kaskas: don't you restore his soul back to him, if your claim is true?

88.Safi Kaskas: If the deceased was of those brought near to God,

89.Safi Kaskas: he will then have eternal harmony, eternal delight and a Garden of Bliss.

90.Safi Kaskas: And if he was from those on the right,

91.Safi Kaskas: then "Peace be to you, from your companions on the right."

92.Safi Kaskas: But if he was from those who called the truth a lie and were misguided,

93.Safi Kaskas: he will be welcomed with boiling water

94.Safi Kaskas: and will burn in Hell.

95.Safi Kaskas: This is the certain Truth,

96.Safi Kaskas: exalt, then, the glory of your Lord's name; the Magnificent.

1.Safi Kaskas: Everything in the heavens and earth exalts God's limitless glory.  He is the Almighty, the Wise.

2.Safi Kaskas: The Kingdom of the heavens and earth belongs to Him. He gives life and causes death, and He is able to do all things.

3.Safi Kaskas: He is the First and the Last, the Outer and the Inner, and He has knowledge of all things.

4.Safi Kaskas: It is He who created the heavens and the earth in six days, then established Himself above the Throne. He knows what penetrates into the earth and what comes out of it, and what descends from the heaven and what ascends to it. He is with you wherever you may be. God sees everything you do.

5.Safi Kaskas: The Kingdom of the heavens and the earth belongs to Him. All matters are referred back to God.

6.Safi Kaskas: He merges the night into the day and merges the day into the night. He knows what is in your hearts.

7.Safi Kaskas: Believe in God and His Messenger and give out from that with which He has entrusted you. Those among the believers who give will have a great reward.

8.Safi Kaskas: Why would you not believe in God, when the Messenger is inviting you to believe in your Lord and He has received a pledge from you, if you are believers?

9.Safi Kaskas: It is He who sends down clear revelations to His servant, that He may bring you out from the darkness of ignorance into enlightenment. God is kind to you and Merciful-to-all.

10.Safi Kaskas: And why shouldn't you spend in the cause of God, when the inheritance of the heavens and the earth belongs to God? Those of you who contributed before the conquest, and fought, are not equal to those who contributed and fought afterwards. They are higher in rank. But God promises both a good reward. God is All-Aware of what you do.

11.Safi Kaskas: Who will make a loan of goodness to God, so that He may multiply it for him and reward him generously?

12.Safi Kaskas: On the Day when you see the believing men and believing women, their light proceeding ahead of them and to their right, "Good news for you today: Gardens with rivers flowing through them, where you will remain eternally. That is the great victory".

13.Safi Kaskas: On the Day, the hypocritical men and hypocritical women will say to the believers, "Wait for us. Let us have some of your light." They will be told, "Go back and look for light." And a wall will be raised between them with a gate in it; inside it there is mercy, but outside lies punishment.

14.Safi Kaskas: The hypocrites will call to the believers, "Were we not with you?" They will say, "Yes, but you allowed yourselves to be tempted, and waited and doubted, deceived by wishful thinking until God's command came and the Deceiver deceived you about God."

15.Safi Kaskas: Today no ransom will be accepted from you, nor from those who rejected the truth. Your home is the Fire. It is most worthy of you. What a miserable destination.

16.Safi Kaskas: Is it not time for those believers hearts to become humbly submissive to the remembrance of God and to the Truth He has sent down? So they are not like those who were given the Book before them, whose time was extended but whose hearts hardened, and many of them are wicked

17.Safi Kaskas: Know that God revives the earth after it dies. We made clear to you the signs; that you may comprehend.

18.Safi Kaskas: For charitable men and women who have loaned God a loan of goodness, it will be multiplied for them, and they will have a generous reward.

19.Safi Kaskas: Those who believed in God and His Messengers are the truthful ones who will bear witness before their Lord. They will have their reward and their light. But the unbelievers and those who reject Our revelations will be the inhabitants of Hell.

20.Safi Kaskas: Know that the life of this world is just a game; recreation, glitter, boasting to one another and rivalry in wealth and children. It is like a rain that helps plants grow, pleasing the growers, but then it dries up and you see it turn yellow, then it becomes stubble. There is severe punishment in the Hereafter, as well as forgiveness from God and [His] approval. The life of this world is only an illusion.

21.Safi Kaskas: So pursue forgiveness from your Lord and a Garden as vast as the heavens and the earth is prepared for [or 'awaits'] those who believed in God and His Messengers. That is the blessing of God which He gives to whom He wills. God is limitless in His blessings.

22.Safi Kaskas: No misfortune occurs, either on earth or in your souls but it is recorded in a Book even before We make it happen. That is easy for God

23.Safi Kaskas: So you will not grieve for what you missed or rejoice over what He has given you. For God does not like the vain and the arrogant,

24.Safi Kaskas: those who are stingy and direct others to be stingy. Whoever turns away, [remember] God is rich beyond need, worthy of all praise.

25.Safi Kaskas: We sent Our Messengers with clear evidence and We sent down with them the Book and the Balance, that people may establish justice. And We sent down iron, which can be used for military might and to benefit people in many different ways. So that God may know those who uplifted Him and His Messengers though He is beyond their senses.  God is All-Powerful, Almighty.

26.Safi Kaskas: We sent Noah and Abraham and placed prophethood and the Book among some of their descendants. Some of them were guided, but many were wicked

27.Safi Kaskas: Then We sent Our Messengers to follow in their footsteps and followed up with Jesus, the son of Mary, and gave him the Gospel. We placed compassion and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him. As for monasticism, which they invented to seek God's pleasure, We did not ordain for them, and they did not observe properly. So We gave those who believed among them their reward, but many of them are wicked.

28.Safi Kaskas: Believers, be ever mindful of God and believe in His Messenger; He will give you a double share of His mercy, provide you a light to guide you and forgive you; God is Ever Forgiving and Merciful-to-all.

29.Safi Kaskas: That the people of the Book may know that they have no power whatsoever over God's blessings, and that all blessings are in God's Hand; He gives it to whomever He wills. God is limitless with His blessings.

58.SurahEnglishNames: She That Disputeth, The Pleading Woman, She Who Pleaded

1.Safi Kaskas: God has heard the words of the woman who argued with you concerning her husband, while complaining to God. God heard your conversation.  God is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

2.Safi Kaskas: There are those of you who divorce their wives by equating them with their mothers, they are not their mothers. Their mothers are those who gave birth to them. What they said is wrong and a blatant lie. But God is All-Pardoning and All-Forgiving.

3.Safi Kaskas: Those of you who divorce your wives by equating them with your mothers, then wish to go back on what you said, must set free a slave before they touch one another. This is what you are instructed to do, and God is well aware of what you do.

4.Safi Kaskas: But he who does not find the means, must fast for two months consecutively before touching one another. And if he is unable, then he should feed sixty needy people. This is to affirm your faith in God and His Messenger.  These are the limits set by God. And the unbelievers will have a painful punishment.

5.Safi Kaskas: Those who oppose God and His Messenger will be restrained, like those before them. We have sent down self-evident messages. The unbelievers will have a painful punishment

6.Safi Kaskas: on the Day when God will resurrect them all, and tells them what they did. God has kept accounts of it all, while they have forgotten it; God is Witness over all things.

7.Safi Kaskas: Do not you realize that God knows everything in the heavens and on earth? There is no secret conversation between three people, but He is their fourth; nor between five, but He is their sixth; nor between less than that, nor more, but He is with them wherever they are. Then, on the Day of Resurrection, He will inform them of what they did. God is All-knowing of everything.

8.Safi Kaskas: Have you not noticed that those who were prohibited from conspiring secretly, have returned to what they were prohibited from doing? They conspire to commit wrongdoing, aggression, and defiance of the Messenger. And when they come to you, they greet you with a greeting that God never greeted you with. And they say to themselves, "Why does not God punish us for what we say?" Hell will be enough for them. They will burn there. What a miserable destiny.

9.Safi Kaskas: Believers, when you converse privately, do not converse about committing wrongdoing, aggression and defiance of the Messenger, but converse about righteousness and being mindful of God. Be ever mindful of God, to whom you will be gathered.

10.Safi Kaskas: Conversing in secret to conspire is from Satan, to dishearten the believers, though it will not harm them at all, unless God permits it. So let the believers put their trust in God.

11.Safi Kaskas: Believers, when you are told to make room in your gathering, then do so; God will make room for you. And when you are told, "Get up," then get up; God will elevate in rank those who believed among you and those who were given knowledge. God is well aware of what you do.

12.Safi Kaskas: Believers, when you privately converse with the Messenger, proceed by offering something in charity. That is better for you and purer. But if you do not find the means to do so, then God is Ever-Forgiving and Merciful-to-all.

13.Safi Kaskas: Do you regret not offering charity before your conversation with the Prophet? If you did not give, and God pardoned you, then perform prayers, and give charitable gifts, and obey God and His Messenger. God is well Aware of what you do.

14.Safi Kaskas: Don't you see those who befriend a people with whom God is angry? They are neither with you nor with them, and knowingly swear to lies.

15.Safi Kaskas: God has prepared a severe punishment for them. What they were doing is evil.

16.Safi Kaskas: They took their oaths as a cover-up, and turned others away from the way of God. They will have a humiliating punishment.

17.Safi Kaskas: Neither their wealth nor their children will be of any use to them against God. They will be the inhabitants of the Fire, where they will remain

18.Safi Kaskas: On the Day when God will resurrect them altogether, they will swear to Him as they swear to you, thinking that this will help them. What liars they are.

19.Safi Kaskas: Satan has overcome them and made them forget the remembrance of God. Those are the party of Satan. Unquestionably, the party of Satan will be the doomed.

20.Safi Kaskas: Those who oppose God and His Messenger are among the most humiliated.

21.Safi Kaskas: God has written, "I will surely prevail, I and My Messengers."  God is All- Powerful, Almighty.

22.Safi Kaskas: You will not find a people who believe in God and the Last Day, loyal to those who oppose God and His Messenger, even if they were their parents or their children, or their brothers or their close relatives. God has written faith into the hearts of these people, and has strengthened them with His spirit. He will admit them to Gardens graced with flowing streams, where they will dwell forever. God is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him. These are of the party of God. Unquestionably, the party of God will be the successful.

1.Safi Kaskas: All that exists in the heavens and the earth is praising God's limitless glory. He is the Almighty, the Most Wise.

2.Safi Kaskas: It is He who evicted those who broke faith among the people of the Book from their homes at the first mobilization. You did not think they would leave, and they thought their fortresses would protect them from God. But God came at them from where they least expected it, and He put panic into their hearts. They wrecked their homes with their own hands, and by the hands of the believers. Therefore, take a lesson, all of you with insight.

3.Safi Kaskas: Had God not decreed evacuation for them, He would have punished them in this world, and in the Hereafter they will have the punishment of the Fire.

4.Safi Kaskas: That is because they opposed God and His Messenger. God is severe in punishment toward anyone opposing God.

5.Safi Kaskas: Whatever you have cut down of their palm trees or left standing on its roots, it is by permission of God. So that He might disgrace the defiantly disobedient.

6.Safi Kaskas: Whatever God has given to His Messenger from them; you did not have to spur your horses or camels for them, but God gives authority to His Messengers over whomever He will. God is able to do all things.

7.Safi Kaskas: Whatever gains God has restored to His Messenger from the villages' inhabitants belongs to God, the Messenger, the relatives, the orphans, the needy, and to the wayfarer; so that it may not circulate mainly between the wealthy among you. So accept whatever the Messenger gives you, and abstain from whatever he forbids you. And be mindful of God. God is severe in punishment.

8.Safi Kaskas: It is also for the poor emigrants who were driven out of their homes and their possessions, who seek God's blessings and His approval, and support God and His Messenger. Those are the truly sincere.

9.Safi Kaskas: And (also for] those who before them, were already established in their homes [in Medina], and have accepted faith. They love those who migrated to them, and find no hesitation in their hearts in helping them. They give them preference over themselves, even if they themselves are needy. Whoever is spared from his own soul's greed is truly successful.

10.Safi Kaskas: Those who came after them, say, "Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith, and leave no malice in our hearts toward those who believe. Our Lord, You are Most Compassionate, Merciful-to-all."

11.Safi Kaskas: Have you noticed those who act hypocritically? They say to their brothers, the faithless among the people of the Book, "If you are driven out, we will surely leave with you, and we will not obey anyone who wants to harm you; and should anyone fight you, we will certainly support you." But God bears witness that they are truly liars.

12.Safi Kaskas: If they are driven out, they will not leave with them, and if they are fought, they will not support them. Even if they should support them, they will surely turn their backs and flee; then they will not be helped.

13.Safi Kaskas: Indeed, you [believers] strike more terror in their hearts than their fear of God. That is because they are a people who do not understand.

14.Safi Kaskas: Even united they will not fight you except within fortified strongholds, or from behind walls. There is much hostility between them. You think they are united, but their hearts are diverse. That is because they are a people without reason.

15.Safi Kaskas: Like those who went shortly before them. They experience the evil consequences of their decisions. A painful punishment awaits them.

16.Safi Kaskas: They are like Satan who says to a human being, "Do not believe." But when he denies the truth, he says, "I disown you; I fear God, the Lord of the worlds."

17.Safi Kaskas: The ultimate end of both is the Fire, where they will dwell forever. That is the reward of the unjust.

18.Safi Kaskas: Believers, be mindful of God. And let every soul consider what it has put forth for tomorrow, and be mindful of God, for God is well aware of what you do.

19.Safi Kaskas: And do not be like those who forgot God, so He made them forget themselves. These are the defiantly disobedient.

20.Safi Kaskas: The inhabitants of the Fire and the inhabitants of Paradise are not equal. It is the inhabitants of Paradise who are the winners.

21.Safi Kaskas: Had We sent down this Qur'an on a mountain, you would have seen it humbling itself and crumbling in awe of God. These examples We mention for the people, that they may reflect.

22.Safi Kaskas: He is God, there is no god but Him, the Knower of all that is beyond our senses and all that we can witness. He is the Mercy giver, the Merciful-to-all.

23.Safi Kaskas: He is God, there is no god but Him, the Sovereign, the Holy, the Peace Giver, the Faith Giver, the Overseer, the Almighty, the Powerful, the Supremely Great. May God be exalted in His glory, above all they associate with Him.

24.Safi Kaskas: He is God, the Creator, the Maker, the Fashioner; to Him belongs the Most Beautiful Names. Whatever is in the heavens and earth glorifies Him. He is the Almighty, the Wise.

60.SurahEnglishNames: She That is to be Examined, Examining her, She Who is Tested

1.Safi Kaskas: Believers do not take My enemies and yours as allies, offering them affection, when they have rejected the Truth that has come to you. They have driven you and the Messenger out, because you believe in God, your Lord. If you have decided to struggle in My way, seeking My approval, how can you secretly love them? I know what you concealed and what you reveal. Whoever among you does that is straying from the right path.

2.Safi Kaskas: If they ever gain dominance over you, they will treat you as enemies, and they will stretch out their hands and tongues to hurt you. They would dearly wish that you renounce your faith.

3.Safi Kaskas: Never will your blood lines or your children be of any use to you. God will separate you on the Day of Resurrection. God is All-Seeing of what you do.

4.Safi Kaskas: There has already been a good example for you in Abraham and those with him, when they said to their people, "we disown you and what you worship besides God. We reject you, and there will be animosity and hatred forever between us and you until you believe in God alone." Except for Abraham's words to his father, "I will ask forgiveness for you, though I cannot protect you from God". "Our Lord, in You we trust, and to You we repent. To You is the ultimate destination.

5.Safi Kaskas: Our Lord, do not make us a target for the unbelievers, and forgive us. Our Lord, You are the Almighty, the Wise."

6.Safi Kaskas: There is a good example in them for you, for anyone who seeks God and the Last Day. But if anyone turns away, God is the Rich Beyond Need, the Praiseworthy.

7.Safi Kaskas: Perhaps God will restore affection between you and your present enemies. God is able to do all things. God is Ever Forgiving and Merciful-to-all.

8.Safi Kaskas: God does not forbid you from dealing kindly and equitably with those who did not fight you because of your faith and did not drive you out of your homes.  God loves those who are equitable.

9.Safi Kaskas: But God forbids you from befriending those who fought against you over your faith and drove you from your homes and helped others to drive you out. Any who takes them for friends are the wrongdoers.

10.Safi Kaskas: Believers, when believing women come to you as emigrants, test them. God knows best about their faith. And if you find them to be faithful, then do not return them to the unbelievers. They are not lawful wives for them, nor are they their lawful husbands. But give the unbelievers what they have spent. You are not to blame if you marry them later provided you give them their dues. And do not hold to marriage bonds with unbelieving women, but ask for what you have spent and let them ask for what they have spent. This is God's judgment; He judges between you. God is All-knowing and All-Wise.

11.Safi Kaskas: If any of your wives rejoin the unbelievers, and you decide to penalize them, then give those whose wives have gone the equivalent of what they had spent [out of what you owe the unbelievers]. And be mindful of God, in whom you are believers.

12.Safi Kaskas: Prophet, when believing women come to you, pledging that they will not associate anything with God, nor steal, nor commit adultery, nor will they kill their children, nor lie about who has fathered their children, nor disobey you in what is right, then accept their pledge of allegiance and ask God's forgiveness for them.  God is Forgiving and Merciful-to-all.

13.Safi Kaskas: Believers do not take as allies those with whom God is angry. They have despaired of the Hereafter, as unbelievers despair of those buried in their graves.

1.Safi Kaskas: Everything in the heavens and the earth declare the praises of God's limitless glory. He is the Almighty, the Wise.

2.Safi Kaskas: Believers, why do you say what you do not do?

3.Safi Kaskas: it is most despicable in God's sight that you say what you do not do.

4.Safi Kaskas: God loves those who fight in solid lines for His cause, as though they were a well-built structure.

5.Safi Kaskas: And mention when Moses said to his people, "My people, why do you hurt me when you know that I am God's Messenger to you?" And when they turned away, God caused their hearts to turn away. God does not guide the defiantly disobedient people.

6.Safi Kaskas: And when Jesus son of Mary said, "O children of Israel, I am God's Messenger to you, confirming what is available of the Torah, and bringing good news of a messenger who will come after me, whose name is Ahmad." But when he came to them with clear evidence, they said, "This is obvious magic."

7.Safi Kaskas: And who is more unjust than one who invents lies and attributes them to God when invited to submit? God does not guide unjust people.

8.Safi Kaskas: They wish to extinguish God's enlightenment with their mouths, but God will perfect His light, even though the unbelievers dislike it.

9.Safi Kaskas: It is He who sent His Messenger with guidance and the religion of Truth, that he may proclaim it over all religions, even though those who associate others with God will dislike it.

10.Safi Kaskas: Believers, will I guide you to a transaction that will save you from a painful punishment?

11.Safi Kaskas: That you believe in God and His Messenger, and strive in the cause of God with your wealth and yourselves. That is best for you, if you only knew.

12.Safi Kaskas: He will forgive you your sins; and will admit you to Gardens with rivers flowing through them and pleasant dwellings in the Gardens of Eden. That is the great success.

13.Safi Kaskas: And another thing you love: support from God and imminent victory; Give good news to the believers.

14.Safi Kaskas: Believers, be supporters of God, as Jesus, the son of Mary, said to the disciples, "Who are my supporters to God?" The disciples said, "We are God's supporters." A faction of the Children of Israel believed, and another faction disbelieved. So We supported those who believed against their enemy, and they became dominant.

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Safi Kaskas: Everything in the heavens and the earth declare the praises of God's limitless glory, the Sovereign, the Holy, the Almighty, the Wise.

2.Safi Kaskas: It is He who raised a messenger from among the Gentiles; reciting His revelations to them, purifying them, and teaching them the Book and Wisdom; although before that they were clearly misguided

3.Safi Kaskas: and [he is sent] to others of them who have not yet joined them. God is the Almighty, the Wise.

4.Safi Kaskas: Such is God's favor, which He gives to whom He wills; God is the possessor of great favors.

5.Safi Kaskas: The example of those who were entrusted to uphold the Torah, but then failed to uphold it, is that of a donkey carrying volumes of knowledge. Terrible is the example of the people who reject the signs of God. God does not guide the unjust People.

6.Safi Kaskas: Say, " you who follow Judaism, if you claim that out of all people you alone are friends of God, then wish for death if you are truthful."

7.Safi Kaskas: But they will not wish for it, ever, because of what their hands have done. God knows the unjust well.

8.Safi Kaskas: Say, "The death from which you are fleeing will catch up with you. Then you will be returned to the Knower of the unknown and the known, and He will inform you about what you used to do."

9.Safi Kaskas: Believers, when the call is made for prayer on Friday, drop all business and rush to the remembrance of God. That is better for you, if you only knew.

10.Safi Kaskas: Then when the prayer is concluded, disperse through the land, and seek God's favor, and remember to call on God without ceasing, so that you may prosper.

11.Safi Kaskas: Yet whenever they come across some business, or some entertainment, they scramble towards it, and leave you standing there. Say, "That which is with God is better than entertainment and business; God is the Best of providers."

1.Safi Kaskas: When the hypocrites come to you, they say, "We bear witness that you are indeed God's Messenger."  God knows that you are indeed His Messenger and God bears witness that the hypocrites are indeed liars.

2.Safi Kaskas: They have taken their oaths as a cover, to divert people from the way of God.  Evil is what they do.

3.Safi Kaskas: That is because they believed, and then rejected the truth; so their hearts have been sealed, and they cannot understand.

4.Safi Kaskas: When you see them, their appearance appeals to you. And when they speak, you listen to what they say. They are like propped up timber. They think every shout is aimed at them. They are the enemy, so beware of them. May God destroy them; how devious they are?

5.Safi Kaskas: And when It is said to them, "Come, the Messenger of God will ask forgiveness for you," they turn their heads aside in contempt and you see them turning away arrogantly.

6.Safi Kaskas: It is all the same for them whether you ask forgiveness for them or do not ask forgiveness for them; God will not forgive them.  God does not guide such defiantly disobedient people.

7.Safi Kaskas: It is they who say, "Give nothing to those who follow God's Messenger, until they dispersed from around him." To God belongs the treasuries of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites do not understand.

8.Safi Kaskas: They say, "If we return to Medina, the more worthy will drive out the disgraced." But all worth belongs to God, His Messenger, and the believers; though the hypocrites do not know it.

9.Safi Kaskas: Believers, let neither your wealth nor your children distract you from remembering to call upon God. Whoever does that are the doomed.

10.Safi Kaskas: Give from what We have provided for you, before death comes to one of you, and he says, "My Lord, if You would only delay me for a little while, so that I may be charitable, and be among the righteous."

11.Safi Kaskas: But God will never delay a soul when its time has come. God is well aware of what you do.

1.Safi Kaskas: Everything in the heavens and the earth declare the praises of God's limitless glory. To Him belongs the Kingdom, and to Him all praise is due. He is able to do all things.

2.Safi Kaskas: It is He who created you. Yet some of you deny the truth, and some believe it. God sees everything you do.

3.Safi Kaskas: He created the heavens and earth in Truth, and shaped you and perfected your shapes; and to Him is the ultimate destination.

4.Safi Kaskas: He knows everything in the heavens and the earth, and He knows what you conceal and what you reveal. God knows very well the secrets of every heart.

5.Safi Kaskas: Has the news not reached you, of those who rejected the truth before you? They tasted the ill consequences of their conduct, and they will have a painful punishment.

6.Safi Kaskas: That is because their messengers came to them with clear evidence, but they said, "Are human beings going to guide us?" So they denied their messengers and turned away. God had no need for them; God is reach beyond need and praiseworthy.

7.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers claim that they will never be resurrected. Say, "Yes indeed, by my Lord, you will be resurrected; then you will be informed of everything you did; that is easy for God."

8.Safi Kaskas: So believe in God and His Messenger and the enlightenment We have sent down. God is well aware of what you do.

9.Safi Kaskas: When He gathers you for the Day of Gathering, the Day of mutual neglect, whoever believes in God and does good deeds, He will forgive him his misdeeds and admit him to Gardens with rivers flowing through them, where they will remain forever. That is the great success.

10.Safi Kaskas: But for those who disbelieve and deny Our revelations, these are the companions of the Fire, remaining there forever; and what a miserable destination.

11.Safi Kaskas: No disaster occurs except by permission of God. Whoever believes in God, He will guide his heart. God has full knowledge of everything.

12.Safi Kaskas: Obey God and obey the Messenger. But if you turn away, it is only incumbent on Our messenger to deliver the clear message.

13.Safi Kaskas: God, there is no god but Him. So let the believers put their trust in Him.

14.Safi Kaskas: Believers, there are enemies to you among your wives and your children, so beware of them. But if you pardon, overlook, and forgive, God is forgiving and Merciful-to-all.

15.Safi Kaskas: Your possessions and your children are a test for you, but with God there is a great reward.

16.Safi Kaskas: So be mindful of God as much as you can; hear and obey and be charitable, it is for your own good. He who is safe-guarded from his own greed, those are the successful ones.

17.Safi Kaskas: If you loan God a loan of goodness, He will multiply it for you, and forgive you. God is appreciative and forbearing.

18.Safi Kaskas: He's the Knower of all that is beyond our senses and all that we can witness, the Almighty, the Wise.

1.Safi Kaskas: Prophet, when any of you intend to divorce wives, do so at the beginning of their prescribed waiting period. Calculate the period's term carefully and be mindful of God, your Lord. Do not drive them out of their homes, nor should they leave during that period, unless they have committed a proven adultery. These are the limits of God and whoever oversteps God's limits wrongs his own soul. You never know what new situation God may bring about.

2.Safi Kaskas: When they have fulfilled their term, either retain them honorably, or part with them honorably. And call from among your just witnesses, to give testimony for God's sake. Anyone who believes in God and the Last Day should heed this. God will find a way out for whoever is mindful of Him

3.Safi Kaskas: and will provide for him from an unexpected source. God will suffice for those who put their trust in Him.  God will achieve His purpose. God has set a due measure for everything.

4.Safi Kaskas: If you have any doubts, regarding a wife who has ceased menstruating and for one who have not yet menstruated, the period of waiting shall be three months. And for those who are pregnant, their term shall be until they have delivered. God makes things easy for those who are mindful of Him.

5.Safi Kaskas: This is God's command which He sent down to you. God will forgive the misdeeds and increase the rewards of anyone who is mindful of Him.

6.Safi Kaskas: Allow the wives you are divorcing to reside where you reside, according to your means. Do not harass them in order to make things difficult for them. If they are pregnant, maintain them until they give birth. And if they nurse your infant, compensate them fairly. Maintain your relationship in a friendly and honorable way. But if you disagree, then let another woman nurse him.

7.Safi Kaskas: Let the wealthy spend according to his wealth, and he whose resources are restricted shall spend according to what God has given him. God does not burden a soul beyond what He has given it. After hardship, God will bring ease.

8.Safi Kaskas: Many a town defied the command of its Lord and His Messengers, so We held them strictly accountable, and We punished them with a horrifying punishment

9.Safi Kaskas: to experience the   consequences of its decisions, and the outcome of its decisions was total loss.

10.Safi Kaskas: God has prepared a severe punishment for them.So you who are endowed with insight and have faith, be conscious of God. He has sent down a Reminder to you,

11.Safi Kaskas: a Messenger who recites God's verses that make things clear to you, that he may bring those who believe and do good deeds from the darkness of ignorance into enlightenment. God will admit those who believe in Him and do good deeds into Gardens with rivers flowing through them, to dwell there forever and ever. God has provided excellently for them.

12.Safi Kaskas: It is God who created seven heavens, and a similar number of earths. His command descends through them, so that you may know that God is able to do all things, and that God's knowledge has encompassed all things.

1.Safi Kaskas: Prophet, why do you prohibit what God has made lawful to you, seeking to please your wives? God is forgiving and Merciful-to-all.

2.Safi Kaskas: God has already ordained for you [believers) to release you from such oaths. God is your protector and He is the All-knowing, the All-Wise.

3.Safi Kaskas: The Prophet told something in confidence to one of his wives. But when she disclosed it [to another wife], God made it known to him; he confirmed part of it, and ignored another part. Then when he confronted her with it, she asked, "Who told you this?" He said, "I was informed by the All-knowing, the All-Aware."

4.Safi Kaskas: You two [wives] need to repent to God, for your hearts have clearly deviated. But if you band together against him, then God is his protector, as is Gabriel and the righteous believers. In addition, the angels will come to his support.

5.Safi Kaskas: Perhaps if he divorced you, his Lord will give him wives better than you: submissive to God, believing, obedient, repentant, worshipping, who fast much; previously married as well as virgins.

6.Safi Kaskas: Believers, safeguard yourselves and your families from a Fire fueled by people and stones. fierce and powerful angels stand over it. They never disobey God's commands to them, but do as they are commanded.

7.Safi Kaskas: Unbelievers make no excuses today. You are only being repaid for what you used to do.

8.Safi Kaskas: Believers, turn to God in sincere repentance. Your Lord may remove your sins, and admit you into Gardens with rivers flowing through them, on the Day when God will not disgrace the Prophet and those who believed with him. Their light will proceed before them, and to their right, they will say, "Our Lord, perfect our light for us and forgive us. You are able to do all things."

9.Safi Kaskas: Prophet, strive against the unbelievers and the hypocrites and be harsh with them. Hell will be their dwelling. What a miserable destination.

10.Safi Kaskas: God has given an example to those who reject the truth: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were married to two of Our righteous worshipers but they betrayed them. They were not able to help them at all with God, and it was said, "Enter the Fire with those who are entering."

11.Safi Kaskas: And God has given an example to those who believed: Pharaoh's wife, when she said, "My Lord, build for me near You, a house in Paradise, and rescue me from Pharaoh and his works and save me from the unjust people."

12.Safi Kaskas: And the example of Mary, Imran's daughter, who guarded her chastity. So We breathed into her from Our Spirit; and she believed in her Lord's Words and His Books, and was one of the devoutly obedient.

1.Safi Kaskas: Exalted is He who has all Sovereignty in His Hand, who has power over all things

2.Safi Kaskas: He who created death and life to test you as to which of you is best in deed. He is the Almighty, the Forgiving,

3.Safi Kaskas: it is He who created seven heavens in total harmony with one another. You will not see any discrepancy in the creation of the Merciful-to-all. Look again, do you see any gaps?

4.Safi Kaskas: Then look again, and again, and your sight will return to you dazzled and exhausted.

5.Safi Kaskas: We have beautified the lowest heaven with lit objects and use them as tools to stone devils and have prepared for them the punishment of the Blazing fire.

6.Safi Kaskas: For those who reject their Lord, there is the punishment of Hell, a miserable destination.

7.Safi Kaskas: When they are thrown into it, they will hear it roaring, as it seethes.

8.Safi Kaskas: It almost bursts with rage. Every time a group is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, "Did no one come to warn you?"

9.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "Yes, someone came to warn us, but we did not believe in him and said, 'God has not sent down anything. You are in greatly misguided.' "

10.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "Had we listened or reasoned, we would not have been included among the inhabitants of the Blazing fire."

11.Safi Kaskas: So they will come to realize and admit their sin. Away with the inhabitants of the Blazing fire.

12.Safi Kaskas: Forgiveness and great reward await those who stand in awe of their Lord although He is beyond the reach of their perception.

13.Safi Kaskas: Whether you keep your thoughts to yourself, or state them openly, He knows what is within the heart.

14.Safi Kaskas: Would He who created not know, when He is the Most Subtle, the Totally Aware?

15.Safi Kaskas: It is He who tamed the earth for you, so travel its regions, and eat of His provision. To Him you will be resurrected.

16.Safi Kaskas: Do you feel confident that He who is in the heaven would not cause the earth to swallow you as it spins?

17.Safi Kaskas: Or are you confident that He who is in heaven would not unleash a violent storm of stones against you?Then you will know how true My warning was.

18.Safi Kaskas: Those before them had already denied my warnings, and how terrible was My condemnation.

19.Safi Kaskas: Have they not seen the birds above them, with wings outspread or folded in? None holds them except the Merciful-to-all.  He is, The Ever Insightful.

20.Safi Kaskas: Or who can be a force to protect you other than the Merciful-to-all? The unbelievers are really living in delusion.

21.Safi Kaskas: Or who can provide for you if He withholds His provision? Yet they persist in their disrespect and evasion.

22.Safi Kaskas: Is he who walks, stumbles and falls on his face better guided or he who walks upright on a straight path?

23.Safi Kaskas: Say, "It is He who brought you into being; and gave you hearing and vision and understanding. But you are rarely grateful."

24.Safi Kaskas: Say, "It is He who scattered you on earth, and to Him you will be gathered."

25.Safi Kaskas: And they say, "When will this promise be fulfilled, if what you say is true?"

26.Safi Kaskas: Say, "God alone has knowledge of this, and I am only delivering a clear warning."

27.Safi Kaskas: But when they see it approaching, the unbelievers' faces will turn gloomy, and it will be said, "This is what you were calling for."

28.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Just think: Should God destroy me and those with me, or if He decides to have mercy on us, who will protect the unbelievers from a painful punishment?"

29.Safi Kaskas: Say, "He is the Merciful-to-all; We have believed in Him, and in Him We trust. You will come to know who is in evident error."

30.Safi Kaskas: Say, "Just think: if your water drains away, who will bring you pure flowing water?"

1.Safi Kaskas: Nun. By the pen and all they write,

2.Safi Kaskas: you are not, by the grace of your Lord, a madman.

3.Safi Kaskas: And you will have a never ending reward.

4.Safi Kaskas: And you are a man of great moral character.

5.Safi Kaskas: You will see and they will se

6.Safi Kaskas: which of you is afflicted by madness.

7.Safi Kaskas: Your Lord knows best who has strayed from His path, and He knows best who is guided.

8.Safi Kaskas: Then do not obey the unbelievers.

9.Safi Kaskas: They wish that you compromise, so they too can compromise.

10.Safi Kaskas: And do not obey any worthless contemptible swearer

11.Safi Kaskas: or any backbiter and slander-monger,

12.Safi Kaskas: preventer of good, aggressor and one who is sinner,

13.Safi Kaskas: cruel, moreover, and furthermore one who is despicable.

14.Safi Kaskas: Just because he has money and children,

15.Safi Kaskas: when Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Myth of former people."

16.Safi Kaskas: We will brand him on the snout.

17.Safi Kaskas: We have tested them, as We tested the owners of a certain garden, when they vowed to harvest it in the morning

18.Safi Kaskas: and made no allowance [for the Will of God].

19.Safi Kaskas: But a disaster from your Lord came upon it while they slept.

20.Safi Kaskas: By morning it became barren and bleak.

21.Safi Kaskas: At day break they called to one another,

22.Safi Kaskas: saying, "Go early to your crop if you want to harvest the fruit."

23.Safi Kaskas: So they set out, whispering,

24.Safi Kaskas: "Make sure no poor person enters the garden today."

25.Safi Kaskas: And early they went bent on their purpose.

26.Safi Kaskas: But when they saw it, they said, " We are lost;

27.Safi Kaskas: Rather, we have been ruined.

28.Safi Kaskas: The most moderate of them said, "Did I not say to you, that you should praise your Lord's glory?

29.Safi Kaskas: They said, "May our Lord be exalted in His glory, we were unjust."

30.Safi Kaskas: Then they turned to one another, each blaming the other.

31.Safi Kaskas: They said, "How terrible for us; we were aggressors.

32.Safi Kaskas: Perhaps our Lord will give us a better substitute for it. We are turning to our Lord in hope."

33.Safi Kaskas: Such is the punishment. And the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they only knew.

34.Safi Kaskas: There will be Gardens of delight for those who are mindful of God.

35.Safi Kaskas: Would We treat those who submit to us like those who forced others to reject Our messages.

36.Safi Kaskas: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?

37.Safi Kaskas: Or do you have a Book which you study?

38.Safi Kaskas: And in it do you find all that you wish for?

39.Safi Kaskas: Or do you have oaths from Us, that are binding until the Day of Resurrection, allowing you to have whatever you want?

40.Safi Kaskas: Ask them which of them, will be responsible for that claim.

41.Safi Kaskas: Or do they have partners? Then let them bring their partners, if they are telling the truth.

42.Safi Kaskas: On the Day when legs are bared, they will be called to bow down, but will not be able.

43.Safi Kaskas: Their eyes humbled, humiliation will cover them. They were invited to bow down while they were healthy.

44.Safi Kaskas: So leave those who deny this revelation to Me. We will proceed against them gradually, from whence they do not know.

45.Safi Kaskas: And I will give them time.  My plan is firm.

46.Safi Kaskas: Or do you ask them for a wage, so they are burdened with debt?

47.Safi Kaskas: Or do they know the future, and they write what is going to happen?

48.Safi Kaskas: So be patient for your Lord's judgment, and do not be like the fellow of the whale who called out in despair.

49.Safi Kaskas: Had a blessing from his Lord not reached him, he would have been abandoned and disgraced on a naked shore.

50.Safi Kaskas: But his Lord chose him and made him among the righteous.

51.Safi Kaskas: Those unbelievers all but kill you with their evil looks when they hear the message, and they say, "He must be mad."

52.Safi Kaskas: But it is only a reminder to all people.

1.Safi Kaskas: The Hour of Truth!

2.Safi Kaskas: What is the Hour of Truth?

3.Safi Kaskas: And how would you know what is the Hour of Truth?

4.Safi Kaskas: The people of Thamud and 'Aad denied [that there would be a] sudden calamity.

5.Safi Kaskas: So as for Thamud, they were destroyed by the overpowering blast.

6.Safi Kaskas: And as for Aad, they were destroyed by a furious, roaring wind

7.Safi Kaskas: which He unleashed against them for seven nights and eight days, nonstop. You could have seen its people lying dead as if they were hollow palm tree trunks.

8.Safi Kaskas: Do you see anything left of them?

9.Safi Kaskas: Then came Pharaoh and those before him, and the destroyed towns that indulged in sin.

10.Safi Kaskas: They disobeyed their Lord's Messenger, so He seized them with an overpowering grip.

11.Safi Kaskas: When the water overflowed, We carried your ancestors in the sailing ship

12.Safi Kaskas: To make it a lesson for you to remember, so listening ears may recall it.

13.Safi Kaskas: Then when the Horn is blown with a single blast,

14.Safi Kaskas: and the earth and the mountains are lifted up and crushed with one blow,

15.Safi Kaskas: on that Day, the Hour of Truth will occur.

16.Safi Kaskas: The heaven will split open on that Day, since it will be so frail.

17.Safi Kaskas: And the angels will be round its edges. On that Day, eight of them will bear your Lord's Throne of His majesty above them.

18.Safi Kaskas: On that Day you will be exposed, and no secret of yours will remain hidden.

19.Safi Kaskas: As for him who is given his record in his right hand, he will say, "Here, take my record and read it,

20.Safi Kaskas: I expected that I would be held accountable."

21.Safi Kaskas: So, he will have a pleasant life

22.Safi Kaskas: in an elevated Garden,

23.Safi Kaskas: its pickings are within easy reach.

24.Safi Kaskas: "Eat and drink merrily for what you have done in days gone by."

25.Safi Kaskas: As for him who is given his record in his left hand, he will say, "I wish I was never given my record

26.Safi Kaskas: and never knew what my account was.

27.Safi Kaskas: If only death had really been the end.

28.Safi Kaskas: My wealth has been of no use to me

29.Safi Kaskas: and my power has vanished."

30.Safi Kaskas: [God will say], "Seize him and shackle him.

31.Safi Kaskas: Then drive him into Hell.

32.Safi Kaskas: Then tie him with a chain whose length is seventy cubits."

33.Safi Kaskas: For he would not believe in God, the Magnificent,

34.Safi Kaskas: nor would he encourage feeding of the poor.

35.Safi Kaskas: So he has no friend here this Day,

36.Safi Kaskas: nor any food except scum,

37.Safi Kaskas: that only sinners eat.

38.Safi Kaskas: So I swear by what you see

39.Safi Kaskas: and what you do not see

40.Safi Kaskas: that this is the word of a noble Messenger.

41.Safi Kaskas: And It is not the word of a poet; how little you believe,

42.Safi Kaskas: nor the word of a soothsayer; how little you remember,

43.Safi Kaskas: The gradual revelations of the Book, is from the Lord of the worlds.

44.Safi Kaskas: Had he [the Messenger] falsely attributed some statements to Us,

45.Safi Kaskas: We would have seized him by the right arm.

46.Safi Kaskas: Then We would have slashed his lifeline,

47.Safi Kaskas: and none of you could have protected him.

48.Safi Kaskas: It [The Qur'an] is a reminder for the those who are mindful of God.

49.Safi Kaskas: And We know that some of you will deny it.

50.Safi Kaskas: It is a cause of great distress to the unbelievers.

51.Safi Kaskas: And it is the Truth of certainty.

52.Safi Kaskas: Exalt, then, the limitless glory of your Lord's magnificent name.

1.Safi Kaskas: An inquirer asked about an impending punishment

2.Safi Kaskas: to the unbelievers that cannot be prevented

3.Safi Kaskas: from God, the Lord of the Gates of Ascent.

4.Safi Kaskas: Unto Him the angels and the Spirit will ascend in a Day whose length is fifty thousand years.

5.Safi Kaskas: So be patient with gracious patience.

6.Safi Kaskas: They [the unbelievers] see it as something distant,

7.Safi Kaskas: but We see it near.

8.Safi Kaskas: On the Day the sky will be like molten brass,

9.Safi Kaskas: and the mountains will be like tufted wool.

10.Safi Kaskas: No good friend will ask about his friend,

11.Safi Kaskas: even though they can see each other. The one who forced others to reject Our messages will wish he could ransom himself from the punishment of that Day, by sacrificing his children

12.Safi Kaskas: and his wife and his brother

13.Safi Kaskas: and his family who shelter him

14.Safi Kaskas: and everyone on earth, if that could save him.

15.Safi Kaskas: Not today!  But a raging blaze

16.Safi Kaskas: that strips away the skin

17.Safi Kaskas: and claims everyone who turned his back to  the truth and went away

18.Safi Kaskas: and accumulated and hoarded [wealth)

19.Safi Kaskas: The Human being was created full of anxiety:

20.Safi Kaskas: desperate when bad things happen,

21.Safi Kaskas: but tight-fisted when good fortune comes his way,

22.Safi Kaskas: The exception are those who pray,

23.Safi Kaskas: those who are steady in their prayer

24.Safi Kaskas: and those who have set aside a known rightful share within their wealth

25.Safi Kaskas: for the poor and the deprived

26.Safi Kaskas: and those who  believe in the Day of Judgment,

27.Safi Kaskas: and those who dread their Lord's punishment.

28.Safi Kaskas: They know not to take their Lord's punishment for granted.

29.Safi Kaskas: Those who guard their chastity,

30.Safi Kaskas: except from their spouses and from those whom their right hands hold in trust, are free of blame.

31.Safi Kaskas: But whoever seeks beyond that, they are transgressors.

32.Safi Kaskas: Those who honor their trusts and pledges

33.Safi Kaskas: and those who stand by their testimonies

34.Safi Kaskas: and those who maintain their prayer with dedication:

35.Safi Kaskas: those will be honored in Gardens.

36.Safi Kaskas: So what is [the matter] with the unbelievers? They run about in front of you in groups, with outstretched necks and staring eyes,

37.Safi Kaskas: from the right, and from the left.

38.Safi Kaskas: Does each one of them aspire to enter the Garden of Delight?

39.Safi Kaskas: Never!  We have created them from that which they well know.

40.Safi Kaskas: So I swear by the Lord of all risings and settings that We are able

41.Safi Kaskas: to replace them with better than they; and nothing can prevent Us from doing this.

42.Safi Kaskas: So leave them to blunder and play around, until they meet their Day which they are promised,

43.Safi Kaskas: The Day when they will emerge from the graves rushing as if rallying to a flag,

44.Safi Kaskas: their eyes humbled, overwhelmed by humiliation. This is the Day which they were promised.

1.Safi Kaskas: We sent Noah to his people, [saying], "Warn your people before a painful punishment comes to them."

2.Safi Kaskas: He said, "My people, I am coming to you with clear warnings,

3.Safi Kaskas: Worship God, be mindful of Him and obey me.

4.Safi Kaskas: God will forgive you of your sins, and reprieve you until an appointed time. When God's appointed time arrives it cannot be postponed, if you only knew.' "

5.Safi Kaskas: He said, "My Lord, I invited my people night and day.

6.Safi Kaskas: but the more I called them, the further they ran away:

7.Safi Kaskas: Every time I called them to Your forgiveness, they put their fingers into their ears, wrapped themselves in their garments, and insisted, and became increasingly more arrogant.

8.Safi Kaskas: I invited them openly.

9.Safi Kaskas: Then I appealed to them publicly, and I spoke to them privately,

10.Safi Kaskas: and said, 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord. He is ever forgiving.

11.Safi Kaskas: He will send down abundant rain from the sky for you

12.Safi Kaskas: and will provide you with wealth and children and He will give you gardens and rivers.

13.Safi Kaskas: What is the matter with you? Why can't you appreciate God's majesty

14.Safi Kaskas: when He has created you stage by stage?

15.Safi Kaskas: Do you not see how God created seven superimposed heavens

16.Safi Kaskas: and placed the moon in them as a enlightenment and He made the sun a source of light?

17.Safi Kaskas: God germinated you from the earth like plants.

18.Safi Kaskas: Then He will return you into it, and will bring you out again.

19.Safi Kaskas: And God has spread the earth out for you

20.Safi Kaskas: that you may travel its valleys as roadways.' "

21.Safi Kaskas: Noah said, "My Lord, they have defied me, and followed those whose wealth and children lead them increasingly into loss.

22.Safi Kaskas: And they schemed outrageously.

23.Safi Kaskas: And said, 'Do not abandon your gods. Never leave Wadd or Suwa' or Yaghuth and Ya'uq and Nasr.

24.Safi Kaskas: They have already misled many. My Lord, increase these transgressors only in misguidance."

25.Safi Kaskas: Because of their sins they were drowned and sent to Hell. They could not find any one to help them against God.

26.Safi Kaskas: And Noah said, "My Lord, do not leave a single unbeliever on the face of the earth.

27.Safi Kaskas: If You leave them, they will mislead Your worshipers and breed only wicked unbelievers.

28.Safi Kaskas: My Lord, forgive me and my parents and whoever enters my house as a believer. Forgive all the believing men and women, but bring nothing but ruin down on the transgressors.

1.Safi Kaskas: Say, "It has been revealed to me that a group of jinn listened in and said, 'We have heard an amazing Recitation.

2.Safi Kaskas: It guides to righteousness, and we have believed it: We will never assign divinity to anyone except our Lord.

3.Safi Kaskas: And exalted be the glory of our Lord! He never had a spouse nor a child.

4.Safi Kaskas: But the fools among us had been saying outrageous things about God

5.Safi Kaskas: although we had thought that no human or jinn would dare tell a lie about God.

6.Safi Kaskas: Some individual humans used to seek power through some individual jinn, but they [the jinn] only increased their confusion.

7.Safi Kaskas: And they thought, as you thought, that God would not send anyone [as a messenger].

8.Safi Kaskas: We as usual probed heaven [in search of news], and found it filled with fierce guards and projectiles.

9.Safi Kaskas: We used to take up certain positions to listen in; but anyone trying to listen now finds a projectile in wait for him.

10.Safi Kaskas: We do not know therefore whether ill is intended for those on earth, or whether their Lord intends to guide them.

11.Safi Kaskas: Some of us are righteous, but others are less so; we follow different paths.

12.Safi Kaskas: And we have come to realize that we can never evade God living on earth, nor can we evade Him by escaping [from life].

13.Safi Kaskas: So when we heard this call to guidance, we believed in it. Whoever believes in his Lord will no longer fear the burden of life or injustice.

14.Safi Kaskas: Some of us submitted to God, while others are transgressors. Those who submitted have sought out right guidance.

15.Safi Kaskas: As for the transgressors, they will be firewood for Hell.

16.Safi Kaskas: Had [your people] kept true to the path, We would have given them abundant drinking water supply,

17.Safi Kaskas: a test for them. Whoever turns away from remembering to call on his Lord will be put into an arduous punishment.

18.Safi Kaskas: Places of worship are for God. So do not call on anyone else besides God.

19.Safi Kaskas: Yet when God's servant stood up calling on Him, they [the unbelievers] overwhelmed him with their crowds."

20.Safi Kaskas: Say, "I only call on my Lord and I never associate anyone with Him."

21.Safi Kaskas: Say, "It is not in my power to harm you, nor to guide you rightly."

22.Safi Kaskas: Say, "No one can protect me from God, and I will never find any refuge except in Him".

23.Safi Kaskas: I only deliver what I receive from God and His messages.He who disobeys God and His Messenger, will have the fire of Hell where they will be forever,

24.Safi Kaskas: until they see that which they were promised and they will know who has less support and are fewer in number.

25.Safi Kaskas: Say, "I do not know whether what you are promised will happen soon or whether it will be delayed by my Lord for a period."

26.Safi Kaskas: He alone knows what is beyond our perception, and He doesn't disclose His knowledge of the unseen to anyone,

27.Safi Kaskas: except to a Messenger of His choosing. He then dispatches guards before him and behind him.

28.Safi Kaskas: That he may know that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord. He encompasses what they have, and has counted everything by number.

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

1.Safi Kaskas: You who wraps himself [in his clothing],

2.Safi Kaskas: stay up during the night, except for a little,

3.Safi Kaskas: for half of it, or a little less,

4.Safi Kaskas: or a little more, and recite the Qur'an slowly and distinctly.

5.Safi Kaskas: We will send a weighty message to you.

6.Safi Kaskas: Rising at night has a stronger effect and is more conducive to concentration.

7.Safi Kaskas: In the daytime, you are kept busy for long periods.

8.Safi Kaskas: So remember to call upon the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him wholeheartedly.

9.Safi Kaskas: The Lord of the East and the West; there is no god but Him. So, assign to Him alone the power to determine your fate.

10.Safi Kaskas: And patiently endure what they say, and withdraw from them politely

11.Safi Kaskas: and leave those who deny the truth and live in luxury to Me. Just bear with them a little longer;

12.Safi Kaskas: We have shackles and Hell

13.Safi Kaskas: And food that chokes and a painful punishment reserved for them

14.Safi Kaskas: on the Day when the earth and the mountains tremble, and the mountains become heaps of sand.

15.Safi Kaskas: We have sent to you a messenger, a witness over you just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.

16.Safi Kaskas: But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a crushing grip.

17.Safi Kaskas: How, then, if you refuse to acknowledge the truth, will you protect yourself from a Day which will turn the children gray-haired?

18.Safi Kaskas: A Day when the heavens will shatter. God's promise is always fulfilled.

19.Safi Kaskas: This is a reminder, so let anyone who wills set a path towards his Lord.

20.Safi Kaskas: Your Lord knows that you stay up praying nearly two-thirds of the night, or half of it, or one-third of it, along with a group of those with you. God justly evaluates the night and the day. He knows that you will not be able to sustain it, so He will not require it of you. Read from the Qur'an what you can. He knows that some of you may be ill; and others travelling through the land, seeking God's bounty; yet others will be fighting in God's cause. So read from it what is easy for you, and observe the prayers, and pay The purifying alms, and lend God a loan of goodness. Whatever good you advance for yourselves, you will find it with God, improved and increased for you. Ask God's forgiveness, for God is Forgiving and Merciful.

74.SurahEnglishNames: The Cloaked One, The Man Wearing a Cloak, The Clothed One

1.Safi Kaskas: You, wrapped in your shroud,

2.Safi Kaskas: arise and give warning,

3.Safi Kaskas: glorify your Lord' greatness,

4.Safi Kaskas: purify your clothing and

5.Safi Kaskas: avoid all filth.

6.Safi Kaskas: Do not give out of a desire for gain.

7.Safi Kaskas: But be steadfast for your Lord's cause.

8.Safi Kaskas: When the Trumpet is blown,

9.Safi Kaskas: that Day will be a difficult day,

10.Safi Kaskas: not easy for the unbelievers.

11.Safi Kaskas: Leave Me alone with the one I created

12.Safi Kaskas: to whom I gave great wealth,

13.Safi Kaskas: sons around him,

14.Safi Kaskas: and for whom I smoothed all things.

15.Safi Kaskas: Then he desires that I should add more.

16.Safi Kaskas: No! He was stubbornly hostile to Our revelation.

17.Safi Kaskas: I will increasingly exhaust him.

18.Safi Kaskas: He reflected and plotted.

19.Safi Kaskas: So, may he perish how he plotted.

20.Safi Kaskas: Then may he perish how he plotted.

21.Safi Kaskas: Then he looked,

22.Safi Kaskas: then he frowned and glared;

23.Safi Kaskas: Then he turned back to his old arrogance

24.Safi Kaskas: and said, "This is nothing but magic handed down from the past.

25.Safi Kaskas: This is not but the word of a human being.

26.Safi Kaskas: I will roast him into Saqar.

27.Safi Kaskas: And how would you know what is Saqar?

28.Safi Kaskas: It neither leaves, nor spares,

29.Safi Kaskas: scorching the flesh.

30.Safi Kaskas: There are nineteen in charge of it.

31.Safi Kaskas: We have appointed only angels to be wardens of the Fire, and caused their number to be a stumbling block for those who disbelieve; so that those given the Book may attain certainty; and those who believe may increase in faith; and those given the Book and the believers may not doubt; and those in whose hearts is sickness and the unbelievers may say, "What did God ever mean by this example?" In this way God lets go astray the one who wishes to go astray, and guides him who wishes to be guided. None knows your Lord's forces but Him. This is nothing but a reminder to all human beings.

32.Safi Kaskas: No! By the moon

33.Safi Kaskas: and the night when it departs

34.Safi Kaskas: and the morning as it brightens,

35.Safi Kaskas: it is one of those great things

36.Safi Kaskas: as a warning to human beings,

37.Safi Kaskas: to whomever among you wishes to advance or regress.

38.Safi Kaskas: Every soul, is held in pledge for its own deeds

39.Safi Kaskas: Except for those on the right,

40.Safi Kaskas: in Gardens, inquiring

41.Safi Kaskas: about those who forced others to reject Our messages,

42.Safi Kaskas: "What caused you to be in Saqar?"

43.Safi Kaskas: They will say, "We were not among those who prayed,

44.Safi Kaskas: nor did we feed the poor.

45.Safi Kaskas: And we used to indulge in vain discussions with those who indulged [in mocking the believers]

46.Safi Kaskas: And we used to deny the Day of Judgment

47.Safi Kaskas: until the Certain End came upon us."

48.Safi Kaskas: The intercession of intercessors will not help them.

49.Safi Kaskas: Why then are they turning away from this reminder

50.Safi Kaskas: as if they were panicked donkeys

51.Safi Kaskas: fleeing from a lion?

52.Safi Kaskas: Yet, every one of them wishes to be given scriptures unrolled before their very eyes.

53.Safi Kaskas: No! But they do not fear the Hereafter.

54.Safi Kaskas: No! This is but a reminder

55.Safi Kaskas: and whoever wills may take it to heart.

56.Safi Kaskas: But they will not remember, unless God so wills. He is the Source of all righteousness, and the source of all forgiveness.

75.SurahEnglishNames: The Rising of the Dead, Resurrection
