1.Safi Kaskas: I swear by the Day of Resurrection

2.Safi Kaskas: And I swear by the self-reproaching soul.

3.Safi Kaskas: Does the human being think that We will not reassemble his bones?

4.Safi Kaskas: Yes indeed. We are able even to reshape his fingertips.

5.Safi Kaskas: Yet the human being wants to deny what lies ahead of him.

6.Safi Kaskas: He asks, "When is this Day of Resurrection?"

7.Safi Kaskas: When vision is dazzled,

8.Safi Kaskas: the moon is eclipsed

9.Safi Kaskas: and the sun and the moon are joined together,

10.Safi Kaskas: on that Day, man will say, "Where is the escape?"

11.Safi Kaskas: No indeed! There is no refuge.

12.Safi Kaskas: Your Lord is the final destination on that Day.

13.Safi Kaskas: On that Day the Human being will be informed of all deeds he put forward for this day and everything that should have been left behind.

14.Safi Kaskas: Rather, the human being, will give evidence against himself,

15.Safi Kaskas: in spite of any excuses he presents.

16.Safi Kaskas: [Prophet], do not move your tongue attempting to rush your memorization of the Revelation.

17.Safi Kaskas: Its collection and recitation are up to us.

18.Safi Kaskas: So, when We recite it, follow its recitation,

19.Safi Kaskas: it is then, up to Us, to make it all clear

20.Safi Kaskas: But you love this brief life

21.Safi Kaskas: and disregard the Hereafter.

22.Safi Kaskas: There are faces on that Day that will be bright,

23.Safi Kaskas: looking toward their Lord.

24.Safi Kaskas: While other faces on that Day, will be gloomy with despair,

25.Safi Kaskas: realizing that a backbreaking blow has befallen them.

26.Safi Kaskas: But when the last breath has reached the throat

27.Safi Kaskas: and It is said, "Who will heal him now?"

28.Safi Kaskas: And he realizes that it is parting time,

29.Safi Kaskas: when one leg is entwined with the other,

30.Safi Kaskas: that Day the journey is to your Lord.

31.Safi Kaskas: He neither believed, nor prayed,

32.Safi Kaskas: but he denied and turned away.

33.Safi Kaskas: Then he went to his people, full of himself and false pride.

34.Safi Kaskas: Your demise is getting closer to you and closer,

35.Safi Kaskas: yet closer and closer still.

36.Safi Kaskas: Does the human being think that he [was created] to be forgotten?

37.Safi Kaskas: Was he not the sperm of ejaculated semen that fertilized the ovum?

38.Safi Kaskas: Then he became a clot. And [God] created and proportioned,

39.Safi Kaskas: and made of him the two sexes, the male and the female.

40.Safi Kaskas: Is not that [Creator] able to bring the dead to life?

1.Safi Kaskas: Has there come upon the human being a span of time when he was nothing to be mentioned?

2.Safi Kaskas: We created the human being from a fertilized ovum to test him;  and We gave him hearing and sight.

3.Safi Kaskas: Then We guided him to the right path, whether he is grateful or not.

4.Safi Kaskas: We have prepared chains, shackles and a Searing Fire for the unbelievers.

5.Safi Kaskas: But the righteous will drink from a cup whose mixture is Kafour,

6.Safi Kaskas: a spring from which God's worshipers shall drink, making it gush abundantly at will.

7.Safi Kaskas: They are the ones who fulfill their vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.

8.Safi Kaskas: They feed the needy, the orphan, and the prisoner, for the love of Him.

9.Safi Kaskas: [Saying], "We feed you for the sake of God. We want neither compensation, nor gratitude from you.

10.Safi Kaskas: We simply dread an austere and stressful Day promised by our Lord."

11.Safi Kaskas: So God will spare them the evil of that Day and will give them radiance and joy,

12.Safi Kaskas: and will reward them for what they patiently endured with a Garden and silk,

13.Safi Kaskas: reclining there on couches. They will not experience there either burning sun or bitter cold.

14.Safi Kaskas: Shades cover them, and its fruit hanging close ready to be picked.

15.Safi Kaskas: Circulated among them are vessels of silver, and cups of pure crystal

16.Safi Kaskas: clear glasses made from silver according to their own measure.

17.Safi Kaskas: They will be given a drink mixed with ginger

18.Safi Kaskas: from a spring there named Salsabeel.

19.Safi Kaskas: Passing among them are immortal youths. If you see them, you would think they were like sprinkled pearls.

20.Safi Kaskas: If you were to look around, you would see a heavenly and vast kingdom.

21.Safi Kaskas: They will wear green garments of fine silk and brocade.  And they will be adorned with silver bracelets. Their Lord will give them a purified drink.

22.Safi Kaskas: "This is a reward for you. Your efforts are well appreciated."

23.Safi Kaskas: It is We who have sent down the Qur'an to you in gradual revelations.

24.Safi Kaskas: So await your Lord's Judgment with patience; and do not obey a sinner or a denier of the truth from among them.

25.Safi Kaskas: Remember to call on the name of your Lord morning and evening

26.Safi Kaskas: And during the night bow down to Him and exalt His limitless glory long into the night.

27.Safi Kaskas: These people love the present life, and leave behind a Heavy Day.

28.Safi Kaskas: We have created them, and strengthened their frame; and if we wish, We can replace them with others like them.

29.Safi Kaskas: This is a reminder. Let whoever wills, take a path to his Lord.

30.Safi Kaskas: Yet you cannot will, unless God wills.  God is Knowing and Wise.

31.Safi Kaskas: He admits whom He wills into His mercy. But He has prepared a painful punishment for the unjust.

1.Safi Kaskas: By those [winds] sent forth in gusts

2.Safi Kaskas: and those violently storming,

3.Safi Kaskas: consider these [messages] that spread [the Truth] far and wide,

4.Safi Kaskas: thus separating [right and wrong] with all clarity,

5.Safi Kaskas: and then delivering a reminder,

6.Safi Kaskas: [promising] freedom from blame or [offering] a warning,

7.Safi Kaskas: what you are promised will surely happen.

8.Safi Kaskas: So when the stars are extinguished,

9.Safi Kaskas: the heaven is split open,

10.Safi Kaskas: the mountains are blown away,

11.Safi Kaskas: And when the messengers are called together to an appointed time,

12.Safi Kaskas: for what Day was it postponed?

13.Safi Kaskas: For the Day of Decision.

14.Safi Kaskas: And what do you know about the Day of Decision?

15.Safi Kaskas: How horrible is that Day for those who deny the truth.

16.Safi Kaskas: Did We not destroy the earlier people?

17.Safi Kaskas: And We shall make the latter follow them.

18.Safi Kaskas: This is how We deal with those who forced others to reject Our messages

19.Safi Kaskas: How horrible is that Day for those who reject the truth.

20.Safi Kaskas: Did We not create you from an  insignificant liquid?

21.Safi Kaskas: Then lodged it in a secure place,

22.Safi Kaskas: for a known term?

23.Safi Kaskas: And We determined it, how excellently We determine.

24.Safi Kaskas: How terrible is that Day for the deniers of the truth.

25.Safi Kaskas: Have We not made the earth a home

26.Safi Kaskas: for the living and the dead?

27.Safi Kaskas: And We placed firmly embedded mountains in it, rising high, and given you sweet water to drink.

28.Safi Kaskas: How terrible is that Day for the deniers of the truth.

29.Safi Kaskas: "Proceed to what you used to deny.

30.Safi Kaskas: "Proceed to a shadow with three columns,

31.Safi Kaskas: that has no shade and will not prevent you from the flame."

32.Safi Kaskas: It shoots sparks [as huge] as a fortress,

33.Safi Kaskas: like giant fiery ropes.

34.Safi Kaskas: How terrible is that Day for those who deny the truth.

35.Safi Kaskas: On that Day they will be speechless,

36.Safi Kaskas: and they not be given permission to offer any excuses.

37.Safi Kaskas: How terrible is that Day for those who deny the truth.

38.Safi Kaskas: This is the Day of Decision; We will have gathered you together with the earlier people.

39.Safi Kaskas: So if you have a ploy, then use it against my plan now.

40.Safi Kaskas: How terrible is that Day for those who deny the truth.

41.Safi Kaskas: The God-conscious will be amidst shades and springs,

42.Safi Kaskas: and any fruits they desire,

43.Safi Kaskas: "Eat and drink and enjoy it as a reward for your deeds."

44.Safi Kaskas: This is how We reward those who do good.

45.Safi Kaskas: How terrible is that Day for those who deny the truth.

46.Safi Kaskas: You are but dissenters. So eat and enjoy yourselves a little [while you can].

47.Safi Kaskas: How terrible is that Day for the deniers of the truth.

48.Safi Kaskas: And when It is said to them, "Bow down [in prayer]," they do not bow.

49.Safi Kaskas: How terrible is that Day for those who denied the truth.

50.Safi Kaskas: In what message beyond this will they believe?

1.Safi Kaskas: What are they wondering about?

2.Safi Kaskas: About the huge announcement

3.Safi Kaskas: over which they are in disagreement.

4.Safi Kaskas: They will know.

5.Safi Kaskas: For sure they will know.

6.Safi Kaskas: Have We not made the earth a cradle?

7.Safi Kaskas: And the mountains as pegs?

8.Safi Kaskas: And We created you in pairs?

9.Safi Kaskas: And made your sleep to rest?

10.Safi Kaskas: And made the night a cover?

11.Safi Kaskas: And made the day for livelihood?

12.Safi Kaskas: And constructed above you seven strong [heavens]?

13.Safi Kaskas: And made [the sun] a glowing lamp?

14.Safi Kaskas: And sent down from the clouds pouring water

15.Safi Kaskas: to produce with it grain, vegetation

16.Safi Kaskas: and luxuriant gardens?

17.Safi Kaskas: The Day of Decision has been appointed.

18.Safi Kaskas: The Day the Horn is blown and you will come forth in droves.

19.Safi Kaskas: And the heavens are opened and becomes gateways.

20.Safi Kaskas: And the mountains are set in motion and will become a mirage.

21.Safi Kaskas: Hell has been lying in wait,

22.Safi Kaskas: to be a home for the oppressors,

23.Safi Kaskas: to stay in for a long, long time,

24.Safi Kaskas: They will not taste any coolness there or drink,

25.Safi Kaskas: except for boiling water and sizzling pus.

26.Safi Kaskas: An appropriate reward.

27.Safi Kaskas: They were not expecting to be held accountable.

28.Safi Kaskas: And utterly rejected Our verses.

29.Safi Kaskas: We have recorded everything in writing.

30.Safi Kaskas: "So feel it, We will only increase your punishment."

31.Safi Kaskas: For those who were mindful of God there is a great achievement,

32.Safi Kaskas: gardens and grapevines,

33.Safi Kaskas: splendid, well matched spouses,

34.Safi Kaskas: and a full cup.

35.Safi Kaskas: There, they will hear no gossip or lies.

36.Safi Kaskas: A reward from your Lord, a fitting gift,

37.Safi Kaskas: The Lord of the heavens and the earth and everything between them, the Merciful-to-all.They will have no authority from Him to speak.

38.Safi Kaskas: On the Day when the Spirit and the angels will stand in rows. They will not speak except for those to whom the Merciful gives permission, and he will say what is right.

39.Safi Kaskas: That is the True Day; so whoever wills, may take now a way back to his Lord.

40.Safi Kaskas: We have warned you of an eminent punishment on the Day when a person will see what he has done, and the unbeliever will say, "I wish that I were dust!"

79.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Drag Forth, Soul-snatchers, Those Who Pulled Out

1.Safi Kaskas: By those [stars] who rise only to sit.

2.Safi Kaskas: And move [in their orbits] steadily.

3.Safi Kaskas: And float [through space] smoothly.

4.Safi Kaskas: And yet some overtake [others] swiftly.

5.Safi Kaskas: Thus they fulfill the [Creator's] purpose.

6.Safi Kaskas: On the Day when the world will shudder.

7.Safi Kaskas: Followed by a tremor.

8.Safi Kaskas: Hearts, that Day, will shiver,

9.Safi Kaskas: and eyes are humbled.

10.Safi Kaskas: They say, "Are we to be restored to the original condition"?

11.Safi Kaskas: After we have turned into decayed bones?

12.Safi Kaskas: They say, "This will be a losing come back."

13.Safi Kaskas: But all it will take is a single blast,

14.Safi Kaskas: and they will be awake and above ground.

15.Safi Kaskas: Has there the story of Moses reached you?

16.Safi Kaskas: When his Lord called out to him in the sacred valley of Tuwa,

17.Safi Kaskas: "Go to Pharaoh. For he has transgressed,

18.Safi Kaskas: and ask him, "Would you be willing to purify yourself?

19.Safi Kaskas: And I will guide you to your Lord so you would be in awe of Him.

20.Safi Kaskas: And he showed him the greatest sign,

21.Safi Kaskas: but Pharaoh rejected the offer and disobeyed.

22.Safi Kaskas: Then he hastily turned away,

23.Safi Kaskas: and gathered [his people] and proclaimed,

24.Safi Kaskas: "I am your lord, the most high."

25.Safi Kaskas: So God seized him with punishment, as an example, in the life to come as well as in this life:

26.Safi Kaskas: In this, there is a warning for whomever would fear [God].

27.Safi Kaskas: Are you more difficult to create or is the heaven that He built?

28.Safi Kaskas: He raised it high and proportioned it.

29.Safi Kaskas: He darkened its night and brought out its morning light.

30.Safi Kaskas: After that He spread out the earth.

31.Safi Kaskas: From it, He produced its water and its pasture,

32.Safi Kaskas: And He set the mountains firmly in place

33.Safi Kaskas: for you and for your animals to enjoy.

34.Safi Kaskas: But when the Great Calamity arrives,

35.Safi Kaskas: a Day when the human being will remember what he has done,

36.Safi Kaskas: and Hell will be there for all to see,

37.Safi Kaskas: for him  who transgressed

38.Safi Kaskas: and preferred the life of this world,

39.Safi Kaskas: Hell will be his home.

40.Safi Kaskas: But as for him who feared to stand one day in front of  his Lord and therefore restrained himself from following his whims and desires,

41.Safi Kaskas: then Heaven will be home.

42.Safi Kaskas: They ask you about the Hour, "When will it take place?"

43.Safi Kaskas: How can you possibly know that?

44.Safi Kaskas: Its time is only known to your Lord.

45.Safi Kaskas: You are only to warn those who dread it.

46.Safi Kaskas: On the Day they see it, it will seem as though they only stayed an evening or a morning.

1.Safi Kaskas: He frowned and turned away

2.Safi Kaskas: when the blind man approached him.

3.Safi Kaskas: For all you know, he might be seeking to purify himself?

4.Safi Kaskas: or to be reminded and be helped by being reminded?

5.Safi Kaskas: As for him who was indifferent,

6.Safi Kaskas: you [Prophet] gave him your attention.

7.Safi Kaskas: Though it is not up to you whether or not he is purified.

8.Safi Kaskas: As for him who came to you eagerly

9.Safi Kaskas: with God's fear in his heart

10.Safi Kaskas: from him you are distracted.

11.Safi Kaskas: Indeed this is a reminder;

12.Safi Kaskas: So, whoever wills may remember it.

13.Safi Kaskas: it is [written] on honored sheets,

14.Safi Kaskas: Exalted and purified,

15.Safi Kaskas: by the hands of scribes,

16.Safi Kaskas: honorable and virtuous.

17.Safi Kaskas: How regretful it is for people to have so much self-destructive ingratitude.

18.Safi Kaskas: From what did He create him?

19.Safi Kaskas: From a fertilized ovum He created him and proportioned him;

20.Safi Kaskas: Then He eased the way for him;

21.Safi Kaskas: Then He causes him to die and to be buried.

22.Safi Kaskas: Then when He wills, He will resurrect him.

23.Safi Kaskas: No! He did not fulfill what He has commanded him.

24.Safi Kaskas: A human being has only to consider the food he eats.

25.Safi Kaskas: We poured down water in abundance,

26.Safi Kaskas: and caused the soil to break open,

27.Safi Kaskas: and grew grains in it,

28.Safi Kaskas: and grapes and legumes

29.Safi Kaskas: olive and dates,

30.Safi Kaskas: and luxurious gardens

31.Safi Kaskas: and fruits and vegetable,

32.Safi Kaskas: for you and your livestock to enjoy.

33.Safi Kaskas: But when the Deafening Blast comes,

34.Safi Kaskas: on the Day when a human being will flee from his brother,

35.Safi Kaskas: his mother, his father,

36.Safi Kaskas: his wife and his children ,

37.Safi Kaskas: every one of them, on that Day, will have enough to preoccupy him.

38.Safi Kaskas: Faces on that Day will be beaming,

39.Safi Kaskas: laughing and rejoicing.

40.Safi Kaskas: And [other] faces, on that Day, will be covered with dust,

41.Safi Kaskas: overwhelmed by sorrow.

42.Safi Kaskas: These are the unbelievers, the wicked ones.

1.Safi Kaskas: When the sun folds

2.Safi Kaskas: and the stars are dispersed,

3.Safi Kaskas: when the mountains are shifting

4.Safi Kaskas: and when full-term she-camels are neglected.

5.Safi Kaskas: When the wild beasts are gathered,

6.Safi Kaskas: when the seas are set aflame,

7.Safi Kaskas: when the souls are paired,

8.Safi Kaskas: when the female baby who was buried alive is asked

9.Safi Kaskas: for what sin she was killed?

10.Safi Kaskas: When the records are made public,

11.Safi Kaskas: when the sky is stripped away

12.Safi Kaskas: when Hell is set ablaze

13.Safi Kaskas: when Paradise is brought into view,

14.Safi Kaskas: every soul will then know what it has brought with it.

15.Safi Kaskas: I swear by the planets,

16.Safi Kaskas: the runners and sweepers,

17.Safi Kaskas: and by the night as it recedes

18.Safi Kaskas: and the dawn when it breathes,

19.Safi Kaskas: this revelation is indeed the word of a honorable Messenger,

20.Safi Kaskas: endowed with strength, secure with the Lord of the Throne,

21.Safi Kaskas: obeyed and trustworthy.

22.Safi Kaskas: This fellow of yours is not mad,

23.Safi Kaskas: he has already seen him [Gabriel] in the clear horizon.

24.Safi Kaskas: He does not withhold what is revealed to him from beyond.

25.Safi Kaskas: And it (the Qur'an) is not the word of a devil, expelled from Heaven.

26.Safi Kaskas: So where, then, will you go?

27.Safi Kaskas: It is only a reminder to all humankind

28.Safi Kaskas: for whoever wills among you to go straight.

29.Safi Kaskas: But you cannot will, unless God, the Lord of the worlds, so wills.

82.SurahEnglishNames: The Cleaving, The Cleaving Asunder, Bursting Apart

1.Safi Kaskas: When the heavens are torn apart,

2.Safi Kaskas: when the planets are sprinkled,

3.Safi Kaskas: when the oceans are exploded,

4.Safi Kaskas: when the graves are scattered,

5.Safi Kaskas: each soul will then know what it has sent on ahead and what it has left behind.

6.Safi Kaskas: People, what has lured you away from your Lord, the Most Generous,

7.Safi Kaskas: He Who created you, formed you, and proportioned you?

8.Safi Kaskas: In whatever shape He willed, He assembled you.

9.Safi Kaskas: Yet you still deny the Judgment.

10.Safi Kaskas: When guardians are standing over you,

11.Safi Kaskas: honorable recorders;

12.Safi Kaskas: They know everything you do.

13.Safi Kaskas: Indeed, the truly good will be in bliss,

14.Safi Kaskas: while the wicked will be in Hell.

15.Safi Kaskas: They will roast in it on the Day of Judgment,

16.Safi Kaskas: and will never get away from it.

17.Safi Kaskas: And how would you know what is the Day of Judgment?

18.Safi Kaskas: Truly, how would you know what is the Day of Judgment?

19.Safi Kaskas: It is the Day when no soul will be able to do anything for another soul; and the decision on that Day is God's alone.

83.SurahEnglishNames: Defrauding, The Defrauders, The Cheats, Cheating

1.Safi Kaskas: How terrible it is to those who give short measures,

2.Safi Kaskas: who, when they take a measure from people, take in full.

3.Safi Kaskas: But when they measure or weigh for others, they cheat.

4.Safi Kaskas: Don't such people realize that they will be resurrected

5.Safi Kaskas: for a grievous Day,

6.Safi Kaskas: the Day when Humankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds?

7.Safi Kaskas: Indeed, the record of the wicked is in Sijjeen.

8.Safi Kaskas: And how would you know what Sijjeen is?

9.Safi Kaskas: It is a locked-in digital data record.

10.Safi Kaskas: How terrible it is that Day for the deniers,

11.Safi Kaskas: who deny the Day of Judgment,

12.Safi Kaskas: when only sinful aggressors deny it.

13.Safi Kaskas: When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of ancient people."

14.Safi Kaskas: Not at all! Rather, their hearts have become encrusted by what they were earning.

15.Safi Kaskas: They will be separated from their Lord, that Day.

16.Safi Kaskas: Then, they will be rekindling Hell.

17.Safi Kaskas: They will be then told, "This is what you used to deny."

18.Safi Kaskas: No indeed! The righteous' record is in 'Illiyyun.

19.Safi Kaskas: And how would you know what is Illiyyun?

20.Safi Kaskas: It is a digital data record,

21.Safi Kaskas: open to be witnessed by those brought near [to God].

22.Safi Kaskas: Indeed, the righteous will be in perfect bliss

23.Safi Kaskas: seated on couches, looking around.

24.Safi Kaskas: You will recognize the radiance of bliss on their faces.

25.Safi Kaskas: They will be given pure virgin nectar to drink

26.Safi Kaskas: leaving a great taste in the mouth. Let people with aspirations, aspire to that.

27.Safi Kaskas: It is mixed with the water from Tasneem,

28.Safi Kaskas: a spring from which those near [to God] drink.

29.Safi Kaskas: Those who rejected the faith and severed their relation with God used to laugh at those who believed.

30.Safi Kaskas: They would wink at one another when the believers passed by them,

31.Safi Kaskas: joking about them when they returned to their people.

32.Safi Kaskas: And if they saw them, they would say, "Indeed, those are truly lost."

33.Safi Kaskas: Yet, they were not sent as guardians over them.

34.Safi Kaskas: So today those who believed will laugh at the unbelievers,

35.Safi Kaskas: while seated on luxurious furnishings, looking around.

36.Safi Kaskas: Have the unbelievers been rewarded for their deeds?

1.Safi Kaskas: When the sky is ruptured,

2.Safi Kaskas: obeying its Lord, as it is bound to do.

3.Safi Kaskas: When the earth is leveled out

4.Safi Kaskas: and has cast out what is in it, and becomes empty,

5.Safi Kaskas: obeying its Lord as it is bound to do,

6.Safi Kaskas: O human being, you are laboring  toward your Lord and you will meet Him.

7.Safi Kaskas: Then, as for him who is given his record in his right hand,

8.Safi Kaskas: he will have an easy settlement,

9.Safi Kaskas: and will return to his family delighted.

10.Safi Kaskas: But, as for him who is given his record behind his back,

11.Safi Kaskas: he will cry out for destruction,

12.Safi Kaskas: and will rekindle the Blaze.

13.Safi Kaskas: He used to be happy among his family.

14.Safi Kaskas: He thought he would never return [to His Lord].

15.Safi Kaskas: Yes he will! His Lord was always watching him.

16.Safi Kaskas: So I swear by the twilight glow,

17.Safi Kaskas: and the night and all it gathers,

18.Safi Kaskas: and the moon when it is full,

19.Safi Kaskas: you will move onward from stage to stage.

20.Safi Kaskas: So what is the matter with them that they do not believe,

21.Safi Kaskas: and when the Qur'an is recited to them, they do not bow down [to God]?

22.Safi Kaskas: But the unbelievers say it is lies,

23.Safi Kaskas: but God knows best what they comprehend.

24.Safi Kaskas: So give them the news of a painful punishment,

25.Safi Kaskas: except for those who believe and do good deeds. They will have a never ending reward.

85.SurahEnglishNames: The Mansions of the Stars, The Constellations

1.Safi Kaskas: By the heavens full of great constellations,

2.Safi Kaskas: by the promised Day,

3.Safi Kaskas: and by the witness and the witnessed,

4.Safi Kaskas: how terrible were the people of the trench

5.Safi Kaskas: [using] fire supplied with fuel,

6.Safi Kaskas: while they sat around it,

7.Safi Kaskas: to watch what they were doing to the believers.

8.Safi Kaskas: The only reason they punish them was because they believed in God, the Almighty, the Praiseworthy,

9.Safi Kaskas: to whom belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth. God, is Witness over all things.

10.Safi Kaskas: Those who persecute believing men and women, and have not repented afterwards, will have the punishment of Hell, and they will have the punishment of Burning.

11.Safi Kaskas: Indeed, those who believe and do good deeds will have Gardens with rivers flowing through them. That is the great victory.

12.Safi Kaskas: Your Lord's punishment is truly severe.

13.Safi Kaskas: It is He who begins [Creation] and repeats it.

14.Safi Kaskas: He alone is Truly-Forgiving, All-Embracing in His love.

15.Safi Kaskas: The Glorious Lord of the Throne,

16.Safi Kaskas: Doer of whatever He wills.

17.Safi Kaskas: Has the story of the legions reached you,

18.Safi Kaskas: [those of] Pharaoh and Thamud?

19.Safi Kaskas: Yet those who denied the truth are persistent in denial,

20.Safi Kaskas: while God will encircle them from behind.

21.Safi Kaskas: This is indeed a Glorious Qur'an

22.Safi Kaskas: in a Preserved Tablet.

1.Safi Kaskas: By the sky and the knocking star,

2.Safi Kaskas: what do you know about the knocking star?

3.Safi Kaskas: It is the piercing Star,

4.Safi Kaskas: there is no soul without a protector over it.

5.Safi Kaskas: So let the human being consider what he was created from.

6.Safi Kaskas: He was created from ejected fluid,

7.Safi Kaskas: emerging from the vicinity of the backbone and the ribs.

8.Safi Kaskas: Indeed, God is able to bring him [the human being] back to life.

9.Safi Kaskas: On a Day when secrets are disclosed,

10.Safi Kaskas: a human being will have no power or anyone to help him.

11.Safi Kaskas: By the sky and its cyclical system

12.Safi Kaskas: and the earth which cracks open,

13.Safi Kaskas: indeed, this is a decisive statement,

14.Safi Kaskas: not to be taken lightly.

15.Safi Kaskas: They plot and scheme,

16.Safi Kaskas: but I am planning too.

17.Safi Kaskas: So bear with the unbelievers. Let them be for a while.

87.SurahEnglishNames: The Most High, Glory to your Lord in the Highest

1.Safi Kaskas: Praise the limitless glory of your Lord's name, the Most High,

2.Safi Kaskas: Who created and proportioned,

3.Safi Kaskas: Who destined and [then] guided.

4.Safi Kaskas: He who brought out the green pasture

5.Safi Kaskas: and then made it black stubble.

6.Safi Kaskas: We will make you recite, and you will not forget,

7.Safi Kaskas: except what God wills. He knows what is open to one's perception and what is hidden.

8.Safi Kaskas: And We will ease you toward the easy way.

9.Safi Kaskas: So, remind, if reminding helps.

10.Safi Kaskas: He who fears God will remember.

11.Safi Kaskas: But the most wicked will ignore it.

12.Safi Kaskas: He will kindle the greatest fire,

13.Safi Kaskas: where he will remain, neither dying nor living.

14.Safi Kaskas: Successful is he who purifies himself,

15.Safi Kaskas: and remembers to call on his Lord and pray.

16.Safi Kaskas: But you prefer this worldly life,

17.Safi Kaskas: whereas the Hereafter is better and more enduring.

18.Safi Kaskas: All this is can be found in the earlier Scriptures,

19.Safi Kaskas: the Scriptures of Abraham and Moses.

88.SurahEnglishNames: The Overwhelming, The Overwhelming Calamity, The Pall

1.Safi Kaskas: Have you heard about the Overwhelming Event?

2.Safi Kaskas: Some faces, that Day, will be humbled,

3.Safi Kaskas: working hard and exhausted.

4.Safi Kaskas: They will kindle an intensely hot Fire

5.Safi Kaskas: and will be given drinks from a boiling spring.

6.Safi Kaskas: They will have no food except from a thorny plant,

7.Safi Kaskas: that neither nourishes nor satisfies hunger.

8.Safi Kaskas: Other faces, that day, will be peaceful.

9.Safi Kaskas: Well pleased with their endeavor,

10.Safi Kaskas: in an elevated Garden,

11.Safi Kaskas: where they will hear no idle talk.

12.Safi Kaskas: A flowing spring runs through it.

13.Safi Kaskas: Raised couches are placed there,

14.Safi Kaskas: cups put in place

15.Safi Kaskas: cushions lined up

16.Safi Kaskas: and carpets spread around.

17.Safi Kaskas: Don't they look at how the camels are created,

18.Safi Kaskas: at how the sky is raised

19.Safi Kaskas: at how the mountains are erected

20.Safi Kaskas: and at how the earth is spread out?

21.Safi Kaskas: So remind them, for you are but a reminder.

22.Safi Kaskas: You are not in control of them.

23.Safi Kaskas: But whoever turns away and rejects the truth,

24.Safi Kaskas: God will inflict him with the greatest punishment.

25.Safi Kaskas: To Us is their return.

26.Safi Kaskas: Then it is for Us to call them to account.

1.Safi Kaskas: By the daybreak

2.Safi Kaskas: and by ten nights

3.Safi Kaskas: by the even and the odd

4.Safi Kaskas: and by the night as it recedes,

5.Safi Kaskas: is there not in [all] that an oath for a rational person?

6.Safi Kaskas: Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with Aad,

7.Safi Kaskas: with Iram of the pillars,

8.Safi Kaskas: whose like was never created in any land,

9.Safi Kaskas: with Thamud, those who carved the rocks in the valley

10.Safi Kaskas: And with Pharaoh, of the stakes?

11.Safi Kaskas: All of them committed excesses in the lands,

12.Safi Kaskas: and spread much corruption there.

13.Safi Kaskas: So your Lord poured on them a scourge of punishment.

14.Safi Kaskas: Your Lord is always watchful.

15.Safi Kaskas: As for human being, whenever his Lord tests him, by honoring him, and blessing him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."

16.Safi Kaskas: But when He tries him, and restricts his provision for him, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me."

17.Safi Kaskas: Not at all! It is you who are not generous with the orphans,

18.Safi Kaskas: and you do not urge one another to feed the needy

19.Safi Kaskas: you who devour the inheritance [of others] with obvious greed

20.Safi Kaskas: and you who passionately love wealth.

21.Safi Kaskas: No indeed! When the earth is crushed, pounded and crushed

22.Safi Kaskas: and your Lord comes with the angels, row after row,

23.Safi Kaskas: on that Day, Hell will be brought near. On that Day, the human being will remember, but what good will that be to him then?

24.Safi Kaskas: He will say, "I wish I had provided for this life to come."

25.Safi Kaskas: On that Day, none will punish as He punishes.

26.Safi Kaskas: And none will shackle as severely as He shackles.

27.Safi Kaskas: [To the righteous it will be said], "Tranquil soul,

28.Safi Kaskas: Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],

29.Safi Kaskas: go in among My worshipers,

30.Safi Kaskas: and into My Garden."

1.Safi Kaskas: I swear by this town,

2.Safi Kaskas: and you [Prophet] are free to dwell in this town,

3.Safi Kaskas: And [I swear by] a father and his offspring,

4.Safi Kaskas: We have created human being for a life of hardship.

5.Safi Kaskas: Does he thinks that no one will have power over him?

6.Safi Kaskas: "I have wasted much money," he says,

7.Safi Kaskas: Does he think that no one sees him?

8.Safi Kaskas: Have We not given him two eyes?

9.Safi Kaskas: And a tongue and two lips

10.Safi Kaskas: and have shown him the two ways [of good and evil]?

11.Safi Kaskas: But he did not take the difficult path.

12.Safi Kaskas: And how would you know what is the difficult path?

13.Safi Kaskas: It is to free a slave,

14.Safi Kaskas: or to feed on a day of hunger

15.Safi Kaskas: an orphaned relative

16.Safi Kaskas: or a needy person in distress.

17.Safi Kaskas: Then to become one of those who believe and urge one another to endure and to urge each other to be compassionate.

18.Safi Kaskas: Those are the people of righteousness.

19.Safi Kaskas: But those who defy Our revelations are the people of despair.

20.Safi Kaskas: With the fire closing in above them.

1.Safi Kaskas: By the sun and its morning light,

2.Safi Kaskas: and the moon as it follows it,

3.Safi Kaskas: and the day when it reveals it,

4.Safi Kaskas: and the night when it conceals it,

5.Safi Kaskas: and the sky and He who built it,

6.Safi Kaskas: and the earth and He who spread it,

7.Safi Kaskas: and by the soul and He who proportioned it,

8.Safi Kaskas: and inspired it [with knowledge to distinguish] its wickedness and its righteousness.

9.Safi Kaskas: Successful is he who purifies it,

10.Safi Kaskas: and failing is he who corrupts it.

11.Safi Kaskas: In their overwhelming arrogance, the people of Thamud called the Messenger a liar,

12.Safi Kaskas: and allowed their most wicked to lead them.

13.Safi Kaskas: The Messenger of God said to them, "This is the she-camel of God, so let her drink."

14.Safi Kaskas: But they called him a liar, and hamstrung her. So their Lord destroyed them for their crime, and leveled it.

15.Safi Kaskas: He doesn't fear the consequence.

1.Safi Kaskas: By the night as it conceals,

2.Safi Kaskas: and the day when it reveals,

3.Safi Kaskas: and He who created the male and the female,

4.Safi Kaskas: your striving is indeed diverse.

5.Safi Kaskas: As for he who gives and is mindful of God,

6.Safi Kaskas: and believes in goodness,

7.Safi Kaskas: We will smooth his way toward all that is easy.

8.Safi Kaskas: But as for he who is stingy and considers himself self-sufficient,

9.Safi Kaskas: and denies goodness,

10.Safi Kaskas: We will ease him toward hardship.

11.Safi Kaskas: His wealth will not help him the least when he falls.

12.Safi Kaskas: Indeed, it is upon Us to guide you.

13.Safi Kaskas: And indeed, to Us belong the last life and this first life

14.Safi Kaskas: so, I have warned you of a Blazing Fire.

15.Safi Kaskas: None will burn in it except the most wicked

16.Safi Kaskas: who had rejected and turned away.

17.Safi Kaskas: But the one who was most mindful of God will be spared,

18.Safi Kaskas: who gives his wealth away to purify himself,

19.Safi Kaskas: not as payment for received favors,

20.Safi Kaskas: but only seeking the pleasure of his Lord, the Most High.

21.Safi Kaskas: He will be well pleased.

93.SurahEnglishNames: The Morning Hours, The Early Hours, Morning Bright

1.Safi Kaskas: By the morning light

2.Safi Kaskas: and the night as it settles,

3.Safi Kaskas: your Lord did not abandon you, nor is He displeased.

4.Safi Kaskas: The life to come is better for you than this first life.

5.Safi Kaskas: And your Lord is sure to give you [so much], and you will be satisfied.

6.Safi Kaskas: Did He not find you orphaned, and shelter you?

7.Safi Kaskas: Did He not find you lost and guide you?

8.Safi Kaskas: Did He not find you impoverished and enrich you?

9.Safi Kaskas: So do not mistreat the orphan,

10.Safi Kaskas: and do not snub the one who asks for help.

11.Safi Kaskas: Instead proclaim the blessings of your Lord.

1.Safi Kaskas: Did We not relieve the tightness in your chest

2.Safi Kaskas: and lift your burden,

3.Safi Kaskas: that weighed heavily on your back

4.Safi Kaskas: and raised high your reputation?

5.Safi Kaskas: For truly, with hardship comes ease.

6.Safi Kaskas: Indeed, with hardship comes ease.

7.Safi Kaskas: So, when you are done, get ready for serious devotion,

8.Safi Kaskas: and focus all your attention on your Lord.

1.Safi Kaskas: By the fig and the olive

2.Safi Kaskas: and [by] Mount Sinai

3.Safi Kaskas: and [by] this secure city [Mecca],

4.Safi Kaskas: We have certainly created the human being in the best of stature;

5.Safi Kaskas: Then We return him to the lowest of the low,

6.Safi Kaskas: except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have an uninterrupted reward.

7.Safi Kaskas: So, do you still deny this faith?

8.Safi Kaskas: Isn't God the most Just of Judges?

1.Safi Kaskas: Recite in the name of your Lord who created,

2.Safi Kaskas: created the human being from a clinging substance.

3.Safi Kaskas: Recite, and your Lord is the most generous,

4.Safi Kaskas: Who taught by the pen.

5.Safi Kaskas: He taught the human being that which he knew not.

6.Safi Kaskas: No! [But] indeed, the human being transgresses

7.Safi Kaskas: because he sees himself self-sufficient.

8.Safi Kaskas: Indeed, to your Lord is the return.

9.Safi Kaskas: Have you seen the one who forbids

10.Safi Kaskas: a servant from praying?

11.Safi Kaskas: Have you seen if he is on [the road of] guidance?

12.Safi Kaskas: Or enjoins righteousness?

13.Safi Kaskas: Have you seen if he rejects and turns away?

14.Safi Kaskas: Does he not know that God sees?

15.Safi Kaskas: No! If he doesn't stop, We will surely drag him by the forelock,

16.Safi Kaskas: a lying, sinning forelock.

17.Safi Kaskas: Then let him call his associates;

18.Safi Kaskas: We will call the angels of Hell.

19.Safi Kaskas: No! Do not obey him. But prostrate yourselves and draw near [to God].

1.Safi Kaskas: We sent this [Qur'an] down during the Night of Decree.

2.Safi Kaskas: But how would you know what is the Night of Decree?

3.Safi Kaskas: The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.

4.Safi Kaskas: During that Night, the angels and the Spirit descend by their Lord's authority for a variety of matters.

5.Safi Kaskas: There is peace that night until the coming of dawn.

98.SurahEnglishNames: The Clear Proof, Evidence, The Proof

1.Safi Kaskas: The unbelievers from among the people of the Book and the idolaters will continue to deny the truth until clear evidence is sent to them,

2.Safi Kaskas: a Messenger from God, reciting purified texts,

3.Safi Kaskas: containing valuable books.

4.Safi Kaskas: Those who were given the Scripture did not become divided until after they were given clear evidence.

5.Safi Kaskas: They were only asked to worship God alone, making their faith sincerely His, to keep up with prayer, and to pay the purifying alms, for that is the true religion.

6.Safi Kaskas: Those who reject the truth among the People of the Book and the idolaters, will suffer the Fire of Hell, to remain there eternally, forever. They are the worst of creatures,

7.Safi Kaskas: while those who believe and do good deeds are the best of creatures.

8.Safi Kaskas: Their reward is with their Lord: Gardens of Eden, graced with flowing streams, remaining in them timelessly, forever and ever. God is well pleased with them and they are pleased with Him.  All this is for whoever stands in awe of his Lord.

1.Safi Kaskas: When the Earth is shaken by its [last] earthquake

2.Safi Kaskas: and the Earth throws out its burdens

3.Safi Kaskas: and the human being says: 'What is wrong with it?'

4.Safi Kaskas: On that Day, it will impart its news

5.Safi Kaskas: because your Lord has inspired it.

6.Safi Kaskas: On that Day, people will come forward, separated from one another, to be shown their deeds.

7.Safi Kaskas: So, whoever has done an atom's weight of good deeds will see it

8.Safi Kaskas: and whoever has done an atom's weight of evil will see it.

100.SurahEnglishNames: The Courser, The Chargers, The Assulters

1.Safi Kaskas: [I swear] by the charging breathless warhorses,

2.Safi Kaskas: striking sparks with their hooves,

3.Safi Kaskas: raiding at early dawn,

4.Safi Kaskas: raising a cloud of dust

5.Safi Kaskas: and storming into the center collectively,

6.Safi Kaskas: the human being is ungrateful to his Lord,

7.Safi Kaskas: even though he is a witness to that.

8.Safi Kaskas: And he is fiercely in love with wealth.

9.Safi Kaskas: But does he not know that when what are in the graves are scattered

10.Safi Kaskas: and the hearts' contents are retrieved,

11.Safi Kaskas: on that Day, their Lord is fully knowledgeable?

101.SurahEnglishNames: The Calamity, The Stunning Blow, The Disaster, The Terrible Calamity

1.Safi Kaskas: The striking calamity:

2.Safi Kaskas: What is the striking calamity?

3.Safi Kaskas: And how would you know what is the striking calamity?

4.Safi Kaskas: It is the Day when the human beings will be like dispersed moths

5.Safi Kaskas: and the mountains will be like fluffed up wool

6.Safi Kaskas: and then, the one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds]

7.Safi Kaskas: will have a pleasant life,

8.Safi Kaskas: but the one whose scales are light,

9.Safi Kaskas: his refuge will be an abyss.

10.Safi Kaskas: And what will convey to you what that is?

11.Safi Kaskas: a Raging Fire

102.SurahEnglishNames: Rivalry in World Increase, Competition, Worldly Gain

1.Safi Kaskas: Your greed for more has distracted you

2.Safi Kaskas: until you go down to your graves.

3.Safi Kaskas: No, indeed you will soon know.

4.Safi Kaskas: Certainly you will soon know.

5.Safi Kaskas: Indeed, If you knew the knowledge of certainty

6.Safi Kaskas: you would  see Hell,

7.Safi Kaskas: then you would surely see it with the eye of certainty.

8.Safi Kaskas: And on that Day you will be asked about the pleasures you enjoyed.

103.SurahEnglishNames: The Declining Day, Eventide, The Epoch, Time

1.Safi Kaskas: I swear by the Late Afternoon,

2.Safi Kaskas: the human being is surely, in a state of loss.

3.Safi Kaskas: Except for those who have believed and done good deeds and urged one another to the Truth and urged one another to patience.

104.SurahEnglishNames: The Traducer, The Gossipmonger, The Slanderer

1.Safi Kaskas: Woe to every scorning backbiter

2.Safi Kaskas: who has amassed wealth and diversified it,

3.Safi Kaskas: thinking that his wealth will make him immortal.

4.Safi Kaskas: No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.

5.Safi Kaskas: And what will convey to you what is the Crusher?

6.Safi Kaskas: It is the kindled Fire of God

7.Safi Kaskas: reaching right into the hearts.

8.Safi Kaskas: it will engulf them

9.Safi Kaskas: in extended columns.

1.Safi Kaskas: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the army who had Elephants?

2.Safi Kaskas: Did He not utterly bring their perfect planning to nothing?

3.Safi Kaskas: And He sent birds in flocks against them

4.Safi Kaskas: striking them with stones of hard clay,

5.Safi Kaskas: He made them like eaten straw.

1.Safi Kaskas: So that Quraysh remains secure:

2.Safi Kaskas: They are secure in their Winter and Summer journeys.

3.Safi Kaskas: Let them worship the Lord of this House

4.Safi Kaskas: who has fed them after hunger, and made then safe after fear.

107.SurahEnglishNames: Small Kindnesses, Almsgiving, Have you Seen, The Daily Necessaries

1.Safi Kaskas: Have you seen the one who denies this faith?

2.Safi Kaskas: For that is the one who drives the orphan away

3.Safi Kaskas: and does not encourage the feeding of the poor.

4.Safi Kaskas: So woe to those who pray

5.Safi Kaskas: but, who do not pay attention to their prayer.

6.Safi Kaskas: Those who make a show [of their deeds]

7.Safi Kaskas: and withhold assistance to others.

1.Safi Kaskas: We have given you all that is good in abundance,

2.Safi Kaskas: so pray to your Lord and sacrifice for Him.

3.Safi Kaskas: Your enemy is the one who is cut off.

1.Safi Kaskas: Say: "You who deny the truth,

2.Safi Kaskas: I do not worship what you worship

3.Safi Kaskas: and you do not worship what I worship,

4.Safi Kaskas: and I will never worship what you worship.

5.Safi Kaskas: Neither will you worship what I worship.

6.Safi Kaskas: You have your own religion, and I have mine."

1.Safi Kaskas: When God's victory has come, together with His conquest

2.Safi Kaskas: and you see people embracing God's religion in multitudes,

3.Safi Kaskas: exult your Lord's glory, and praise Him, and ask for His forgiveness; for He is ever-accepting of repentance.

1.Safi Kaskas: Doomed are the hands of Abu Lahab, and he is doomed too.

2.Safi Kaskas: His wealth and all that he gained would not help him.

3.Safi Kaskas: He will burn in a fire strongly glowing

4.Safi Kaskas: and his wife as well, the carrier of firewood.

5.Safi Kaskas: Around her neck is a rope of palm fiber.

1.Safi Kaskas: Say: "He is God who is Uniquely Singular,

2.Safi Kaskas: Who is Eternal, [the uncaused cause of all that exists]

3.Safi Kaskas: Who has not given birth nor is He born

4.Safi Kaskas: and there is no equivalent to Him."

1.Safi Kaskas: Say: "I seek refuge with the lord of the Daybreak

2.Safi Kaskas: from the evil in that which He has created,

3.Safi Kaskas: and from the evil of the darkness when it settles

4.Safi Kaskas: and from women who blow on knots

5.Safi Kaskas: and from the evil of the envious when he envies."

1.Safi Kaskas: Say: "I seek refuge with the Lord of people,

2.Safi Kaskas: The King of people

3.Safi Kaskas: The God of people.

4.Safi Kaskas: From the evil of the insidious whisperer

5.Safi Kaskas: who whispers [evil] into the hearts of people

6.Safi Kaskas: from among the jinn or people.
